name: Stephanie Taylor
text: I have a long history of back surgery since I was young.  I started going to Dr. Reto for those issues about 7 years ago and he has always been knowledgeable, patient, uses surgery as a last resort instead of first and always advocates for my best interests instead of an agenda of his own.  Great personality, takes time to explain things, patient with explanations and never tries to hurry through an appointment.  He has performed 3 surgeries on my back and I've always had immediate relief from pain, no complications after surgery, thorough and immediate response to any questions or concerns after surgery and is just an awesome doctor.  His team is also top notch.  They are all kind, patient and prompt.  I've never been left waiting for an endless time and am usually in and out of the appointment within 45 minutes to an hour total.  I recommend his services to anyone that I know or meet who has a need in this area.

resp.text: So glad you’ve been satisfied with your care. We’re always here to help and support patients through their difficulties.

name: reedera4
text: My workers compensation made this appointment for me.  I was advised by a radiologist at my hospital that I had a t4 fracture. Dr Retro tried to tell me that he only saw arthritis in my spine. The problem is number one, I never had any back pain until I had my accident at work; number two, I find it very hard to believe that a radiologist, whose education dealt specifically in reading x-rays, CT scans, and MRIS would read an x-ray that badly. I am still in tremendous pain. I don't think Dr Retro knows what he's talking about. I have been on medication for arthritis for years and it doesn't touch my back pain.  Because of my workers comp I have to go back to see him one last time. But if they want to pay that bill oh well.

name: Cindy O'brien
text:
I would not recommend her at all.  I received a shoulder injury this summer and was referred by Grandview ER to Dr. Moul.  I went to her office on a Monday and saw Dr. Sudduth who was so kind but felt that I needed to come back the next day and see Dr. Moul to talk about surgery.  I went back the next day and she looked at my X-rays, came in the examination room, and never examined  me.  She told me to take the sling off and go to physical therapy for three weeks which I did.  The therapists questioned why an MRI was never done and felt my injury was more severe than she thought and so did I.  When I returned 3 weeks later for my follow up she told me to stop therapy and gave me a steroid pack.  I told her how bad it was still hurting.  Still no MRI so I went to my regular doctor who sent me for an MRI.  I have a torn labrum and have an appointment with Dr. Andrews surgical group tomorrow.

I had my surgery with Andrews  on 11/20/20 and had a labrum tear repair,  rotator cuff repair, and debris cleanup in my joint.  I am looking at a long recovery now which could have been avoided and already done with a simple MRI four months ago to see what was really going on inside my shoulder.  I am very frustrated because I spent  probably $700-800 dollars in unnecessary PT fees and copays which only made my issues worse.  Since surgery I have started PT but am fixing to experience a break in services because I have used my allotted physical therapy services for the year by being sent needlessly to therapy for a month by Dr. Moul instead of her taking the time to do an MRI to see what would have been obvious.  I am beyond frustrated with the situation above and will be looking into possible courses of action to recover expenses that could have been avoided if she had used reasonable medical judgement.

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 205-971-3348 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

text: 1st time visit being referred to seeing Dr. Revels . He’s staff showed a lot of care and helpfulness for me and even listened to comments from my wife about her concerns with me . When Dr. Revels came in he asked a lot of concerning questions and had already looked at my X-rays (that I had brought with me) before coming into the room . Pulled them on the screen and pointed out to me and my wife what was the problem areas and he need 1 more thing an MRI that hadn’t been done yet and his staff called and had me on the list 3 days later to get an MRI done . A big added plus was he used a few big words but but he explained anything he expressed concerns about at sweating blue collar level . I thank him and his staff for that .

name: Thomas Spradlin
text:
The care and compassion I received from Dr. Revels and his staff was no less than beyond excellent. I would give them six stars if that were an option.    Everyone took the time to answer all questions and explain in detail if needed all procedures and aspects of my care both prior to and post surgery as well as during my  and follow up care.
At the request of family I had gone to a second MD for a second opinion  before such a serious , and potentially dangerous  to my life and at the least my quality of life procedure.
Although I know the second Dr was an excellent surgeon I was treated as my health was just to be blindly trusted to him and he seemed offended that I asked questions.   He was in a hurry and didn't really have time to discuss anything with me, or give me details about his procedural plans.  (In his defense his partner was out of town and he was having to handle the full load of their practice and they had squeezed me in due to the severity of my injury.)
The outcome may have been the same between the two but there was a night and day difference in the way " I " was treated.
I firmly believe that if it were not for Dr. Revels and the care I received from he and his staff that I would have soon been paralyzed or worse. As is I have made a better than expected, almost complete recovery.

name: Kelsey Chambers
text:
I hardly ever leave reviews, but if this helps even one person avoid going through what I did it's worth it.

I was reffered to Dr. Revels a couple of months ago by my PCP.  I was able to get an appointment with him rather quickly, which I was grateful for. Once seen by him I told him that I've been dealing with intense pain that felt like someone put a hot knife in my mid back since October. I've tried everything I could think of to help it out, I already take a daily NSAID, I'd seen a chiropractor (he took xrays and showed me that I had bone spurs and what looked like some degenerative discs) that no matter what I was only getting minimal relief from, I've started doing soft yoga, I've used large ice packs, a heating pad, I'm on an anti-inflammatory diet, and over the past year I've lost nearly 100lbs. I brought a copy of xrays of my thorasic and lumbar spine for him to see. His nurse took the CDs to have them imported to their software. After a few minutes he came in, introduced himself, and talked with me. He told me that there wasn't anything he saw that was a cause for concern, that he's a back surgeon and didn't forsee me needing back surgery or an epidural, I'm doing everything right, and that I'd be okay after some more time. That was it, no additional imaging, no PT orders, no real suggestion, nothing. His nurse then brought back the CDs, and on the thorasic spine disc there was a note that said "Unable to import" which leaves me to speculate that he wasn't even able to look at it. Of course I left feeling fairly defeated over the encounter.

After a couple of weeks I decided to get a second opinion, PT orders were given, an MRI was ordered, and turns out I have 1 fairly large bone spur growing anteriorly, a couple of smaller ones, and 2 bulging discs in my thorasic spine putting pressure on my spinal cord. I'm being referred to a pain management doctor for epidurals.

I will say, Dr. Revels was very nice, he never seemed blatantly rude or impatient. I understand there are people out there who have altered intentions, and I know a 24 year old wouldn't be assumed to have the problems I'm having, however that doesn't mean patients should be dismissed so easily.

name: Leigh Brown
text: It's very frustrating when you have an appointment and don't get to see the doctor for 3-4 hours later! No exaggeration. And when you bring it to the staff's attention, everybody wants to pay the blame game but no one wants to take responsibility and apologize and help to correct the problem. This is an ongoing issue. I had an appointment two days ago and because of a slip up with my doctor's office my referral was not sent over. This was corrected within 15 minutes (the mandatory time for it to be corrected) yet still, I was in the waiting room an hour and a half before being seen. I was in the back another hour and a half before seeing the doctor. I explained this to Dr. Crotwell, and that I make my appointments early in the morning because I work at night, and I was tired and should have been out of the office. Instead of apologizing for the inconvenience, he did what he always does, bece argumentive and lied to make it seem like the error was mine, saying it took an hour to get the referral (an office manager debunked that lie, proving that it only took 15 minutes after I was called up, and theanager was outraged because I had been there 30 minutes before I was called up!) Then he wants to rush and hurt out of the office, doesn't sit still long enough to hear out your concerns, and treats you as if you are pill seeking because you ask for some kind of help with pain management! After years of this, it's to the point where I'm ready to start looking for another physician because I have voices my concerns and I don't want to be treated even more unfairly because I have. They talk extremely loud, and the walls are thin. I can hear him talking about other patients health when he's in another room, just like I could hear the nurse supervisor make a comment about me in the hallway.

name: Chris Lewis
text:
Starting at the front door the guard was nice and courteous offering assistance in whatever you need. Then on to the receptionist that's so nice and courteous and getting you checked in.
And now on to Dr. Crotwells team, being very professional and preparing you to see the doctor. And finally dr. Crotwell one of the most amazing doctors I have ever encountering because I've never had a leg break before but him knowing my injury told me how he would fix it and everything seems to be working so good. Thank you doctor crotwell.

name: Bryant Jones
text: Great doctor, however I think that he needs to spend more time with his patients.

name: Harry Lewis
text: Dr Crotwell maybe a little ' to the point' but he knows his stuff. That's why I use him.!!

name: Nelda Covey
text: I was a patient of Dr. Crotwell in or about 1977. I had a crushed ankle on on one leg and a broken heel bone on the other. After several surgeries and skin grafts I came out of the incidents perfectly well. Dr Crotwell saved my life physically and emotionally. I say that because for a year I was in a wheelchair and for a 25 year old with three small children I needed not only medical help but also mental encouragement and he did just that. He is an awesome Dr. I wanted to share this story because I never did say a real thank you to him. So Thank You Dr. Crotwell!!!!!  ❤️

name: harold lyda
text: Our family has been using for years. Surgeries performed have produced good results.

name: Michelle Mendoza
text: He was knowledgeable and made sure I understood my options well.

name: Bennie Ashby
text: Great Physicians, the only problem is they sometime run behind due to workload and they do not let their patients know this when they are running behind. If they would do that it would at least show the patients that they realize you may have other things to do that day that cannot be changed and they could reschedule their appointment.

name: Spergis Brown
text: I can tell that  he is a veteran of his skills. Very detailed.

name: Kim Middleton
text: My family has been treated by Dr Crotwell for years. He is great Dr and a nice person. He cares about his patients and their treatment.

name: Keith Stanley
text: Dr. Crotwell is a very kind and caring individual, at the same time that he had his hip replaced I had an issue with my knee. Never did his condition effect my care. His staff is above board kudos, satisfied patient.

name: Katrina Smith
text: Dr. Crotwell is very thorough and has great bed side manners.

name: Sae Sadie Sarah
text:
I have been a patient of Dr. William A. Crotwell III for forty years. From neck to ankle he has repaired me multiple times.
His concern for his patients is a cut above. I proudly share my scars with people nervous about going to an orthopaedic and always recommend Dr. Bill. Do you research, make your choice, but never settle...use Dr. Crotwell. If he can't repair you, he will get you to the doctor that can. Smile

name: Anita Freeman
text: Great Doctor, the office staff not so great,  the office is over loaded with appointments, also didn't like the physical therapy either.  I would go somewhere else if ever needed again.  Crotwell is a great doctor but other experience not good at all.

name: David Pugh
text: Dr.Crotwell is the best is a very good doctor and he knows his stuff.

name: Tucker Trucker Patriot
text: I had a work injury and have had constant pain and problems with my wrist to the point where I was losing control of my hand.  A quack doctor in Baldwin county took xrays and even an MRI (that was fuzzy looking even to me & I'm not a medical person) and kept telling me nothing was wrong with me.  After a year & a half I demanded to see another doctor and was sent to Dr. Crotwell.  With one MRI (that was actually clear to me) he showed me what the problem was and took the time to explain everything to me as well as what needed to be done to fix the problem.  I had the surgery and physical therapy at AOC.  Both Dr. Crotwell and their physical therapy department are excellent. I am more extremely happy that Dr Crotwell is my physician.  He has helped me immensely from when I first started seeing him and continues to help me with issues that were caused by not getting excellent medical care from the beginning of  my injury.  Thank you so much Dr. Crotwell!  As far as his assistants that work with him, they have been excellent as well.  Thank you all!

name: Jack Hill
text: No time to inform his patients,waited 2 days to be told nothing about my wife's hip that was broke 5 minute visited in 2 days,very upset was given no information.discharged my wife with broken hip in spring Hill hospital.nurses and hospital staff top notch, Dr Cromwell can learn something from the staff at the hospital .no time for patients it's a shame he don't take time to communicate  with patients and family.

name: Nikki Leland-Battiste
text: Dr. Crotwell is a very good doctor.

name: Sandra Cody
text: Dr Crotwell and his staff have always been great!

name: Gregory Clark
text: Patient, always listen and anwer any questions I may have

name: Adam Senn
text: Dr. Crotwell is very thorough and all business. I like this ,but it could come off as rude to some.

name: Winfred July
text: It is always a good experience when a professional who is always professional

name: Jm Thomas
text: Awful experience. Rude rude rude

name: Betty Douglas
text: Nice

name: Gwen Wade
text: Love my doctor!!

name: Gwen Dixon
text: Excellent

name: Todd Addison
text: Did not correct my issue and was very stubborn about listening to what I was saying about it.  After his first surgery I still had same pain in my left hand.  I explained that I felt it was Golf related. I felt I had a broken hamate bone.. he was adamant about blowing me off.  After being released from him, I went to Andrew’s Orthopedic and they confirmed exactly what I thought.  My “Hook of the Hamate” was fractured. Now I’m having surgery to fix what was my issue. What a complete waste of my time he was!

name: Aaron Southern
text: I was referred to Dr. Bonatz for carpal tunnel syndrome. His staff was fantastic. They were able to get me an appointment right away. Dr. Bonatz took his time to make sure every question I had was answered. Their surgery coordinator was able to work me into their surgery schedule within the following week. After the surgery, I was back to work within 3 days, typing on a keyboard all day. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. I am currently scheduling my surgery with my other hand. Definitely check them out!

resp.text: Wow, we appreciate the high praise, Aaron! We're thankful you chose us to be a part of your recovery journey, and we'll be sure to pass along your kind words to everyone involved.

name: Jason Hall
text: I was referred to Dr. Bonatz by my orthopedic surgeon. She had told me that he was one of the best hand surgeons around. I will say that received great care and the surgery went well. Very pleased with the overall experience. He is the best.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Mr. Hall! We're thrilled that you had a great experience with our clinic.

name: Jared Dailey
text: Dr. Bonantz is rude, does not listen, and does not deal with the correct problems.  I went to him with a hand problem and he informed me I am an overweight diabetic,  which I already knew.  He sent his nurse in with papers for bariatric surgery across the hall.  I have a cyst in my hand I need removed.   I'm well aware of my weight problems.   I have to buy my clothes.  No thank you, you rude, self righteous know it all.  He also told me I would die without the covid vaccine,  and he's told multiple other people this.  I would not recommend this "doctor" to anyone. for anytbing

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention, Jared. We at Southlake Orthopaedics hold ourselves to the highest possible standards of patient care, so we are terribly sorry to hear about this experience. Please reach out to me at (205) 985-4111 or email me at mjones@slortho.com so we can better understand the problem and better serve our patients in the future.

name: Kimberli Calma
text: Dr. Bonatz and his staff are amazing! He is brilliant and he has surrounded himself with an amazing knowledgeable and caring team.  Their attentiveness and follow up is amazing and this comes from a patient with an emergency on a Friday that continued over the weekend into the following week.  They did not miss a beat ensuring I have a healthy full functioning hand.  Thank you Thank you!

name: candy j
text: Dr. Bonatz has to be one of the worst doctors I’ve ever seen. My first visit with him was Nov 6 fracture ring finger sprained middle finger. He had me to start Occupational Therapy immediately. My return visit with Dec 8. My range of motion had improved however the strengthening had not even begun. All of my OT were saying the same thing my hand needed further OT because of my job. On Dec 8 2020 Dr. Bonazt entered the room and began talking with the door of the room wide open. I asked if he could close the door while we discussed my injury. His response no because of COVID-19 a violation of my patients rights mind you Dr. Bonazt was not wearing a mask nor gloves so much for concerns. Also, while waiting on him the door was closed the entire time and anyone else that entered closed the door behind them. He ask me what my job title was twice which I’m sure was on my report. He indicated that the fracture was healing pretty good I didn’t need surgery and therefore there was nothing else he could do. I question him because I must be 100% my strength in my hand indicated that I could hold up to13lbs briefly. I asked him for copies of the report he denied me of that also, stating that workman’s comp would have to request it. Forgetting when I visit him the first time he did.  His sarcastic remarks and tone was very belittling. To add insult to injury as he was walking out he says if you break anything else come see me. Unbelievable and Rude he obviously doesn’t care because there’s no repercussions behind his actions.

name: Kaye Byrd
text: Dr. Bonanza and assistants were pleasant, explained procedures, and answered my questions fully.

name: Jane Carson
text: Office staff was very friendly and helpful . Dr Bonatz was on spot and Office was quick to setup the additional testing to verify my issues so that Dr Bonatz could resolve them. I learned about him from a friend w similar probs and she had excellent results. From everything so far,  I’m sure I will have the same excellent results.

name: Marilyn Seier
text: Excellent surgeon and has operated on both wrists and more recently my right hand. He thoroughly explains the diagnosis and the course of action to repair the problem. In case of an emergency like with my hand he saw me right away and planned surgery two days later. My Southlake physical therapist, Cathy, helped me rehab after all 3 surgeries and she is fantastic

name: Bobby Smith
text: Friendly, helpful,great staff, treat you like family.

name: Crystal Watford
text: Dr. Bonatz is professional, personable, and also quick, which I appreciate. He makes sure I understand what he has explained before leaving the room. He's done one surgery on my hand and is about to do another. I have no hesitations.

name: Ruth Black
text: He’s a sadistic man. Don’t go to him!  He hurts you & he allows you to be in excruciating pain after surgery. There are GREAT hand surgeons in Birmingham who have MANNERS and do not enjoy seeing their patients in pain.  One is Dr. Smith. He’s in the same office.

name: Beverly Kirkpatrick
text: Everyone was very friendly & professional. Dr. Bonatz was very thorough & explained everything concerning treatment for my problem. I would definitely recommend to others.

name: Candis Threatt
text: Dr. Bonatz is so straightforward but also very thorough. My son had a broken thumb that most times would require surgery, Dr. Bonatz simply had my son put in a cast and said, "Three weeks!" In exactly three weeks his thumb healed properly and he's back doing what he loves... Playing BASKETBALL! The supporting staff(front desk, nurses, pct, etc) were phenomenal!

name: Staci Rowell
text: Dr Bonatz is brilliant!  He is precise, professional and courteous. Would definitely recommend him to anyone needing hand/wrist treatment.

name: Madelyn Bauman
text: Very pleased with my association with this clinic and Dr. Bonatz. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful, especially the front desk. Dr. Bonatz is warm, kind and careful, double checking the info received from xrays, etc. Should you be in need of this type medical assistance, I highly recommend this clinic.

name: Efagan53
text: In and out quick, all questions answered in a professional manner

name: William Green
text: The doctor has a sense of humor and a strong personality. He has a plethora of knowledge. I like that. I’d trust him with my children any time!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal at Southlake Orthopaedics is to provide excellent patient care.

name: Jim Cook
text: I don't have the knowledge to evaluate my visit based on the medical expertise of the people I saw, but I can talk about the efficiency of the office personnel, the personal respect from everyone I saw (both for patients and for each other), and the overall positive atmosphere there. Top notch. Dr. Bonatz took a lot of time to examine my inury, and he followed up by taking me out of the examination room to show me details of my x-rays and diagrams of the injury. That was something I liked very much.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal is to provide excellent service to all our patients.

name: Laine Poole
text: Absolutely the best possible care for any medical problems related to the hand and wrist.

resp.text: Thank you for the the review.

name: m mills
text:
First I can not say enough good things about the staff, they were extremely nice and compassionate. But Dr Ekkhard Bonatz is not, he has zero ethics. He told me he would preform surgery on my broken wrist but and I quote "it would not work anyway", DO NOT LET THIS MAN TREAT YOU!
I ask if I could see my break on an x-ray and he brought in a plastic arm, he patted my arm and thanked me because he could pay off his daughters college tuition with my injury. He acted like a pediatrician talking to a child. He refused pain treatment and said he would drink if it were him, again DO NOT LET THIS MAN TREAT YOU!

name: Dale Dixon
text: I was very nervous at first, in past others gave me no hope. Dr.Bonatz gave me the hope I have been looking for. Very kind and attentive. I feel 100% positive now. All staff made it a pleasurable visit. Thank you Dr.Bonatz

name: Catherine “Best Friend” Marie
text: I would not send my worst enemy to this man. He lied about the procedure,  he lied about the treatment and was upset and told us that if we were to seek a second opinion he would no longer treat. He gave wrong meds when he had pathology report right in front of him . Not a compassionate person and neither is his assistant. Would NOT recommend.

name: Bo Canning
text:
Dr. Bonatz and staff are the most knowledgeable, caring team in Alabama. Dr. Bonatz took the time to answer all my questions during the process of rebuilding my hand. I never felt rushed by him.
His staff were the same way, taking time to discuss the questions you forgot to ask Dr. Bonatz. They are very knowledgeable and very caring.
His P.T. staff are the  and same way, they know their stuff, and are always encouraging you to do your exercises at home.  If you do what they say, you will improve your hand. (They are the best)
Lastly, the front desk and waiting room, in a word, excellent.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal is to provide excellent patient care!

name: Chris Davis
text: Hands down one of the best doctors visits ever! Dr. Bonatz put me at ease with his knowledge, straight forward approached with a great dose of humor. His staff was friendly, quick and efficient and I feel like I received the best healthcare. I highly recommend Dr. Bonatz at Southlake Orthopedics

name: Kimberly Snelling
text: Dr Bonatz is least compassionate Dr I have ever had the misfortune to meet! He has no ethics whatsoever. He told my husband he would do surgery on his hand but it probably wouldn't work. He mentioned he needed the money for his daughter s college. He also said he would do the second surgery, he mentioned he wanted to go Spain. He also thanked my husband for fracturing his wrist. If you have hurt yourself and need treatment I wouldn't not recommend Dr. Bonatz. I would not take my dog to him. The staff however were very helpful and compassionate.

resp.text: At Southlake Orthopaedics we certainly sympathize with our patients and the pain they have due to injuries or other conditions.  Very sorry you found your recent visit to be unsatisfactory to the standard you expected.  We are happy to coordinate a second opinion with one of our other Board Certified physicians if you so choose.  Our goal is to improve any conditions we can.

name: DEBRA SMITH
text: Dr. Bonatz and staff gave me excellent care before and after surgery. I couldn't have ask for better treatment.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Juandelisha Perry
text: I am so greatful to have met Dr. Bonatz and the staff of Southland  orthopedic. For over 10+ years of  chronic pain I spent years searching for help and  consulting with my primay physican, rheumatologist,  neurologist, osteoarthritis, pain management, and any other specialist.   Unfortunately, they all gave up on me and past me on to the next specialist. Finally, I was referred to, I was Dr. Bonatz.  The frist cosultation, he knew what was wrong, schedule some tests and did not give up on me until he solved the problem.  For the first time in years, I can sleep at night with out pain, go outside during the winter with out pain. Thank you so much!!!

name: C Miller
text: I am due to have surgery with Dr. Bonatz  in the next couple of weeks. So I cannot speak of that experience yet. I can however speak of his Staff which has been wonderful, and informative, as has Dr. Bonatz. I would have given 5 stars except for the fact both times I have been to see him, once at Grandview, the other at the Southlake office, both times I had to wait 20 to 30 minutes past my appointment time. I realize they get busy, however  my time is important as well   My suggestion would be to find a way to improve upon that.  It’s a shame to have an appointment time of 1:15pm and not leave until 3:00.

name: Kassie Luster
text: We had a really good experience with Dr Bonatz. We were very pleased with the care we recieved. My 10 yr old broke her pinky finger and it went into her growth plate. He was very good with her and making the right decision for her care. She was in a custom splint made for just her size for 3 weeks. We went back and he was so nice. Said she was healing nicely. She really liked him alot and would recommend anyone else with smaller children to see him. Staff was really awesome as well. We had not longer than a five min wait time each time we went.

name: Ronald Barksdale
text: Awesome

resp.text: Thanks for the review.

name: Barbra Garver
text: Dr. Su is the best surgeon you could ask for!  Very understanding, compassionate, and will "listen" to your concerns.  He is a patient advocate with the goal of have complete healing before releasing you post-op.

name: Janet Guevara
text: I absolutely love Dr. Su! He fixed my wrist after I broke it in 6 places. His PA Maria is amazing too! Best Surgeon!

name: Don Laney
text:
I walked in and told them what I was there for and the receptionist waved me over to one side and said they'd be with me shortly.
An hour later I walked to the back and asked s nurse why my name hadn't been called. She said they had no record that I was there.
She took me straight back. 10 minutes later I was done. The doctor and nurses were fine. But the front desk needs to get their act together.

name: Debbie Worland
text: I attended my two-week post-op appointment today with Dr. Su following arthroscopic hip labrum repair. He showed me photographs taken within the surgery site, both before and after repair, and described each step thoroughly. He patiently listened to all of my questions and took the time to fully answer each of them. He even explained his philosophy and reasoning regarding certain treatments and methods as opposed to those used by other surgeons. Dr. Su took the time to make sure I was educated and informed about my current status and also what I might expect in the future, and I appreciated that very much. I highly recommend Dr. Su and his team!

name: Kimberly Fellows Gaines
text: Dr. Su is timely, knowledgeable, and doesn't mind learning new things.  I wish all doctors were like him.

name: James McKinley
text: New patient appointment went smooth with all current and possible future procedures explained clearly.

name: Sheilah Bentley
text: Very pleased with my appointments here. Friendly staff and excellent care!!

name: Melinda Washington
text: It's very nice the nurses are very polite and caring and the doctors are caring as well I'm glad I got the opportunity to be one of the patients thank you TOC team. Happy New Year.

name: Sandra Edwards
text: I hurt my knee at work. Had to have surgery. I highly recommend TOC. Very  friendly staff.

name: Roger Graves
text: Dr. Su was very knowledgeable, thorough, and professional.

name: D Wilbourn
text: Dr Su and staff are very knowledgeable with patience, I’m almost 4 months out from my total hip replacement surgery and each office visit or phone call I’m always treated with respect any questions I have are always answered with patience. Dr Su is the best.

name: Shirley Ryan
text: Dr. Madanag takes his time with you, he listens to you and makes sure you understands what he tells you. He is great at doing the best treatment for you. He doesn't go for surgery unless it is totally necessary.

name: d navarre
text: Dr. Sue was straight forward and down to every detail.  I was very comfortable talking to Dr. Sue even on my first visit. Thank you for your professional advise and options. Give doctor a thumbs up. This is what i look for in a doctor.

name: Andrew Marlow
text: One of the best doctors I have ever had.

name: Peggy Jackson
text: I have the best Doctor at TOC.  He listens to me and talks to me, and takes care to insure that my pain is relieved.  He also explains what is happening to my knee and explains why he is recommending certain treatment.

name: Vicki Whisenand
text: Dr. Su did hip arthroscopy on me. He is professional and explains everything you need to know. Answers any questions you have. Post surgery he reviewed what he did and what to expect with continued recovery.

name: kriss bobo
text: Dr Su was very professional and explained everything so well that when he asked me if I had any questions I thought wow he even answered questions I wouldn’t of thought of till later. Very good experience

name: Keith A. Reed
text: Dr. Su is awesome! He will not operate on you unless it is necessary. He believes in doing everything he and make the last alternative. Very professional and kind.

name: Dan
text: "Dr. Su" is a extremely thorough.  When he identifies a problem, he explains it thoroughly,quite and gives a list of treatment options.  He explains the issue using the imaging, and shows the patient what he is talking about.  When presenting options, he explains the benefits of each, and let's you know what his recommended course of action is and why.  He is extremely thorough, and I have nothing but positive experiences.

name: Judy Wallace
text: Dr. Su completely understood the problem I was having and took immediate steps to help.  He listened to my comments and, after the injection, asked me to show him what I couldn't do before the injection.  He made notes, recommended therapy and set up the follow-up appointment.  Great staff, great doctor.  And, no wait time.

name: james jordan
text:
November 11, 2005 I was in a car accident that was life changing.  Dr. Sue Not only saved my right leg, he helped save my life when I bled out on the table and died for over a minute.  He put me back together and  although I will never be 100 percent I will always owe my life to his expertise and steady hands .  I will forever be grateful.
Very Very sad to see him leave the Mobile, Al area as a trauma surgeon/orthopedic surgeon.

name: Bob Wrinkle
text: Has all the traits you want in your surgeon.  Informative, timely with appointments, answers your questions in detail and explanations you understand, and does not make you feel he has to rush out to the next patient. It is hard to get through to the office on the phone but message do get deliver and call backs happen.

name: Dan O'Meara
text: Dr. Su has brought me great relief from an issue with my right SI joint. He fused the joint on September 30th, 2019, and after 8 months of therapy and a series of well planned exercises , I am free of pain and can resume my normal daily routine. i am so very pleased with Dr. Su who was very upfront about the surgery and the extensive re-hab that would be necessary to accomplish both his and my goals. I would wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Su to anyone that has an orthopedic issue. 7/16/2020

name: Donna Lundstrom
text: Dr. Su is very good.  He will listen to any concerns and explain what is going on.  He also makes sure you get all your questions answered and doesn’t make you feel rushed.  He works with a great team, including Daniel Root.

name: Michael OHearn
text: Very knowledgeable, professional and willing to answer questions.  Conservative approach gave me a lot of confidence that he is genuinely concerned for his patients' welfare.

name: Anita Shaw
text: Always polite, concerned and actually listen.  Wouldn't use any other Dr. In this profession

name: Buffy Acklin
text: I need surgery and I've been postponed twice. It got to the point that I had to stop working. Dr Su knows how bad things are and is gonna make things happen for me.

name: DONALD R BANKHEAD JR
text: Dr Sudhakar seemed very genuine and concerned about my issue and was easy to talk to and I would recommend him to anyone.

name: Wynona Gibson
text: Everything was alright.  I needed directions on how to get to the check out desk. Also seemed to be some confusion about what I was there for.  I had an appointment to get two cortisone shots in my left arm  I had one and hope it helps as the arm is very painful.  Then I was told to go to the check out desk for another appointment and I had no iidea where it was. I followed exit signs and found myself in the lobby again. I went to the main desk and she  told me where it was.  hanks

name: Douglas McVey
text: Dr. Su impresses me as a very knowledgable and professional orthopedist. This was my 2nd visit with him so now I wait to see results of his ordered test.

name: Michael OHearn
text: Very knowledgeable, professional and willing to answer questions.  Conservative approach gave me a lot of confidence that he is genuinely concerned for his patients' welfare.

text:
Dr.Sudhaker is a great Dr.
He tried one way of getting relief on my hip and now we are gonna do hip replacement..He listens well and address your concerns

name: Rocky Foster
text: This doctor really knows his craft. He'll explain the process fully to you and provide any guidance that pertains to your affliction. If need be, I'd use him again in the future.

name: Andrew Marlow
text: One of the best doctors I have ever had.

name: DONALD R BANKHEAD JR
text: Dr Sudhakar seemed very genuine and concerned about my issue and was easy to talk to and I would recommend him to anyone.

text: Always polite, concerned and actually listen.  Wouldn't use any other Dr. In this profession

name: wanda Rhodes
text: I am healing very well Dr.Su did surgery on my badly broken leg. And I like his seriousness.

name: Jimmy Dixon
text: THE DOCTOR WAS SUPER NICE AND THE NURSES WERE ALSO  MY APPOINTMENT WAS ON TIME AND THAT WAS VERY NICE.  LOOKING FORWARD TO HAVING THE SURGERY DONE

name: Rocky Foster
text: This doctor really knows his craft. He'll explain the process fully to you and provide any guidance that pertains to your affliction. If need be, I'd use him again in the future.

name: Pam Foley
text: Had a total hip replacement about a month ago!  It was a total breeze!  I recovered almost totally in 2 weeks w absolutely NO HIP pain!  Also had a knee replacement 5 yrs ago by another surgeon & took a very long time to recover!  And I had a lot of pain!  However I heard a hip replacement easier than knee!  Soooo true!  I need another knee replacement and have total confidence in DR SU!  I’ve seen orthopedic surgeons in CA, AZ & VA!  Dr Su beats them all!  If you are hesitating about a hip replacement event CONSIDER DR SU!!!  He’s the best!!! Thank you Dr Su & God Bless you!!!  Btw this is Pam Foley!!!

name: David Harrison
text: Great orthopedic surgeon.

name: Jody Scott
text: Was a great doctor when I was under his care.

name: wanda Rhodes
text: I am healing very well Dr.Su did surgery on my badly broken leg. And I like his seriousness.

name: deborah buskirk
text:
Dr operated on my hip and my knee
Thank you

name: Nick Harcrow
text: Great  placeandpeople

name: Alexandra Holt
text:
Starting off.... the waiting sucks..... next off... how the neck do you pronounce his name
...???? And he forgot all about my sister.....

name: Melanie Morris
text: Absolutely best surgeon I’ve been too. I have rheumatoid arthritis and have had 25 surgeries at 40 years old. So I’ve seen my share of surgeons. By far the best I’ve seen. Very kind and understanding patient  with you. You don’t find that a lot these days. I highly recommend him.

resp.text: Thanks so much, for your review! We are grateful to be in service of our communities with compassionate care. -Ascension St. Vincents Community Manager

name: Mark Jones
text: Very timely process . Appointment was on time . All providers were very friendly and Dr Werthon was very thorough and explained everything well

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. We will pass it along to our leadership team. Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincents Community Manager

name: Honora Gathings
text: Dr Worthen is extremely intelligent and very personable.  He listens to his patients concerns and adequately addresses them.  Had a knee replacement on May 11, 2021,  walked and went up a flight of steps 2 hrs. after surgery.  Wonderful results.  I would highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for this great review, and have a fantastic day! -Ascension St. Vincents Community Manager

name: James Mayfield
text: Great Doctor very professional knows what he is doing. My follow up visit today was though and fast given all the information that I needed or requested. If you need a should done Doctor Wittgenstein is in my opinion the very best.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us this positive review! Have a great day! -Ascension St. Vincents Community Manager

name: William Tynes
text: Great experience! Dr. Worthen was on time, thorough, and took a lot of time to explain his diagnosis. You will not find a doctor with a better bedside manner. Excellent staff and X-ray tech as well. Parking and access to his building are very easy.

resp.text: Hello, your feedback is important to us, and we appreciate you taking the time to share it. Thank you! -Ascension St. Vincents Community Manager

name: chrismarie1973
text: Prompt and professional! Five stars for the front desk, nurse, radiology, PA and doc. Hope that a future in-patient experience will be the same.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincents Community Manager

name: Peggy Rhodes
text: My husband and I consider Dr. Jamie Worthen to be the BEST orthopedic surgeon serving the greater Birmingham area.Both he and his staff are personable, knowledgeable and highly skilled.  If either of us has a knee or shoulder problem, Dr. Worthen is our first and only call.

text: He's a great Dr. The follow up at the Prattville locations is extremely open and has no privacy.  It's more like rounds in an emergency room when done by a treatment team. resp.text:
Ms. Ross –

Thank you for your review and bringing these concerns to our attention. As you identified, Lemak Health strives to provide a wonderful patient experience with superior outcomes, and it sounds as though most of your experience was that way.

Would you mind contacting our office manager, Melanie Goggins directly to further unpack some of your comments? (334) 310-1117.  We welcome the opportunity to understand the needs and concerns of our patients, and also share and gain knowledge of expectations. We sincerely appreciate your trust in our practice, and especially with Dr. James. We look forward to continuing to serve you and improving in every way we can with your feedback.

name: Rachel Davis
text: I have experienced a lot of pain and headaches with this place. I had some unexpected swelling in my right knee Dr. James ordered an MRI to be done which was $325 for self pay and after MRI they told me it will be additional $100 next week for him to talk to me about my results. I'm sorry but that is way too high for a self pay person. I'm not happy with this and if I need surgery I'm unsure if I'm going to have them do the surgery or go somewhere else. They should treat self pay people with a little more respect.  My advice is not to go this place if you are self pay find somewhere that treats people better.

resp.text:
Ms./Mrs. Davis,
Lemak Health of Prattville respects and values every patient that trusts us for orthopedic care. According to cms.gov, we feel we have a fair fee schedule for self-pay patients. Our office manager, Melanie Goggins, is happy to discuss with you the self-pay fees for a patient visit.  She can also provide you with resource information for insurance open enrollment and our alternative payment options via Care Credit. The self-pay costs for an MRI are set by Sonos Imaging rather than Lemak Health. Our physicians refer to them for their exceptional patient care and affordable services. Here is a helpful tool for price comparison for our services, and to help you anticipate future self-pay patient responsibility prior to your next appointment. https://www.healthcarebluebook.com/page_ProcedureDetails.aspx?cftId=292&g=Knee+MRI+(no+contrast)

name: Wade Goggins

resp.text:
Kelly,
Dr. James and all of our staff at Lemak Health of Prattville are committed to providing exceptional care for all of our patients. Each and every patient's complete health is our main focus. Thank you for sharing your experience and leaving a review and recommendation. Most importantly, thank you for trusting Dr. James and Lemak Health for your orthopedic care.

MY WIFE THEN PAID BY CREDIT CARD. SHE CONTACT LEMAK THEY SAID THEY WOULD CALL BACK AND NEVER DID. GOOD LUCK IN GETTING SOMEBODY TO TALK TO IN THEIR BILLING OFFICE LEAVE NAME AND DATE OF BIRTH AND PHONE WE WILL CALL BACK RIGHT! WE HAVE A RECEIPT OF THE TRANSACTION ON THE INTERNET ON THE CREDIT CARD WEBSITE WHERE IT WAS PAID. WE JUST RECEIVED A FINAL NOTICE THREATENING TO TURN THIS OVER TO COLLECTIONS. name: Robyn Lyons
text:
I work in the medical field and had the privilege of treating many of Dr Jones IV patients, post surgery and throughout their recovery. His staff was always attentive, called back regarding any concerns with the patient and his patients adored him. I also saw them recover well from their respective surgeries with fantastic outcomes.

When I found myself in need of an orthopedist, I called the one I felt I had seen the best results in, in other patients. Dr Jones IV has seen me and my daughter now for several different injuries (4 different body parts between the 2 of us). He takes his time, listens to the problem/concern, discusses treatment options and respects that we, the patients, know our bodies the best. He doesn’t just throw something quick at us (meds/braces/etc...) and run out the door.

So for those who have waited a while to see him and gotten frustrated... He would have spent the same time with you. Appointments are made to stagger the number of patients that come in at once- Some are early, some are late, some emergency injuries pop-up (but not enough to warrant an ER visit) and those patients are worked into the schedule in order to be seen as well. Doctors also take call and may be pulled out to treat a very emergent case.

I have waited to see him for nearly 3 hrs once. I have also been in, out and pulling out of the parking deck in less than an hour. It’s the nature of physicians and their occupation. Personally, I can’t sing the praises of Dr Jones IV (and his staff) enough.
