resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and entrusting your care to us. During this time, we are working harder than ever to continue providing the care you need while keeping you and our staff safe. We are happy to be here for you.

name: Kathy Walker
text: I have found the therapists to be personable, professional and knowledgeable.  I wholeheartedly recommend this facility for any of your therapy needs.

resp.text: Professional attitudes, compassion, trust and clinical expertise - that's what we promise to deliver. We're glad to hear that our staff's dedication to providing exceptional care and customer service managed to make your time in recovery that much easier. Thank you for your fantastic review.

name: Robyn Summerford
text: Excellent team. Great leadership

resp.text: It's always exciting to read such wonderful feedback. We love to hear that we are upholding our commitment to excellence. Thank you for entrusting us with your care, and remember, we're always here for you.

name: Barry Simmons
text: Very professional & knowledgeable  staff

resp.text: Our team always strives to offer the best service and we're glad to know we were a part of your recovery process. We appreciate the review and we wish you a speedy recovery!

name: Teresa Rachal
text: My 93 year old mom was there.  They are the most incompetent people I’ve ever met.  They do patient reviews to keep Medicare paying.  The patient reviews are not real.  They are all lies as to what a patient can do.  They should be investigated.

resp.text: Hi Teresa. Thank you for your feedback about your mother's experience. We're sorry to learn that you were unhappy with the care she received. It is our goal, every day, to provide exceptional clinical care and customer service experience to all of our patients. If you're interested in sharing more details, please consider sending an email to info@selectmedical.com so that we can review and reach out as appropriate. Thank you!

name: amanda jones
text: I cannot say enough amazing things about this place. From the time you walk in the door you're treated like family, my 4yr. old son excitedly skips in the door as if we were at Chunk E. Cheese. Jenn at the desk is always friendly, courteous and tries to accomadate all. Hannah, Anthony, and Matt are just a few therapist that will get you back feeling great again. So if you are looking to be treated like a friend rather than dollar signs then please call Jenn and she will take care of y'all. Rehab Associates Wetumpka is the is the best physical therapy business in central Alabama!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and entrusting your care to us. During this time, we are working harder than ever to continue providing the care you need while keeping you and our staff safe. We are happy to be here for you.

name: Dean Baskett
text: Outstanding treatment received by my wife and myself.  I would recommend this folks for your rehab. Anthony and his team were great!

resp.text: You needed care. We are grateful to be here for you. Thank you for entrusting your care to us to feel better and get back to life.

name: Keith lucy
text: The staff at Rehab Associates are some of the best that I have had the opportunity to work with. Great service to go along with great friendly personality is hard to find. At Rehab Associates you are guaranteed both.

name: Mary Hanby
text: The entire staff at Rehab Associates is first class. All of them are personable, caring and highly skilled at physical therapy. I’ll never go any place else!!

name: Doug Jones
text: Staff is awesome.   Since I started staff has worked for a common goal  to improve my well being.  Staff is friendly, courtesy, kind,and polite.  Strongly recommend this team for all your rehabilitation needs. Thank you for a job WELL DONE.

name: Virginia Hancock
text: The staff at Rehab Associates Wetumpka have all been dedicated to helping me recovery quickly from my knee replacement surgery. Since my first visit my therapy has been explained thoroughly, changed or adjusted as I improved, and they have encouraged me through the process. They are a great team of professionals dedicated to patient care. I highly recommend them and would come again if needed. Thank you!

name: Laura Berkstresser
text: Great place for pt! Friendly, knowledgeable people who are committed to helping you get well! My exercises could have left me tired and cranky, but the great community atmosphere kept my energy and my spirits high!

name: conbralius thomas
text: Professional and very knowledgeable personnel always has best  at heart for all patients .great family oriented atmosphere

name: Bob Mahoney
text: This organization is among the top 1% of the PT facilities in the Wetumpka, Tallassee, and Montgomery area.  If you are in need of any type of physical therapy and live in the area get you Physican to write the order for R. A. Hall’s facility in Tallassee.  Each and everyone of his personnel know their business, are right there to assist you and always do it with a smile.  Doesn’t make any difference whether is is 8:00 in the morning or 4:00 in the afternoon.

name: Barry Barnett
text: Complete rehab clinic. Very knowledgeable trainers, friendly staff. Always have time for your questions. Highly recommend them to anyone who needs rehab.

name: Johñ Henderson
text: The staff is respectable, professional, and friendly. The exercise room is always kept ln a clean condition.

name: G Greenfields
text: The ONLY place to go! The staff are always very friendly but professional. They will assist in a positive recovery.

name: Byron Searcy
text: I have been a patient at this facility on numerous occasions over the last several years as has my wife. We have found them to be nothing more than professional in what they do and also go out of their way to make sure we are given the proper treatment. Great atmosphere, great staff, clean surroundings! If I could rate them higher I would and if you need a rehab facility please don’t take my word for it go and try it for yourself. Trust me you you want regret it! Rehab Rocks! Byron and Beverly Searcy

name: shelby jones
text: Such wonderful, friendly and accompanying staff.

name: Larry Crawford
text: If the choice is yours to make, choose Rehab Associates in Wetumpka. Great staff and facility.

name: Diana Wood
text: Flexibility of scheduling, hospitality and experience of staff!

name: Debbie Nixon
text: Great Folks

name: Cori Campbell
text: Dr. Kunkel has been caring for my husband's foot issues for 5 years, and is the reason he can still walk.  God sent us this incredible doctor- and I am eternally grateful.  Dr. Kunkel's knowledge, care, manner and professionalism is top notch.  I would highly recommend him to anyone.  Blessings to him for putting up with us all these years, and being truly invested in the best possible outcomes for his patients.

name: Deborah DeeDee
text:
He is an awesome Dr. He takes time with you and is polite and nice , you couldnt ask for a Dr. To be so kind. He goes above and beyond his duty as a Dr when your with him he treats as if your the only patient in the office.
Couldnt ask for a better Dr.

name: Mo Morgan
text: Smart. Great bed side manner. Pleasant. Serious about his craft.

name: shawnie hale
text: My experience was great,it was my first time there everyone was nice and very professional. I loved that I didn't have a long wait time. Everything was explained to me on what was going on in a way that I could understand better. Yes I would recommend to family and friends.

name: Mike Darnall
text: Great team. I felt completely safe during my visit with Dr. McGough. His team was professional and courteous. I was seen promptly and I felt like Dr. McGough answered all of my questions and gave me a wealth of info about my upcoming surgery. I feel much more at ease. Looking forward to getting things started. Great experience overall!!

name: Kim Poston
text: I was super nervous and scared. Your staff was patient with me, took great care to explain everything, and checked in with me to make sure they answered all of my questions.

name: Joan Baker
text: Dr. Ortega and staff were excellent in every way.  From making the appointment to seeing Dr. Ortega was an exceptional experience.

name: Jim Nelson
text: At least my 4th visit to Andrews for sports related issues - Always pleased with the excellent concern and care everyone has in helping me get back on track and back to the activities I love.

name: Hazel Hamilton
text: Very courteous and professional from the scheduling of my appointment to walking out of the office !!! Dr. McGough was amazing at discussing my concerns , telling me what ALL my options were. He didn't just jump to , " Let's do surgery !" Like other Drs. I've seen. I wish ALL my doctor's had his personality and demeanor!

name: Joanie Helms
text: Everyone was helpful, polite, and kind. I felt very comfortable.

name: Michael McGrath
text: had a problem with my hip, scheduled and appointment online on Saturday and was called on Monday by the office and in on Thursday. The check in procedure and paperwork process (which I normally despise in any healthcare setting) was easy to navigate and efficient. Going to Xray was the best experience ever and the equipment first class. All medical staff including the Doctors treated me amazingly and I felt valued. I hope I dont need to come back but can guarantee I will if I get injured again

name: CeCe Cole
text: Consult visit went smooth and straightforward.

name: Gail Bush
text: My first visit with Dr. McGough and was very pleased.

name: Steven Knott
text: I required surgery on my right shoulder in 2014. The doctor did a good job then, I thought,  yet now I'm having trouble with what was done. Specifically, the bicep was relocated and screwed into bone, and now it does not feel so secure and is painful. The result of a recent visit felt ambiguous at best. Another huge problem is with the some of the staff. It is now July 2017 and during a recent visit in June, I discovered outstanding co-pays when there should not have been. I was ushered around with whispers behind my back like I was a delinquent. When I found out and refuted the claims, I was told their system was new and my info was on the older system. How convenient! When trying to contact Andrews Sports Clinic, the person answering the front lines either does not listen and things have to be repeated numerous times or the person is sarcastic, rude, and condescending with the whole  "mean girl" attitude. Its not unusual to wait while the person guesses what you want and when you interrupt to tell them what you want, look out! I don't know if this is what you are willing to go through but I'm not anymore. Nothing is worth this.

name: Kim Wise
text: Dr. Ortega is great!

name: Clint Douthit
text: Entire staff was excellent.

name: Melissa Reynolds
text: Excellent care from everyone at Andrews Sports Medicine!

name: Laura Worthy
text: Very positive experience

name: Vraj Patel
text: Great service

name: shawn jonesq
text: Very professional staff.

name: Mark Connell
text: I had broken my ankle in three places and they did surgery and I am up and working sooner than I would have expected great place! Kudos to Dr.Bose!

name: candy swoboda
text: I really don't have enough great words to say about Dr. Bose, if you want the best Orthopaedic Doctor in Mobile. Pick up the phone and call his office. That was the best thing I ever did. He did my hip the first of the 2015 and another in small surgery 2014.He the only one I will trust my body too. He has an outstanding staff who care about the needs of the patients who come to there office.

name: Brenda Baker
text: Dr Boss is a great Orthopedic he get straight to the point.The office staff is very professional and get you what you need,no long waiting in and out no long waiting to schedule and appt always convenient. About to have a surgery soon little nervous but I trust Dr Boss.

name: E Davis
text: Dr Bose has put me back together numerous times over the years. Always professional and courteous.

name: David Dixon
text: Dr Bose repaired my shoulder injury in March 2017. His surgery corrected my problem. I would highly recommend Dr Bose. He is honest and explains what he has to do and what to expect during the healing process.

name: Randal Rocker
text: Dr.  Bose is a specialist,  he knows his job and how to do it.  He isn't going to give you extra conversation,  the only extra attention you will get is to your surgery or problem but this office is the best at what they do,  I love the receptionist,  she answers emails and get you what you need promptly.

name: Rebecca Ivy
text: The Best surgeon's and staff

name: Theodore Gail
text:
Front desk staff very cordial, helpful and friendly.  X-Ray a great team.  Dr. Savage takes the time to explain what’s going on and what is necessary to get on the road to recovery. I have no hesitations in recommending him.  Truly a very good Orthopaedic surgeon with the patients best interest and care as his primary goal.
A great experience with a capable staff.

resp.text: We're especially grateful for the recommendations of our patients to others - thank you Theodore!

name: Arthur Wallace
text: Jennifer a lot better than the last specialist I went to (not Bayside) for other problem. Didn't show X-ray no explanation of anything. At least Jennifer was explicit with X-ray and all other info. GOOD NURSE

resp.text: We appreciate the five stars - thank you Arthur! Glad you're on the mend.

name: mwhite3064
text: Dr. Stubbs is an excellent doctor, explained diagnosis and treatment. Happily answered all questions,  explained recover time and precautions afterwards.

resp.text: Thank you - we appreciate the five star feedback!

name: Bonita Crist
text:
Dr.  Determann and his staff are caring and take time to listen to me and then set up a plan to fix my problem. They all make me feel like they really care. I have been going to him for 2 years.
Dr D keeps putting me back together and I  would not consider going anywhere else.

resp.text: We're always here to "put things back together" when you need us - thank you for the kind words Bonita!

name: Angie Bacon LoPresti
text: From the first time I met with Dr. Determan, over 5 years ago I was thoroughly impressed with his knowledge, demeanor and caring attitude. I’m almost 4 years post-op for a knee replacement and could not be happier. I have all the faith and trust in him as a doctor one should have. I highly recommend him for all one’s Orthopaedic needs.

resp.text: Thank you Angie -  our patients become like family along the healing process. Glad to know your new knee has you back to doing the things you love!

name: Monique Rogers
text: Everyone at Bayside Orthopedic was very courteous and professional. I definitely rate my overall experience 5 ⭐ ⭐⭐⭐⭐ My husband and I absolutely loved the Christian atmosphere. Even though the AC was out, we barely noticed that.😊 The receptionist told us only one physician was there and I may not be able to be seen. That was very disheartening because we had drove for over an hour from Mobile. She checked and Joshua Wing, CRNA, graciously agreed to see me.🙌🏾 Brian the X-ray technician made sure to take as many x-rays as possible to get the right angles of my knee. Brian was super nice and professional. What can I say about Joshua Wing? He was very caring and professional. He provided excellent service. Joshua was very thorough in his examination and  explanation of my x-rays. He was very caring and concerned about my knee pain and discomfort. He provided my husband and I with various suggestions and treatment options. And he gave a detailed explanation of knee replacement surgery. Joshua raved about the excellent physicians at Bayside. Joshua assured us a plan would be put in place to get my surgery scheduled as soon as possible. My husband and I truly appreciated Joshua's knowledge and professionalism. Joshua truly blessed our day. 🙏🏽

resp.text: Thank you for the detailed and thoughtful feedback Monique - your thoughts let us know whether we’re meeting your expectations and our own standards for patient care.  Brian and  Josh are stellar - you were indeed in the best of hands.  Grateful to have you in the Bayside Ortho family… and look forward to getting you on the mend!

name: Angie Janes
text: Josh was just great- knowledgeable, personable, and easy to relate to. He explained the process for my knee injections very well. Injections were almost painless!  Thanks Josh!

resp.text: Thank you Angie - glad to know we’ve got you on the mend!

name: Gina Gillott
text: As always, a great experience at this practice! Dr. Deaterman & Jennifer are so kind and are very patient with my questions. Wouldn’t go anywhere else!

resp.text: Thank you for that feedback Gina - it takes a team every step of the way toward great patient care!  Grateful to have you in the Bayside Ortho family.

name: Janice Kinard
text: I arrived early and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes.  Dr. Carter is very thorough is determining what is wrong.  I feel he always listens to my concerns.  I have been using Dr. Carter for 25 years and would not see anyone else.

resp.text: Thank you Janice - we’re grateful to have you in the patient family all these years!

name: pamela jiovenetta
text: She was very calming.  I was nervous.  She explained everything. Made sure I was ok checking me. I would have her do the procedure again. Her prep nurse was calming also.  Made sure I knew everything the Dr was going to do. 👏.

resp.text: Thanks Pamela!

name: Tom Christy
text: Dr. Joanne Baird is by the best of the best in her field. You will not find a more qualified doctor and her true concern for your quality of life. I am 64 and been going to doctors all my life being actively involved in sports, knee surgeries, etc. My first visit and my knee feels so much better. I would strongly read her profile online, she has a great bedside manner to make you feel at ease when you are miserable with pain. I wish all doctors regardless of specialty, had her genuine concern for your well being. Cancel your other appointment and call her office, you will find that you wished you went to her a long time ago.

resp.text: Thank you for that thoughtful feedback Tom.  We agree, Dr. Baird is distinguished in not just her remarkable credentials but warm approach to each and every patient.  We're glad to have her with us - and grateful to have you within the patient family!

name: Sherie Gore
text: I love, love, love Dr Determann and his staff!! Dr Determsnn is a good Christian man with a great bedside manner. He loves his job and it shows in how he treats his patients. Everyone from x-ray techs to nurses to receptionists have treated me, not only with respect, but with care and concern. I'm almost sad I don't need him anymore. I, absolutely, recommend him, 150%.

resp.text: It takes a team - and we have a great one every step of the patient journey. Thank you for those kind words Sherie!

name: Stanette Miller
text:
First time to see this physician, but have used this group before.
Dr. Stubbs was great.  He was not aggressive with a treatment plan,
and his personality was exactly what I needed.

resp.text: Thank you Stanette - just what we hope to hear!

name: Ann DeBrule
text: Jennifer is great. Will answer all your questions and make sure you understand. Over many months she has guided me thru steroid shots and the latest visits the "rooster" shots. Thanks for your help.

resp.text: We appreciate the five stars - thank you Ann!

name: Georgie Cain
text: Excellent physician. Explained situation in detail with clear plan of care and follow up. Did not have to wait very long to be seen.

resp.text: Thank you Georgie - we appreciate the five stars! Always our goal.

name: Cristol Thompson
text: Excellent professional service. Had rotator cuff surgery and have absolutely no complaints. I would highly recommend Dr. Determan and his staff!

resp.text: So glad you're on the mend Cristol - thank you for the kind words!

name: Matt Drouillard
text: We trust Dr. Savage completely. He successfully reconstructed our daughter’s ankle after numerous dance-related injuries. He is a top notch surgeon with a great bedside manner. Highly recommended!

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words Matt - and glad we've found relief for your daughter. Always here when you need us!

name: Benita Harris
text:
Dr. Savage is one of the most friendly, bedside manner, Concerned, doctor you ever want to meet. I continually telling family and friends, and stranger about him. If you need a GOOD Well experience Orthopedic doctor He's the one to call. Dr. Savage operated on my right knee giving me a total knee replacement, he's done a fantastic job I am very pleased.  I will give Him 5 stars he deserves more. Awesome Doctors At Bayside Orthopaedic Sports and Medical.
Signed,
Benita A. Harris

resp.text: Thank you for that thoughtful feedback Benita - we believe taking time with each and every patient is essential to care and recovery. It's a partnership - and we're grateful to have you in the patient family!

name: Angela Long
text: We have always been pleased with services here. They are timely and very friendly and knowledgeable.  We highly recommend Dr. Savage and Jennifer Firestone.

resp.text: Thank you Angela - we're grateful to have you in the patient family!

name: Brandolyn Cote
text:
Dr. Stubbs is great and knowledgeable. Very personable and great manner. Over the years we have seen a few doctors in this practice at both locations and have always had good interactions with each. The nurses are all friendly too.
The only downside to our recent visit was the receptionist as it seems she forgot her customer service skills this morning, no eye contact and spoke down to us more than once.

resp.text: Thank you for that valuable feedback Brandolyn  - as it's essential to know whether we've met not only patient expectations but our own commitment to their care.  We'll ensure your next visit meets that goal!

name: Stacey Sexton
text: Everyone we encountered was outstanding.  Dr Determann was very patient and personable. He took time to really listen and explain everything very well. Would definitely choose him again! Great experience.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: thank you Stacey!

name: Michael Velaski
text: Jennifer was extremely polite & knowledgeable. Overall my appointment was a great experience.

name: Bill Wallace
text: Jennifer was through in testing my left knee for the cause of the pain I'm experiencing. Talked in layman's terms that I was able to understand. Xrays and knee manipulation with orders to my PT clinic has set me on a path to recovery.

resp.text: So glad you’re on the mend Bill - we appreciate the kind words!

name: Krista Lippold
text: Efficient practice and kind people. Dr Stubbs explained everything very well and offered a large variety of treatment options. As it has been said.. people don’t care how much you know.. until they know how much you care.  I truly appreciate being sincerely cared for during my visit.  Thank you

resp.text: We couldn't ask for a great endorsement of what we do and how we do it.... thank you Krista for those very kind words!

name: Carolyn Hare
text: Dr. Determann was thorough, explained things to my husband about the condition of his knee, and offered good advice. Also, pleased with how we were in and out in 45 minutes.

resp.text: Thank you for the thoughtful feedback - glad to know we got you on the mend !

name: P L
text: Jennifer was very helpful and informative and answered all my questions and concerns

resp.text: Many thanks for the five stars!

name: Gracie Weston
text: Made me feel so comfortable and like I was already known. Staff took good care of me and dr Stubbs really helped.

resp.text: Thank you Gracie!

name: Judy Ullrich
text: Dr Jay Savage is THE best...caring, knowledgeable, skilled surgeon.

resp.text: Thank you Judy!

name: Karen Walton
text: Dr. Detterman has always been great in handling the ortho issues I have had. He is so friendly and conversational - not stuffy or standoffish or dismissive. Knowledgeable but not arrogant. I highly recommend Dr. Detterman for orthopedic needs.

resp.text: Medical care shouldn't be overwhelming - we take time to ensure your questions are answered and concerns heard. We're glad to have you in the patient family!

name: Gwen Taylor
text:
I came from MS, for a second opinion, and was pleasantly surprised about how friendly, respectful and knowledgeable this group has been to me. I met with Dr. Terrall once and immediately felt comfortable  and less stressed. Even making an initial appointment was easy and the staff was cheerful.
I then had my “rooster”shot given to me per Josh Wing, CRNP, and knew this was a special group. I felt no pain and he talked me thru the injection and answered all my questions. This has been nothing but a positive experience for me and I will sing their praises for a long time.

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words Gwen - glad we were able to provide the treatment direction and relief  you were seeking.  Glad to have a Mississippi face in the patient family!

name: Mike LeCroy
text: Great communication with not just me but my 10yr old. He made sure we both understood what was going on with her knees and what we could do to help them. It’s great to have a doctor take time with their patients.

resp.text: Thank you Mike - glad your daughter is on the mend!

name: Susan Martin
text: Jennifer was wonderful!  A thorough examination and determination of what my problem was!  She explained everything in detail and gave wonderful advice!  Would highly recommend her as a practitioner!

resp.text: Jennifer is one of our most experienced NP team members - from trauma to burn care and specialized certification in bone health & osteoporosis care.  Thank you for sharing your experience Susan!

name: Darlene Smith
text: I find Dr. Carter and Laura to be extremely professional and caring.  I believe I receive exceptional care each time I go to Bayside Orthopedics.  There can’t possibly be any care any better!

resp.text: thank you Darlene!

name: Sherie Gore
text: I had a great experience. I was a new patient and they made me feel part of the family. The doc showed me my X-rays and explained what was happening in my hands and what we could do about it. I left with a plan and am on the road to pain free hands!!

resp.text: Glad we could sort things out with your hands Sherie - and welcome to the family!

name: Michele Frost
text: Dr Baird is the female Dr. to avoid here. She saw me for five minutes to show me an x-ray of my hips which I’ve been having pain in and wrote  me off to the bone density Clinic who then informed me that the pain I’m having in my hips most likely stems from the curve in my spine that was noticeably overlooked by her but highly visible in the x-ray.  Any five minute doctor should be avoided at all costs.  And I do not need to see anyone at Bayside on this. I reported the issue and received NO CALL BACK.

resp.text: Michele, we regret the experience you’ve described as meeting neither your own expectations nor our own standards for patient care and communication.  We would welcome the opportunity to discuss any questions or additional concerns from your recent visit by calling and speaking to Kirby Butler: 251.210.3114

name: Crystal Gonzalez
text: Dr. Carter operated on my shoulder and did a fantastic job!! He called my husband before and after the surgery to keep him updated. He answers any and all questions or concerns you have. I've used this office since I was 10 years old. Back then it was Dr. Fellers. I've also seen Dr. Terrell. Highly recommend this office to everyone.

resp.text: Crystal - caring for Baldwin County more than 40 years gifts us with longtime members of our patient family like you.  Grateful to have you with us all these years - and for the continuing kind words.  Glad your shoulder is doing well!

name: Donna Brown
text: Dr. Carter is always reassuring and encouraging.  I would recommend him and his team to everyone. They all know what they are doing.

resp.text: We appreciate those kind words - thank you Donna!

name: Matthew Conklin
text: I've had nothing but great expereinces in their office. The staff is friendly and takes pride in their work. Dr. Carter does a wonderful job explaining everything and and is dedicated to his patients' well-being.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing that feedback on not only Dr. Carter but our entire time. We strive for a common culture throughout the office based on a welcoming sense of patient care. Glad to have you in the patient family Matthew!

name: Ruth Lazzari
text:
Dr.Joey, had been my Dr. for years.
He not only does his job well.
But more than that ,he is a true friend. And cares about you. I am blessed to have him .

resp.text: We appreciate those five stars Ruth - grateful to have you in the patient family all these years!

name: Brian Sinclair
text:
Wonderful experience with Bayside Orthopaedic Sports Medicine and Rehab Center. Dr. Determann was a wonderful surgeon, and the staff was always helpful and kind. I am so glad I chose Bayside Orthopaedic and would highly recommend to anyone.  I appreciated Dr. Determann taking time to go over my diagnosis and his willingness to listen and discuss my treatment options not only to me but while also educating his residents in how to diagnosis and treat shoulder issues.  A testament to his passion to educate, train,  and heal others!
The physical therapists were wonderful to work with and they will work as hard for you as you work for them while taking your pain levels into consideration and ensuring you do not work outside your physical capabilities of the injury.

resp.text: Thank you for that thoughtful feedback Brian - you've described exactly the benefit of having such a comprehensive physical therapy team on site at our Fairhope clinic. Our surgeons are able to coordinate directly with PT staff in planning a recovery plan unique to your injury and needs.   Dr. Determann is our shoulder go-to... you're in the best of hands!  Glad you're on the mend - and grateful to have you in our patient family.

name: Sybil Lindell
text: I Love all of the ways that everyone with Bayside Orthopedic is so attentive to your needs. I really appreciate Dr. Carter and his group of nurses helping me to get mended back up!!

resp.text: Our nursing staff is key to patient care - and work hand in glove with our physicians. Thanks for sharing - glad you're on the mend!

name: Gordon Howe
text: Our first time there we got in on time and we impressed with Dr. Savage. He listened well and explained things in terms we understood. We're in our second week of therapy and my wife is out of pain and having her mobility improve. After one visit we decided he can take care of our needs. It's nice to be impressed. 😉

resp.text: Thank you Gordon - our entire team works hard to ensure you're seen promptly and have ample time with each physician to thoroughly understand your diagnosis and next steps. Glad your wife is on the mend!

name: carrie devolder-edwards
text: The radiologists, Dr Determann’s  nurse, & Dr Determann are so very comforting to work with, especially when in pain & worry about upcoming surgery.

resp.text: Thank you Carrie - we realize it takes a team approach for the superior patient care that's always the goal. Glad to have you in the patient family!

name: Amanda Olive
text: Called at 801am today for an appointment for my son (age 3.) The secretary was amazing. Was able to get us in on the cancellation list. From the nurses, to the x-ray people, to Dr. Determan, everyone was so amazing to both me and my son. Incredible.

resp.text: Glad we were able to get you in quickly Amanda! Our team all shares the same commitment to patient care especially when it comes to little ones. ;)

name: luann iturrino
text: Had complete  knee replacement done both knees and the experience has been nothing but wonderful. Staff and Doctors are very nice and they actually listen to you.

resp.text: We appreciate that feedback LuAnn- glad to know you're back doing the things you enjoy!

name: Julie Bower
text: Excellent physicians, nurses, technicians, office staff and everyone else on the team.  They are always on time for appointments but have plenty of time to explain and answer questions. I highly recommend Bayside Orthopaedic.

resp.text: It takes a team,  and we're proud of ours. Excellent care goes far beyond just the patient/physician. Thank you for the kind words Julie!

name: marcella bell
text: My experience was great.  he is professional, well informed and kind.  He has a great chair side manner.

resp.text: Thank you Marcella!

name: Kristine E Woosley
text: Dr. Joey Carter has been my bone doctor since I moved here 20 years ago. He has done  three surgeries for me, and helped me tremendously. I would have any other for this type of surgery.

resp.text: Very kind of you Kristine - grateful to have been part of your continued recoveries all these years!

name: Bob Osterholt
text:
I had my appointment with Josh, to go over some swelling and pain in my left knee which I just had knee replacement 3 weeks ago. Josh was very precise on his examination and understood (layman) everything he was telling me. There was no rushing through my examination and ask if I had any questions. Josh was extremely thorough and I felt very much at ease and made sense in everything he exclaimed to me. I hope that I get him again for any follow ups that may come up.

Thank you Josh

Bob Osterholt

resp.text: Our Nurse Practitioners are a vital part of the care team - and we agree with your five stars for Josh.  Taking time to listen and explain your diagnosis thoroughly is essential in our approach to patient care.  We appreciate the kind words Bob!

text: Staff was great! Dr Determann is so kind. Debbie Kay was so great with my daughter giving her her cast.

name: Kayla Myers
text: Place is nice and clean, staff was friendly and my doctor (Determann) was awesome! Explained things in a very natural way not condescending at all, also my x-ray tech was amazing!! Highly recommend!

name: Dottie Leech
text: Absolutely trust Joshua! Very mannerly, efficient, knowledgeable, and very helpful in all ways! I wouldn’t consider going to anyone else!

name: Wayland Blake
text: I have found Dr. Carter to be very professional, detailed and thorough, yet very friendly and patient oriented. Several members of our family have been patients of his from my granddaughter, daughter, son, and myself. I would highly recommend Dr. Carter as an Orthopedic Surgeon and Doctor.

resp.text: Thank you Wayland - we appreciate all of your family being such a big part of our own patient family!

name: Linda Bolton
text: Jennifer Firestone and the entire staff are very nice and helpful. My husband is a patient and recommended that I come here too and I’m glad I did!

resp.text: Glad you kept it all in the family - thank you Linda!

name: Victoria Jones
text: I highly recommend Bayside Orthopedic Group. Our first visit was two months ago when my 7 year old son broke his elbow... and again this week after a broken leg. Dr. Stubbs has great communication with not just me but my 7 year old as well. He made sure we both understood what was going on with his elbow and leg. Even called the day after his surgery to check in on him! The office staff has been friendly and helpful anytime I have called. They are always on time for appointments but leave plenty of time to explain or answer any questions. It’s great to have that time and not feel rushed with unanswered questions. Dr. Stubbs and Kristen both have been wonderful through all of this and have had all the patience in the world to deal with the drama from my 7 year old. From the nurses, to the x-ray people, everyone has been so amazing. And I have to give a big thank you to Evan for taking time out of his busy day to work with Trey on using his crutches. He was fantastic. Bayside has been a blessing to our family.  We have always been treated with the upmost care and respect.

resp.text: Our youngest patients are extra special, as we realize both children and parents need a unique level of reassurance in diagnosis and treatment plans... not to mention time to ask questions and plenty of encouragement. Crutches are awkward at every age!   Hope that elbow and leg are mending well - we're sorry for the bumps but grateful to have you and Trey as part of our own patient family.  Will pass along your kind words to Dr. Stubbs and team!

name: vickie bailey
text: Dr. Savage is amazing!!  His bedside manner is like no other physician.. I would definitely recommend anyone in this practice.. I find everyone to be extremely thoughtful and caring!!!

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words Vickie - glad to have you in our patient family!

name: Jeanette

name: Tracie Reeves
text:
My husband has had two compound fractures in two separate accidents.  We went to The Falcons Sports Ortho in Atlanta.  Three different ones here in Alabama...one of which is extremely famous for sports figures...They never caught the problem on x-ray.  The hardware was literally falling apart due to non growth of bone.
Finally we were referred to Dr Determen.  He immediately diagnosed.  He did surgery on my husband...David Owen....He took old hardware out of the arm and replaced it .  He took bone graft from my husband's hip packed it to his bone in elbow.  Few scars....perfect healing...small downtime...and he uses his arm wonderfully today.  It took four years to find Dr. Determen and we are forever grateful!   His staff and rehab is Amazing.  Bone growth is amazing!  We thought he would lose use of his arm.  This is an Amazing Ortho Doctor.   I hope he gets honored and lives well for all he does.  Another thing...he treats you well...very personable...finally trust!

resp.text: So glad we were able to bring your husband relief after such a long, frustrating and painful road to recovery.  Grateful David is back in action - and grateful to have you in our patient family!

name: Debbie Blankenship
text: Dr Terral has been my orthopedist for 15 years. He is calm, patient and compassionate.  I am so thankful for successful knee replacements and broken hip repair.  Dr. Terral does not push for unnecessary surgery; instead he encourages noninvasive treatment first. This visit was for results of an MRI on my ankle.  Good news - surgery not necessary. I appreciate Dr. Terral and his staff. Bayside Orthopaedic acknowledges that faith is important in the healing process.  I am thankful especially for that. Besides providing excellent medical  care here, the Drs and nurses travel to many other countries to provide orthopaedic care.

resp.text: Thank you for that thoughtful feedback Debbie.  Dr. Terral leads our practice commitment to just what you've described: patient, compassionate care that ensures the patient understands everything from diagnosis to procedure.   We appreciate the opportunity to provide care all these years!

name: God Faith Fathers Family & Guns
text:
I had surgery shoulder surgery on December 14, 2020. I woke up in recovery with ungodly pain. The nurses did a great job getting the pain under control before discharging me.
Fast forward to Friday the 18th, I left two messages to have my pain medication filled before the weekend since I would run out.
It is Monday the 21st and still nothing about having my pain medication refilled. I guess patients being in pain is amusement for some on my doctor's staff.
In 2012 I would have happily recommended Bayside Orthopaedics to anyone. Oh yeah, when I had my first shoulder surgery back in May it took ten days for me to get my first prescription for pain medication filled.
As of 2020, I will not ever recommend anyone use Bayside Orthopaedics until a patient's care actually means something again.
If I could have given less than one star I would have!
UPDATE: 12/31/2020
Bayside Orthopaedic without my permission gave a third party my personal and medical information and this company wants $30 to fill out a form that would have taken my doctor 2-3 minutes to complete. Not only that this PPW was supposed to be completed within a couple of days after surgery and they give it to this third party company two weeks and two days after surgery. This is it for me with this practice!!!!!

resp.text: Our patients care is of the utmost importance to us. Thank you for bringing this situation to our attention. We value all feedback that can allow us to be better healthcare providers. We would appreciate an opportunity to follow up with you. Please give us a call at 251-928-2401 and ask to speak with Kirby.

name: Melanie Brown
text: Dr. Terral and his nurse are absolutely amazing!  Educating with compassion and passion for the patient and their work! Truly feel blessed that I was lead to Bayside for my surgery!! My only complaint is with the main front desk gals  and The Covid door monitor.. it’s crazy to me with such and  amazing Dr. that they are not pleasant as well as not welcoming, I believe the word is Anhedonia or (without) emotion.  It’s upsetting.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback Melanie - we're glad to know your treatment went well.   Unfortunately, COVID-19 protocols create some  stiffness on arrival to the clinic.  We'll all be on the other side of this soon - and look forward to a more relaxed and welcoming experience when you visit.

name: Tom Jackson
text:
Undoubtedly the worst experience I have ever had with a doctor's office.

Appointment scheduled for 2:45, arrived 2:20, not seen til 4:15. Made me late to work.

Supposed to schedule an appointment for MRI. 7 days now, no contact, no appointment. Tried to call for two days now. They do not answer the phone.

The doctor seems good. The support staff I have had contact with were rude, indifferent, uncaring, and have no respect for your time.

I'm totally dissatisfied. Do not waste your time!!!

name: Sara Rutkoski
text: Had an appointment at 10:40, signed in at 10:30. It's now 11:25 and no sign of being seen anytime soon. When I approached the desk to ask about an estimated time I was "greeted" by who I assume is the office manager. She rudely stated "all the rooms are full so I don't know how long your wait will be. Do you want to reschedule?" I explained that I did not due to taking my child out of school for this appointment. The same extremely rude woman stars "well there are three people in front of you so it's going to be a while". I had already overheard that a patient who's appointment wasn't until 11:10 had already been put in a room. The next patient who signed in was told upon signing in that the doctor was running 30-40 minutes behind. And here we still sit. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone! Rude staff and no consideration for the patients time.

name: L Armstead
text: I wouldn't even give them one star. But anyway, I was scheduled for an MRI and didn't realize how claustrophobic I was until the day of.  I immediately left the hospital and came back to  the office and explained to the nurse the issue I had.  Her was response was we can only give you one pill. First of all, I was new patient and they know nothing about me.  I hate taking medicine, but I was desperate to find out what is wrong with my arm.  I have been on the same job for 16 years and only have to go to the doctor twice because of job related issues.  When I initially met Dr. Determann he seemed like he really wanted to find out what was going on as well. After getting the MRI he only saw a small spot and started saying his office wasn't in to do pain management and that I was able to go back to work as normal lifting same amount weight.  He also stated that I should not be on light duty.  The medicine he prescribed for me made me drowsy and I could not function, so I brought it back and asked the nurse to dispose of them. He mentioned physical therapy and it's been over a week and I have not heard from the office for an appointment.  He mentioned making a referral appointment to see a rheumatologist and I have not received an appointment yet.  It's sad to me for someone to assume and stereotype instead of giving me a real solution other than medicine. This small spot has had me off work for almost six weeks and the office would not even fill out fmla papers so I didn't have to use up all my annual leave.  Dr. Determann told me I had to go the physician that referred me to him for them to complete the paperwork. This really bothered me, so I went to Dr. Goldman at the Daphne received a much simpler solution that gave some much needed relief the next day.  Some people are actually hurting and not after a prescription.  I don't want to be contacted by email, text, calls, or any form of communication from this office.  I have already told some of my family and friends Do Not Come to this office in Fairhope.  The staff and environment in Daphne was like night and day.  At the Daphne office I had a much better experience.

text: Day after Christmas I fell and broke my humerus bone in my right arm I had to wait till January 7th to have surgery and I was referred Dr. Carter. I don't remember everyone's name but Brian in the radiology department was so kind and tender with me while I was hurting. I have nothing but good things to say and I recommend them to anyone I thank everyone for all your care. I've never felt this way at a doctors office before like everyone truely cared about me and I'm just very much appreciative of you. Now I'm recovered and I don't have to come back unless I have problems and it's kind of sad that I won't see you again but I appreciate and very thankful to all of you. God bless ya'll. Thank God 🙏 for caring peeps like y'all. You definitely made a bad condition into an excellent recovery. Kudos to the whole team at Bayside Orthopedic. Very thankful to all.👍👍😘😘😘🤗

name: Cherry Melvin Worsham
text:
For years I suffered with carpal tunnel in my hands and was afraid to have surgery.Over the  years I had heard bad stories about the surgery and was scared to death.It got so bad that I was dropping things didn't have a strong grip and my hands would sleep and throb.The pain was getting worst and I was afraid before long the doctor couldn't fix them.Well a few years back my husband had rotator cuff surgery .I went with him several times to see the doctor before surgery.Well this doctor his name is Dr Greg Carr is wonderful so kind and concerned about your well-being that I liked him immediately.So the time come that I couldn't take it no more with my hands so I made an appointment with Dr Greg Carr the surgeon that fixed my husbands shoulder.I sit and talked with him and he explained everything about the surgery and I felt so relaxed and confident  we schedule the surgery.Anyway I had the surgery everything went great. So when I go back for my follow-up we scheduled surgery for my my left hand the very next week. Dr Greg Carr is amazing I can't say enough about him. He shows a love of his work and to help people.I urge anyone that needs carpal tunnel surgery or has a sports injury to see Dr Greg Carr he's your doctor. Dr Greg Carr has a patient and Friend in me for Life.and one last thing before I forget his staff is amazing they are the kindest group of people I have ever met. I say thank you to Dr Greg Carr and his staff for everything you've done for me.
Thank You Again
Cherry Worsham

text: My advice is to find another Doctor. My surgery to repair a meniscus disk back in October with Doctor Greg Carr was not a success. In fact, I'm headed to the operating room to correct the surgery. Doctor Carr also told me that I had a lot of arthritis in my knee and now I'm finding out that I don't. I just didn't have a good experience with him at all!

We were greeted by a very nice young lady who explained the procedure and took our temperature. The security person was just as nice and informative. After the initial paperwork and Within 15 minute I was in the back for X-Ray’s. Let them 15 min later Dr. Shell was examining me. His nurse was great and very polite, ready to answer every questions that I had and she even encouraged me to ask every thing that I had on my mind.
Great job by the entire staff at AOC, we were in and out in no time and with all of the information that I needed to make a sound decision.
If first impressions are graded they would receive an A++.
Thank you for caring and treating us with respect and dignity.

text: I love Dr.Shell his nurse Gwen and all the staff at AOC. From calling to make an appointment or having x-rays done,everyone is always so very nice.

name: Milton Grimes
text:
I own a small business so I know a little about customer service and satisfaction. I cant say enough good about my experience with these folks. From the security guard at the entrance to the tech that delivered me to our car.
I have had this foot issue for some time and was told nothing could be done about it. Dr. Shell looked at it and said ouch ! That needs to come out. Three days later I reported to the clinic and had a pea sized something or another removed from under my big toe. I was back home within four hours and now feeling better than I have in over a year.
I have had my left hip replaced by Dr. Granberry and two back surgeries by Dr. Donahoe . The second one was due to snapper season two weeks after procedure.
I highly recommend this place and its awesome staff. I use them as an example when having motivational talks with my group. Thanks

My foot ended up needing surgery. He performed the surgery. I’m so happy. My foot is finally healed. I can walk without pain. I wasn’t able to walk normally from May to my surgery in September. It feels awesome to be able to walk without intense pain!! I’m so thankful for this doctor and his team!!

text: I went to Dr. Shell due to an extremely disfigured big toe. I looked at his credentials and saw he graduated from UAB. They are quite a good school and have a history of making good physicians. Dr. Shell did an awesome job making my foot appealing and useful . I am forever grateful. His nurse, Gwen, is a star too. I have to have an ankle surgery soon and plan on getting Dr. Shell to do it. He is busy but thorough.

name: Sarah Black
text: Best foot/ankle specialist in the area! Great bedside manner, and really cares about his patients experience. Highly recommend!

name: Glenda Michaels
text:
I cannot say enough great things about Dr. Shell. He makes you feel that you are the most important patient he will be seeing from the moment he steps into your exam room until you and he are finished with your visit.
He takes the time to explain your x-rays showing you what has been found and, he is always pleased to inform you that there are no broken bones. He also allows you to ask questions about what you see on the
x-rays that you think might be a problem.
He listens to your concerns, carefully exams your foot or ankle, asks questions to determine if what he is doing is making you feel better or making you hurt more. His exams are always conducted in a caring manner.  His soft voice and sparkling blue eyes lets you relax and know
you are truly in the hands of a caring and knowledgable physician.
My left foot and ankle highly recommend Dr. Grant M. Shell.

Dr. Chamblee explained my situation, diagnosis, and treatment. He listened to what I had to say and repeated back to me so that I knew he understood me. He did not rush me through (like so many other physicians do).

text: Dr Chamblee is amazing- thank you so much!!

name: Julie Castle
text:
I had heard so many horror stories about knee replacement that I was quite apprehensive going into my first.  Yup,that's right--there will be a second.  In fact I'm looking forward to it.

Dr. Chamblee is very good at his job! I've got a neat, relatively small scar.  My pain needs were covered. And I was given the opportunity to decide what PT provider I would work with.  He was also skilled at understanding the stress such an event adds to the family.

In short, I would highly recommend Dr. Chamblee to anyone in need of knee replacement surgery.

name: Laure Starring
text: Dr. Chamblee was fantastic. I was in town for a funeral which was terrible enough, but then I woke up with my left elbow very painful, swollen and hot and I was very uncomfortable. He was able to see me, drain my elbow and prescribe me antibiotics. I am still recovering, but my whole experience was so pleasant. Everyone was kind and caring and I was in and out in under an hour. Hopefully I won’t have to return, but if I do, I would go without hesitation.

resp.text: Laure, glad to hear Dr. Chamblee was able to help you....especially in light of the circumstances.  Let us know if there is anything our team can do for you.

name: Lisa Bradley
text: Dr. Michael chamblee I was sitting here thinking about a good doctor, an mine came to Baldwin CountyAnd joint . So I was feeling a little scared and made a phone call and talk to the reception and she gave me Dr. Chamblee .The reason that I wanted to go there I was familiar with the place. I work there November in 2007 and are used to clean that building at night so lady  name Dorothy McClurg administratior I had a impact on  staff and she wanted me to do something for her. And she asked me to pray for her and I did.So one night she came to me why I cleaning the building she said went around and talk to the whole staff because they always pick a doctor and give him something for Christmas but that particular time they pick me to give me a gift for Christmas what what they did they gave me a Christmas party and some gifts and that’s why I have a compassion for Baldwin County bone and joint.I was in the newspaper from bone and joint November 19 2007 December 25 2007.I always said if something happened to my bones I will go there to get it get taken care of I feel good with Dr. Michael Chamblee talk to me and my husband told me that I have bad case  arthritis that my bone rubber together my hip and knee got have surgery. But he was not trying rush me in decision because that news was devastating .he gave me a shot in my knee and told me come back in two weeks and he said we got talking to do so we can fix problem .he made me feel better. I guess that Why I mess up I don’t like go to doctor. I thank the reception because she told Doctor CHAMBLEE was a good doctor.so I did what I always do I pray for reception and Doctor. Thank you so much looking forward to seeing you soon.

I highly recommend Doctor Chamblee for hip surgery. He performed total hip surgery on my left hip and I’m totally pain free!

text: Dr. Chamblee is a real down to earth guy.  Had him do a complete hip replacement and wish I had it done sooner.  Up and walking the same day and almost pain free after 2 weeks.  A real expert at his job and compassionate doctor who is a great listener.  Thanks Doc for a job well done.

text:
Earlier this week I went to Baldwin Bone & Joint for the first time ever. I met Dr. Chamblee...(he was hott in the most professional sense of the word). I was very impressed and pleased with my entire experience, beginning with the excellent online new patient paperwork process. The facility was spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff seemed to enjoy working there. The doctor was knowledgeable and exuded confidence in the care of my diagnosis. I am pleased to have been referred here.
-M.N., RN
(Daphne, AL)

name: Dale Rutherford
text: My wife and I would like to thank Dr. Chamblee for his expertise in doing my hip replacement surgery and taking care of me afterwards...I would recommend his services to anyone...Thank you Dr. Chamblee and staff.

text: My little guy broke his finger and though I know there not much to be done for a broken finger we wanted to err on the side of caution. We went on a day after an honor roll parade, I had my other son in tow and they were full of sugar and rowdy. Dr. Chamblee didn’t rush, he patiently explained the proper care to me and explained to my son the importance of keeping the splint on. We felt welcome and well cared for.

text: This was my first time with Dr. Chamblee and staff. They were so supportive and just very kind and took such great care of me. I loved the energy as soon as we walked in. Beautiful souls and very good at what they do! So happy to have had the honor to share this experience.

Further attention to my needs (An MRI) is being handled in a timely fashion to help completely solve my knee problem. Highly recommended!

text: I came to Baldwin Bone and Joint after a Not do good experience at the Orthopedic Associates in Foley. Dr. Chamblee gave me a treatment plan from day 1. I made the right choice to seek out a second opinion,  just so happened that I was referred to Dr. Chamblee. Dr. Chamblee's diligence, knowledge  and experience is Bar None ! text: Dr. Gullung is a wonderful doctor. He takes time to answer any questions or concerns that you may have. The entire staff made me feel comfortable and at ease before I had surgery. I would highly recommend him to family and friends.

name: Melanie Anderson
text: Dr. Gullung is excellent. He performed surgery on my back to relieve a severe Herniation in 2018 just one month prior to my daughter’s wedding. I got immediate relief from the procedure.  I have scoliosis, osteoporosis,  as well as degenerative disc disease  but am able to function wonderfully. Physical therapy has taught me how to recognize limitations and continue to remain strong. I walk 5-6 miles a day and work with weights 2 times a week. Dr. Gullung  takes the time  to listen and explain when I always have questions. He understands my goals in this decade of my life are to be as healthy as possible, and able to get down on the floor with grandchildren when that time comes! 😊

name: Kandi Warnock
text: Arrived at 1:20 for appointment, finally after 3 hours and 10 minutes I left . The doctor was useless , I came to him for my neck , after consultation with a ent and Nero for my balance and tremors issues, they had both noted to see a neck doctor. He NEVER examined my neck , just looked at X-rays and order a MRI , mind you I am in a wheelchair for to POTS at my office that is caused from neck issues. If you want to feel your at a cattle call and spend 3 hours to see the doctor for 12 minutes this is your place. I do not care for place that brings you in like cattle to sit and sit . We had to circle the small parking of lot for 10 minutes along with 3 other cars , waiting for someone to finally leave. WHAT DOCTOR NEVER EXAMINES HIS PATIENTS?

resp.text:
Hello, Kandi.
We sincerely regret not meeting your expectations regarding your experience with one of our providers. Patient satisfaction is incredibly important to us and is something we continuously strive to achieve with every patient. We would like the opportunity to discuss your comments further. Please use the URL listed below to provide us your contact information directly. Thank you.
Contact URL: https://tinyurl.com/yf3l7rpa

text: Dr. Gullung is a good doctor.  I recommend him for back surgery for sure!

name: richard herbal
text:
Dr Gullung took me as his patient after a catastrophic back surgery performed by another orthopedic group.  I was just barely able to walk from the excruciating pain from a bad lower back fusion surgery.  He took time to review my surgery records and explained everything to me and my wife.  Dr Gullung performed a reconstructive surgery completely replacing all hardware.  I was able to walk right after the surgery.  He recently implanted a neuro stimulator to relieve muscle spasm pain from nerve damage caused during the first back surgery.
I would trust Dr Gullung and his staff to perform surgery on any of my family or friends.

name: Heather Fann
text: Everyone was quite friendly and helpful. Great experience with a painful problem.

name: David Cagle
text:
I had tremendous pain in my arms and shoulders as well as my back. My Sports Medicine MD referred me to Dr Gullung for surgery on my neck and back. I had anterior surgery on my cervical disks with the understanding that it may not work completely because the disks were so far out of place. He wanted to use the least painful procedure first in the hopes that it would take care of the pain.
It worked great for a few weeks, but then I started having more problems. When I had a CT scan done it showed that the disks were in alignment, but the bone was actually growing on the inside and had all but closed the area around my spinal cord. I had almost zero spinal fluid going through the canal. He pushed me to the front of the scheduled surgeries to prevent my spinal cord from being damaged. He did the posterior surgery then. He removed the bone from two disks and cleared out the excess bone on a couple of more to get my spinal fluid going back to normal and prevent the bone from cutting into my cord. I wore a bone stimulator for twelve weeks and, even to his surprise, the bone had grown back together at the back.
I still have some pain and numbness at times, however he informed me prior to surgery that it may take a year or so to get complete relief.
I appreciate everything he did and his staff is always very friendly and helpful. Thank you Dr. Gullung for relieving the pain I’ve had for years. You helped me even when two Spinal Surgeons told me that there was no hope and that one day I would turn my head and I would be paralyzed for the rest of my life or I would sever the nerve that would stop my breathing or keeps my heart beating.
You are a God sent doctor and I appreciate you more than you know.

name: roy dixon
text: I had surgery about 2 years ago for  sciatic nerve pain. My  first back surgery did not go well with another doctor, and after a year and a half of pain,  I was forced to seek treatment again and was refer to Dr. Gullung. He sat down with me for about an hour and a half and discuss my situation and  he made me feel very comfortable with the decision to go with him on performing my second back surgery. I am very happy to say that going on 2 years the back surgery has been a success. I am able to do things that I just could not do 2 years ago and spend quality time with my family as well as relief from pain daily. I can honestly say that I am thankful that the Lord blessed me to connect with Dr. Gullung and I'm happy to say life is much better.

name: Deborah Branham
text: Awesome doctor and staff

name: Jeremy Sasser
text: Great Doctor

name: Crystal
text: This dr performed lower back surgery on me 2x. A fusion on the second time. After a car accident, my symptoms got much worse and he performed a revision fusion. This was my 3rd surgery. I had never fused from 2 previous surgeries. (He had told me i had healed prior to this.)He replaced rod and screws with larger ones due to being loose. I got worse after last surgery. He didn’t want to listen to my still having problems and that my leg pain was worse. He said everything looked great surgically so he couldn’t help me. After 2 follow ups he dismissed me and said maybe a spinal chord stimulator would help. I researched and opted against this. I would be diagnosed with CRPS a few months later. If only he would have had current knowledge on my symptoms which could be caused by the accident and / or surgery, he might have been able to diagnose the CRPS.   I would find out almost 3 years later, that he had put a screw through my nerve which was contributing to my leg pain  and limping. I have since had surgery and know for the first time what it is like to actually wake up with mostly just surgical pain. After Dr Gullung’s surgery, I always woke up in worse pain and not knowing anything had been helped. He may be cute to look at, but in my humble opinion, he needs to realize that he needs to listen to his patients and not be so quick to dismiss them and their complaints.

name: A Monica Reads
text: I have been there 3 times for back pain, he ordered a bunch of tests and said I needed a back injection, that I'll get a call, that never happened. Then I saw the bills for almost 1k and said, nope! 3 visits and 1k for no real solution.

text: I had my first appointment today with Dr. Parks about a problem with my knee. He was very nice and friendly. After taking X-rays he made a diagnosis and explained  my issue well. He gave me treatments options, explanation of risk and rewards as they procedures progressed. I want the less invasive fix, still active and don’t want to loose months after surgery.  The shot was a first step and glad I gave it a “shot”...  Feeling better by end of day and 95% pain free today. Hope it last a few months.

name: Patricia Bishop
text: I am the wife of Gregory J Bishop.We were referred Chirstopher T Sparks by his personal Dr Gaspar to see if he might could help my husband have a better quality of life after a broken left Femer January 30 2017.Dr Matthew Smith did his Surgery.We were sent home with Home Rehab.All thru rehab an Dr Smith visits with still lots of pain walking Dr Smith told him it would probably take a year or more for recovery an there was nothing else he could do.After almost 3 years of pain an quality of like going down hill he got sick with lung infection August 28 2019 during that time he ask if they would XRay his hip to see why he was in so much pain an hard for him setting an getting up.This is when they saw the problem.We had made us appointments an had to change it for outpatient care.On January 3 2020 We came to Dr Parks.We found him to very friendly he said the picture tells it all and that he could take out the hardware an do a hip replacement and it would change his life.Gregory  believes it well,so do I.My husband has been thru a lot an I know he well make it thru this.God has not brought us to this far to let us down.His heart Dr has released him an so have I his quality of life is what we both want.Thanks to Dr Parks.

name: Ed Brown
text:
I cannot tell you enough how great my knee feels and acts.  I’ve lost 40 pounds since my surgery and that has only made it even better.   I’m pain free, climb stairs without a problem, can walk long distances with easy, and even climbed a ladder to put lights on the outside Christmas tree the last two years.

When people ask me how my knee feels, I tell them that it’s the only part of my 66 year old body that doesn’t hurt.      Kind of kidding around with them, but I can’t believe how good it feels, how strong it is, and how secure I feel using it ….acting just like a real knee.

Though I never thought I’d live through rehab, but I’m glad I did.  That’s a past memory that’s fading away.  But I was back to work full time 6 weeks after surgery, walking the cement factory floor and climbing the 20 steps to my office loft without a problem.     I could have made my surgery and rehab even better if I prepared for it better; more exercise, more strength building in my knee, and dropped a few pounds before surgery.

I give Dr. Moore and staff an A+.  Thanks for giving me a chance to ramble on and share Dr. Moore’s success with me.

12/17/2018 Happy Holidays  

resp.text: Mr. Brown, thank you so much for your kind words! Happy Holidays!

name: Helga Visscher
text: I had a total hip replacement surgery with Dr. Moore in 2013. He was reassuring that this would alleviate the pain and it did.  I should have had the surgery two years earlier. The first time on my feet the day of surgery I felt that I had better range of motion. I thought he was conservative in the limitations he told me to follow the weeks after surgery, but it has paid off.  I can walk easily and continuously as long as I’m on a flat surface. Other osteoarthritis problems in my knees affect me,  such as walking up stairs, and I will follow up on that.  He is a skilled and kind doctor.

name: Tony Russell
text: Dr Moore performed THR on my right hip in March of 2017.  The procedure went well at the time as I suffered from Femoral Acetabular Impingement (FAI) and prior to surgery was in severe pain where walking was a major undertaking.  FAI is a debilitating condition where basically the femur is too big for the hip socket and leads to extremely painful bone on bone arthritis (I was 47 when I had my first procedure performed and prior to the procedure walked as if I was in my 80s).  I was scheduled for THR on my left hip in March of 2020 with Dr Moore and despite the Covid-19 pandemic was eagerly looking forward to the surgery.  Dr Moore ended up cancelling my surgery for what he deemed more "needy and critical" patients.  I was upset at this decision given my FAI condition and called to discuss my options with Dr Moore.  After a heated conversation with Dr Moore I ended up being banned from Andrews Sports Medicine.  As a result, I went to Dr Shane Buggay with OrthoSports Associates who performed THR on my left hip in May of 2020.  Today my left hip feels great while I have some pain "flair ups" from time to time in my right hip. Dr Buggay "radiated" my left hip prior to his procedure, whereas Dr Moore did not "radiate" my right hip prior to his procedure and I suspect that may be the reason for the differences in how each hip feels today.  For anyone looking at a THR, I recommend Dr Shane Buggay with OrthoSports Associates, he is a great compassionate surgeon who has a working knowledge of his patients, whereas  Dr Moore dropped me as a patient when I needed him the most.

text: I went in to see Dr. Peavey about some persistent and worsening knee pain in my right knee.  For reference I’m late 40’s and overweight (and have been all of my adult life). Obviously my weight is going to aggravate any load bearing joint pain.  He was helpful and didn’t sum up the grand total of my issue to my weight, which was an extremely welcome surprise.  My experience with many physicians is that they see my weight and dismiss any other possible reasons for any issue.  I’d been putting off this appointment for exactly this reason, but instead I left with some immediate pain relief solutions and a plan for how to deal with the issue (arthritis) in the longer term.  Great visit and I highly recommend.  I left feeling heard, not patronized.

name: David Terry
text: had a great experience with the whole staff and totally loved our experience with Dr. Waldrop would highly recommend Dr. Waldrop he took what time we needed didnt make us feel rushed, could tell he wanted the best care and out come for our son.

name: Dion Jones
text: Good location and great people. If you're a sports fan or military the visit is even more interesting. I had an ankle injury that required surgery and 3 months of recovery. Dr. Waldrop and staff are fantastic. The wait times for an appointment are minimal and safe during this pandemic. The office is right at the patient drop off point and the parking deck around back has plenty of spaces, though that is a longer walk. There is also valet parking at the patient drop off. Well set up for people with mobility issues.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!

name: Marilyn Hubbard
text: Loved Dr. Waldrop, fixed my ankle and now have hardly any pain.  Office workers and his nurses were very nice.

resp.text: We value your feedback and want to thank you for taking the time to share it.

name: Joel Hawbaker
text: I had a pretty severe break of three bones in my foot following a motorcycle accident, and Dr. Waldrop and the whole staff at Andrews were amazing! Quick appointment, quick surgery date, lots of follow-ups to make sure my recover/healing was going well, and excellent 'bedside manner'/customer service throughout the entire process. This group is world class, and I feel blessed to have been able to have them help me get healthy again. I'm on the road to recovery and looking forward to playing soccer and riding my motorcycle again very soon!

resp.text: As a practice we always aim to provide the best care possible to patients. We love to hear about folks that have had a positive experience. Thank you for your review!

name: Bill Hamner
text:
Was actually seeing Dr. Waldrop for a second opinion on a surgery I had a year ago.
The staff was great, kind and they listened to me about my post surgery problems that I am currently experiencing. Dr. Waldrop examined me and listened to me about the post surgery problems I am currently having and came up with a long term plan to hopefully resolve the issues.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Jimandmarilyn Hubbard
text: Dr. Waldrop is excellent along with his staff.  I would recommend him highly.  I went in with extreme pain in my ankle, and now I have none.  I can't thank him enough.

name: Chuck Shields
text: I saw Dr. Waldrop because I was having a lot of pain and other problems from surgery done five years ago.  The clinic is top notch and very professional from check-in to scheduling to actual doctor visits.  As a result of my visit, I have scheduled surgery with Dr. Waldrop for January of 2021 and have the utmost confidence in him.  Pamela Shields

resp.text: As a practice we always aim to provide the best care possible to patients. We love to hear about folks that have had a positive experience. Thank you for your review!

resp.text: As a practice we always aim to provide the best care possible to patients. We love to hear about folks that have had a positive experience. Thank you for your review!
