name: Hope Munger
text:
Dr. Eslava was rude and disrespectful to the female staff. My daughter was very quiet and shy during our visit. He commented on how quiet she was being, and said to two of the female nurses, “See, she’s so quiet. This is how all women should be. I wish y’all would just quit talking sometimes.”
Both women were visibly uncomfortable by this incredibly rude comment. I was shocked and nearly speechless. I said, “that’s pretty disrespectful”, but he didn’t care to hear me. I’m very disappointed that he was so comfortable with saying something so disrespectful to them, especially in front of patients. I hope that’s a normal thing, but by the way he said it with such ease and laughter, I’m assuming it does happen often. That type of behavior is unprofessional and should unacceptable.

As for the care I received from the nurses—amazing! One woman, I believe named Brittany, helped calm my daughter while we waited for an X-Ray.

name: Bob H
text:
I “inherited” Dr. Eslava as my Orthopaedic Physician after Dr. Edmiston retired. I had Orthoscopic Surgery on my knee about 15 months earlier.  This was my second follow up appointment with Dr. Eslava since the surgery.
During my examination, Dr. Eslava projected professionalism, confidence, and knowledge.  He worked quickly, but throughly, to access my physical situation and to establish a plan of action based on my goals.  He had a training assistant with him during our review of my case and our plan of action.  Dr. Eslava ordered current xrays of both knees for a comparison of my “good knee” with my “bad knee”.  He showed me the xrays, which clearly confirmed an increased “bone-on-bone” issue with my “bad knee”.
I was anticipating his recommendation for a total knee replacement, however, he told me about a new procedure available for patients who were not ideal candidates for such an invasive answer for knee joint pain relief.  He described the “Coolief Procedure” and provided his reasoning for this treatment.  He is referring me to another local physician, outside The Orthopaedic Group, for consultation about having the procedure performed.  Meanwhile, he recommended a joint injection to offer the possibility of immediate pain relief.  The injection was administered and I walked out carrying my walking cane rather than leaning on it.  So, my rating for Dr. Eslava is as high as possible.
My 2 hour (+) wait to see Dr. Eslava was unexpected, and could likely have been partially avoided with better scheduling and more efficient paper flow at the receptionist area.  In defense of the “Group”, My appointment was mid-afternoon and the doctor was working with a training assistant.  In the future, I will schedule appointments earlier in the day if possible.
I do recommend “The Orthopaedic Group” and I am very appreciative for Dr. Eslava’s knowledge and skills.  He is “first class” in my book.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to leave your thoughtful review. We sincerely appreciate it!

name: Sherrie' Nelson

He did a total knee replacement about seven months on my left knee and I'm scheduled to have the right knee replaced in one month.  Some people are surprised when I tell them that I am going back to have my other knee done but to be honest he did such a great job it was not that bad at all.

So far I have nothing but praise for their efforts. They are very professional yet easy to discuss my problems with.

I would highly recommend Dr Marshall and his team to anyone who has needs in his area of expertise.

These were tough exercises to do considering that I’m 75 years old but she made it very enjoyable even though it hurt. 😬 I will definitely be going back to see her after my surgery. I know that all of this pre-surgical strengthening is going to help me heal much quicker.
I would definitely recommend going to CSM for any type of rehab

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and entrusting your care to us. During this time, we are working harder than ever to continue providing the care you need while keeping you and our staff safe. We are happy to be here for you.

resp.text: We really appreciate you taking the time to leave such a positive review. We are so glad that you had a wonderful experience at Champion sports Medicine. Chelsea and the team at Champion Sports Medicine would be my preferred care providers for any subsequent injuries.

-Christopher “Yardsale” Weeden

text: I went to Dr. Lane because he had treated my hip, knee, and shoulder problems.  I had a place on my right thigh that was very bad. It had been sharp pains in the muscle of.my thigh. The muscle was bowed up. And, that day, it burned like fire. I was in agony. He ordered an ex-ray that showed nothing. I wanted  him to do an ultrasound to see if it my be a bloodclot or a growth.  He said since Dr. Rose had done a procedure on my varicose veins,  that she would have to do the ultrasound.  So, I went back to her. The tech did an  ultrasound immediately and found nothing.  I am to have a CT scan soon, ordered by Dr. Rose.  My leg is getting some better.  Dr. Lane has ordered an epidural for me on October 7th. He thinks my back may be the cause of all my hip and leg troubles.  We shall see.

name: Robert K Miller
text: Dr. Lane recently performed hip and knee surgeries on me following an accident. His office staff and surgical staff are amazing. They are professional,  polite and caring. They really put your mind at ease before the surgery. Dr. Lane meets with the patient's wife, family, significant other and explains in detail how the procedure went, what was completed and what to expect post-op. He provides them with a folder of post-op instructions,  contact information should any problems arise, pictures of the surgery  / injury and prescription meds. Surgery center personnel will call and check on you the day after to make sure there aren't any problems. I highly recommend Dr. Lane and AOC for your orthopedic / sports medicine needs. I will be back to running, hiking and playing racquetball in no time. Thank you!

name: Anne Sockwell
text:
I had a simply terrific medical experience at the Medical West Freestanding Emergency Department and the Hoover Health Center of the UAB Health System.  I fell on a flight of stairs and badly broke both the radius and the ulna of my forearm, below the wrist. The bones were badly out of place and I was very shocked and freaked out. We walked into the emergency room and it was a serene and quiet atmosphere. They told me I would be put into a room as quickly as possible and it happened very soon. People started tending to me immediately and I was given pain medicine. An x-ray machine was brought to the room so I was able to stay in bed while they did the films. As soon as they had the information from the x-rays, they gave me a “waking sleep” anesthesia while they moved the bones back into position (called reduction.). I felt nothing during the procedure, thank goodness.  When I woke back up, the pain was gone and my arm had been splinted so that the bones couldn’t move out of place. They put my arm in a sling and started asking me which doctor I would like to use for the surgery. We had no idea and started scrambling for information. We made some calls, and it was a week before anyone could even see us to evaluate.  The doctor who splinted my arm, Dr Herring, strongly suggested the orthopaedist in the building, Dr Stephen Gould. We looked Dr Gould up and he came from Johns Hopkins Hospital, so we thankfully said “Yes!”  Dr Herring had been sending all my films and information updates to Dr Gould from the  time I arrived. He was ready to see me that afternoon!  We simply walked down the hall from the room I had been in and I saw Dr Gould after a short wait. My surgery was scheduled in a few days and it happened at Medical West Hospital in Bessemer. There I had another Excellent experience from the UAB Health System!  The bones and incision have healed beautifully and I am sold - I am changing doctors so that I will be using this health system from now on. Thank you to Dr Herring and Dr Gould and staff who cared for me so well.
Anne Sockwell
Hoover, AL

Dr Gould advised me that there was a fractured fibula and it would take several months to heal. In my medical records a fractured fibula became a sprain ankle. Though there are x-rays showing a fractured fibula his office has refused to correct my records. This is totally unprofessional. He can make a mistake in his opinion yet he won't correct nor own up to it. Instead of orthopedic medicine you should just do autopsies.  You apparently don't have a clue as to what you're doing.

text: Writing on behalf on my mom, Carol! she seen Dr. Gould he was in the room no more than 5 mins! He "glanced" at an x ray to say nothing is broke, he would tell her he would refer her for MRI. Bedside manor per my mom: arrogant, rushed, no concern for patient! My mom asked how much MRI would be, the nurse told her a $40 copay, also Med Ctr West Radiology told her it would be a copay of $40 when she arrived for the MRI, gave her a receipt for $40 showing no balance due but she gets billed later for $160 more dollars! Her credit is perfect, has  never filed a complaint nor negative review in her life! But I am for her because she hand wrote this doctor explaining everything, its been months and he nor his staff never contacted her! Now she is getting collections letters!  After hearing her for months upset but now understanding, I have gotten involved!!! I fight cancer and I have been fighting 9 yrs so I am familiar with the medical field and billing - errors do happen on their part! They are not beyond making a mistake! Radiology at UAB West who did the MRI should have told her the correct copay amount before getting the scan! To assure the patient can pay before services rendered and to assure they get their money. It is common courtesy and practice for a pre-scheduled test or scan like that for the staff to have the correct copay available for the patient! Well they did not and on the phone and speaking to whoever was over billing at UAB West the lady got very rude and and said my mom should know what she should have paid~ I have never heard of such and they need to learn how to treat customers, last I check, patients and insurance companies pay their salaries! Regarding the doctors office, there is a Amy that seemed kind and is to be following up with my mom on the situation.

The following Monday afternoon I called the office to check on things as I had not been contacted.  Was told the doctor was not in not was the nurse.  The person on the phone was unable to look in the system to see if my information had been forwarded.  Said she would have the nurse check on it the next day. I am picking my xrays up and going elsewhere.

name: Diana Coggin
text:
I had a total knee replacement in August. Dr. Cowley may take a little warming up to because he is very business-like and not all warm and fuzzy, but he is a fantastic surgeon!! (I now look forward to seeing him in the halls where I work at Grandview Medical Center and talking with him!!!)
I had a genetic disposition to form blood clots after surgery and Dr. Cowley worked with my primary to establish a regimen to decrease that risk.
My knee surgery went GREAT!!! My physical therapists both said it was one of the best surgical scars they had seen while some scars look like a street map for a San Francisco street....I was walking without a walker in a week-and-a-half and without a cane a few days later. I am scheduling an appointment to have my other equally-bad and painful knee replaced in early February.
I have dealt with knee pain and other doctors with suggestions that I really needed surgery which I could not afford over the last 10 years. Dr. Cowley is a great surgeon and compassionate man...AND...is the only Dr. who asked me a question which prompted me to strike out to accomplish the first surgery...if not for him, I would still be limping around with two bad knees instead of one!!!

resp.text: Diana Coggin, thank you for the star rating and for taking the time to leave a review for Dr. Cowley. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We will pass along your comments to the team here at Grandview and to Dr. Cowley.  Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to share your positive experience. Have a great day!

name: Jeff Franklin
text:
Absolutely the worst patient processing timing ever.
Took mother due to awful pain in back. 2 1/2 hour wait to see doctor Heck. We got there 15 minutes before the scheduled time to be there. I am sure if we missed it they would want to charge for missing schedule. I am totally fed up with doctors that over schedule and then want to charge you if you are late. Not sure if I would go back if doctor recommended him. “Heck” I am not sure if he will show up!

Inexcusable for that type of waiting, especially when it is a back doctor.

name: Andrea F.
text:
Dr Heck saved my life.  Went to the ER at another hospital before seeing him and they thought I was trying to get drugs since I was complaining about back pain.  Dr heck took me seriously and did surgery even though my MRI wasn’t that bad.  Found out during surgery that I had a rare condition with abnormal nerves in my back. He said he sees this condition about every 2 years. The abnormal nerves were causing the pain - I felt like I was being electrocuted.
He also later performed a back surgery on my mother. Her back is much better now.  We were worried about her surviving the surgery due to her health.  She had a rough recovery - but overall her back is much better.  Highly recommend Heck.

resp.text: Amazing story, Andrea! Thank you so much for sharing it with us, and we're thrilled to hear about you and your family's outcomes. We'll make sure your praise is known to Dr. Heck and the whole team.

Dr. Heck was very nice n very knowledgeable about my concerns. We are going to try an option that has not ever been brought to my attention. I hope n pray it works.
Dr. Heck did give me some Hope for my back problems.

resp.text: Hi, Janice. Thank you for the wonderful review! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: Tasha Ambers
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is absolutely the WORST  orthopedic surgeon in Alabama!  Due to his incompetence, a simple disc herniation has resulted in me being disabled. What should have been a three week recovery has now been more than three years with no recovery!  He performed a second surgery and now I need a third.  After two years, and I decided to let God handle him and not sue him, he got very rude with me and told me he did not want to see me anymore and less I want another surgery. After countless procedures and  thousands of dollars in physical therapy, (22 weeks all together) I will now live with his incompetent error!  He definitely lives up to his name! He’s not worth a HECK!!!!

name: Leigh Pearson
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is so amazing!  He has performed a discectomy for my sister (herniated disc with a conjoined nerve root that he found during surgery, that was causing more pain than just a herniated disc would cause).  She is doing fantastic!  He also performed a fusion from L3/L4 to L5/S1 for my mother who suffers from severe spinal stenosis.  She went from a wheelchair to a walker, and the walker is only because she has neuropathy in both feet!  I cannot say enough about how wonderful this man is!  And he’s not only a smart and talented surgeon, but he’s kind and takes the time to listen to his patients (and their caregivers)!

resp.text: I appreciate the feedback you provided!

name: Angela Thornburg
text:
Dr. Heck is "The DOCTOR" to go see. He is personable, doesn't forget what is going on with you. He explains all procedures in detail with words and explanations that you understand.
With having 3 back surgeries before i was referred by Dr. Lawler from Oxford Alabama. My back kept becoming worse and the pain got to the point I couldnt take it anymore after hurting for about 6 years. Dr. Heck told me that he could help me but i had to have a long and extensive back surgery that was about 5 to 6 hours long. I was ready for anything and I left his office that day confident he would help me.
Dr. Heck came out 3 times during the surgery to speak to my husband to let him know how I was doing, and where he was in the surgery. That meant so much to my husband and me that he had that much consideration not to leave my husband wondering what was going on.
I came out of surgery that day PAINFREE, after 6 years of constant hurting.  I was Up walking around the hospital floor on the second day feeling like wonder woman, I went home on the 3rd day. I can also walk straight and stand straight. That was a bonus that I didn't know that could be fixed.
Everyone from the nurse care in recovery, the nurses there on the floor that took the most gentle and sweet care of me. The sweet people that brought your food, the folks that came to your room to get your food order, to the sweet sweet girls that cleaned my room were a joy to be around. GREAT HOSPITAL!!
Both of Dr Heck's office staff are great and attentive.  They Call You Right Back, friendly, and they get you right in to see him.
I can't say enough great things about Dr. Heck and his staff.  Go see him and get your hurting fixed by a Great Doctor!!! All I can say is Thank God for Dr. Heck because I can't say enough of good about him.

name: Angela Kulo
text:
About 2 months ago I started having pain in my hands, as a Casino dealer of 25 years, I make my money with my hands, I  researched for a hand Dr. in Mobile (I live in Mississippi) All the reviews were great.  I had my Dr. send a referral to Dr. Barbours office and an appointment was made. All staff was respectful and courteous.  EXCEPT Dr. Barbour. He blew me off and talked down to me,  like a second class citizen. I tried to convey my concerns and was cut off.  "All women have loose joints" ....How disrespectful! I went out of my way to find a good reputable Dr. and just wound up with ANOTHER ARROGANT WASTE OF MY TIME AND MONEY! I  was not there for a prescription, I  was there because I have a problem.  Needless to say my hands are still in pain and now I have to do it all again.
Don't bother with Dr. Barbour. Find someone who ACTUALLY wants to find a solution!

resp.text: We take your feedback seriously because we strive to exceed expectations for all patients. If you'd like to discuss this further, please call our office manager at (251) 476-5050 during regular business hours.

text:
This was my very first surgery ever and I have to say I was jollied along by Dr. Barbour and by his  anesthesiologist, Dr Crowell, who allayed my apprehension about the whole experience.  I was covered in pre-warmed blankets and interviewed most thoroughly by an attentive staff on procedure-day.
It was not necessary for me to take any pain medication past the initial block, no bruising, no swelling, no infection at all, and of course, no more symptoms of carpal tunnel restriction.  A big thank you, also, to Cris, Dr. B’s nurse, for his availability and patience in answering my fearful advance questions. Altogether, quite a positive experience.

name: Sierra’s Henderson
text: My mom has been suffering from thumb wrist pain for over a year.  We have went to her primary care physician several times.  She has received steroid shots in her thumb, taken ibuprofen,  used a spica splint, iced, rested, and attempted physical therapy and they said it was too swollen to do anything with it at this time.  She then got an X-ray and it said she had bone on bone arthritis.  She doesn’t have insurance, but we have paid cash for all treatments; therefore, her ex-husband volunteered to pay for her to see an orthopedic surgeon and pay for surgery if needed.  I am an ICU nurse and wanted to take her to her appointment because she is medical illiterate and I wanted to see what her options were to be able to help her decide what to do.  During this appointment, the doctor walked in and asked where she was hurting and for how long then told her she had bone on bone arthritis and then stood up like he was going to leave and said “Well do you have any questions.” Nothing was ever explained and no options were ever given.  This is when I spoke up and started asking questions about our options and he ended up giving her a steroid injection and said she would maybe need surgery in the future.  8 days after the injection, her hand is hurting, swollen, with loss of motion again, now I need to make another appointment, but I don’t know if I need to see the same doctor or try to see another doctor due to his lack of concern.  I felt as if she was treated differently because she didn’t have insurance, but I’ve heard raving reviews about Dr.Barbour so maybe he was having an off day and in his defense the office was crazy busy that day.

resp.text: Sierra,  we are sorry we did not meet your expectations. We would like to speak with your mother about her visit if she is available. Please ask her to call our office manager at (251) 450-2766 to discuss your specific issues.

name: Georgia Sanders
text: I appreciated the way I was quickly attended to with respect and kindness.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!

name: barbara j cochran
text: This was not the first experience with Dr. Barbour, he did a great job on both my thumbs, in 2003 & 2006.  Now he’ll have the opportunity to repair my elbow.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review!!

name: Nicole Riis
text: Dr. Barbour was prompt in seeing me, and he was very compassionate and thorough in his examination.  He formulated a plan to alleviate my pain. His staff was helpful and knowlegeable.

name: Jackie Pierce
text: Easy intake and quick turn around time getting back to see Dr. Barbour. What a great run office. Dr. Barbour is so kind, caring and really listens to everything I had to say. He NEVER made me feel rushed. I had X-rays and a custom splint molded to my hand and learned physical therapy exercise to do at home. Every part of my experience in Dr. Barbour's office was great!

name: Bonnie Blocker
text: They were all great 👏👏👏👍🏻🤗

resp.text: Thank you !!

name: T T
text: Appointment wa at 9:40 , they called me back at 11:28 so the wait was long. I work in foley, since they tell me to be there at 9:15 to fill out new patient paperwork mind you, the appointment was at 9:40 so I was there at 9:15 and finally went back at 11:28. Then when I get back there they wanted to do X-rays on my right wrist when the problem was my left. Finally they put me in room and about 5 minutes later dr comes in and reaches for my right hand and says : “so... you having problems with your right wrist “. I said “ uh no it’s the left.  He said , well they said it was your right. Well I spent 10 minutes in waiting room filling out a form and writing my complaints in plain English on the forms. That irritated me. Then the dr just stares at me when I find out that what the cause was . I asked him what I could do to help with the problem since surgery was not an option at this point he just stares at me with this look of you just asked me that. Finally I get my point across then he says do this and this and that and it might help for relief temporarily.then he says ok. Call us if you get worse and walks me out . I go to post check out desk. No one is there waited, then walked out to check in desk out front, no one there and I waited standing there for 5 minutes finally I just left. Didn’t know if there was a copayment but I know I had to get back to work it was 12:15 . I missed 3-1/2 hours of work basically for nothing.

name: Talmadge Cain
text:
I was very pleased. I was seen in time and everyone was professional.
Gym

resp.text: Thank you !!

Doctor Bourber rushed me through and didn’t listen and acted like, what are you doing here I’m a hand doctor. As if I didn’t know that, very unprofessional and disrespectful. This is the only review I’ve ever posted in my life, nothing against TOG hope he just had a bad day!

text: Although being a previous patient here my wife was told she had to have a doctor's referral to be seen again for a new injury which meant she had to wait to see a regular doctor so he could say she needs to see an orthopedic Dr asap. Paperwork was sent to this clinic on Thurs and when we called on Tuesday to see why we haven't gotten an appointment yet we were told "it hasn't been processed yet" now she has to wait almost a month for the "first available" appointment. And to top it off she was told she didn't need a referral after all! And this office can't call you if they have a cancellation, you have to call them daily if you want to have a chance to be seen faster

name: Karl GOULET
text: I had both my wrist done back to work in six weeks. He did a great job on me. My wife had Corporal tunnel to in her right hand a few years ago. She’s been great after he worked on her. No scar on my wife and mine are about gone

name: Carmie Carr
text:
Extremely rude front desk. I had a $25 copay. The appointment was for my husband. Since I had medicare and another supplemental I have never had to pay a copay.
I did not bring the correct credit card and the young girl at the desk said Dr. Ikard Jr would not see him unless we paid the $25 right then.
I told her I could call it in and she said I would need to reschedule if I did not have the $25 that day.
I feel any doctor who puts a value on a patient is not the kind if doctor I want to put my husbands care in.
If refusing a patient for $25 is our “new” new, then I’ll go somewhere else where my husband is worth more than $25 .
UOC is where money is far more important than a patients care.
They would have gotten their money if the front desk girl was more professional and would listen to me but we were blown off by her.
Thus my 1 star rating. If I could give a negative I would. Staff should show more understanding

name: Aaron Cano
text: Staff is not helpful and incompetent.... there is such a lack of communication and knowledge at the front desk. I was in Biloxi, Mississippi early that day. I called the office at 9:50am and asked if I get to the office 15 minutes late, could I still be seen. The receptionist said, “Yes, as long as it’s within 30 minutes of your scheduled appointment”. I knew that I can make my 3 hour and 50 minute drive in time to get there with 15 minutes to spare so I made the drive to Tuscaloosa. When I was 20 minutes from the office I called to ensure I can be seen and the same receptionist said no the doctor cannot see me. She completely contradicted her original statement and wasted a full 8 hours of driving and gas with no consideration to my particular situation. I will never recommend an office with an incompetent front desk staff and lack of care that I made a distant drive under unforeseen circumstances. If only they had the integrity to follow the original statement provided to me may I have had a totally different experience.

name: Teresa Atchenson
text: I WAS A PATIENT OF DR.JOHN P.BUCKLEY SINCE 1985.I LAST SAW THIS WONDERFUL MAN AND DOCTOR  IN FEB.OF 2017.THE NEXT FEB.I WAS TOLD HE RETIRED PREVIOUS DEC..I CRIED LIKE A BABY.HE WAS A DOCTOR THAT WAS CALM GOOD SPITIT,ALWAYS TOOK TIME TO ANSWER MY QUESTIONS.HE PASSED AWAY EARLY OF 2020.ONLY 2 YRS.OF RETIREMENT.IT BROKE MY HEART.LAST TIME I WAS AT UOC.WAS THE LAST TIME.I HAVENT SET A FOOT IN THERE SINCE DR.BUCKLEY PASSED.I TRIED TO GET AN APPT SINCE,BUT WAS TOLD SINCE MY DOCTOR RETIRED,I WOULD HAVE TO BE TREATED AS A NEW PATIENT.I TOLD THEM NO WAY.I WAS A PATIENT FROM 1985 - 2017.DR.BUCKLEY  ALL THOSE YEARS.THEY WANTED HIM OUT I WAS TOLD LAST TIME I WAS THERE NY A NURSE.THEY SAID HE TOOK UP TOO MUCH TIME WITH PATIENTS.HE WAS ONE OE DOCTORS THAT STARTED UOC IN 1974.THEY SHOULD BE ASHAMED.RIP DR.BUCKLEY.LOVE YOU❤.its true about rude staff too.

name: Latasha Hooper
text: Staff is very rude. I’ve called 6 times to schedule an appointment. Female that answers the phone catches an attitude very quickly.

name: Scott Shuttleworth
text: DO NOT USE THIS CLINIC!  Doctors may be good but the staff getting to them does not tell the truth and then cops attitude...I called a week before and specifically asked about them taking my insurance...they said yes the did...I specifically asked if they were network and they said yes...I made the appt and showed up after a 1.5 hour drive. Signed in, waited and they said they didn't have a referral from my doc...when they told me the week before they did...ok got that fixed...after waiting again they tell me they are in fact not in network for my insurance after I specifically asked that question prior to making the appt.  They told me I could be seen if I paid the amount for the visit but they wouldn't honor what they told me on the phone...after the clerk at the checkout window got cynical, I grabbed my imagery and stormed out for a 1.5 hour drive home only to find out that now I have to start over and find another doctor and live with this pain even longer...if possible and you have a choice, SEE ANOTHER CLINIC...DO NOT GO TO UNIVERSITY ORTHO!!!

name: Pamela Truelove-Walker
text: Dr. Thompson is a very thoughtful physician. He answers questions patiently, explains medical issues in practical terms, and offers multiple treatment options. He definitely listens to his patients and allows them input as it relates to surgical procedures. I HIGHLY recommend him for any Orthopaedic issues under his practice.

name: Alice Thomas
text: Dr Atkins Jr.  is great. Nice atmosphere. Wait time is very reasonable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Thank you for taking good care of me. Their physical therapy staff is wonderful.

name: Nancy Watkins
text: Dr. Ikard, Sr., did a full knee replacement for me 3 months ago.  A wonderful doctor who is very thorough and takes the time to listen to your concerns as well as answer any questions you may have about your surgery.  One of the most efficiently run offices I have been to - I don’t think I have ever waited more than 15 minutes to be called back.  Also the scheduler for the surgery was very nice and super efficient!  I had to have forms from my regular doctor and my cardiologist signed before the surgery could be scheduled.  She faxed those immediately and my surgery was scheduled for two weeks later.   All of the nurses, x ray technician and office staff could not have been nicer.   I would highly recommend the University Orthopaedic Clinic!

name: Leslie Alexander
text:
My son broke his hand and needed surgery. Dr. Claytor and his nurses were wonderful. Excellent bedside manner and helped this out of state mom feel better about surgery.
Scheduling and setting an appointment was a challenge because they were super busy in Monday. It was worth time I spent getting him scheduled because within 48 hours he was fixed up!

name: Pamela Richey
text: My appointment was at 8:00 o'clock. At 9:00 o'clock I went to the front desk to inquire if I would be seeing the doctor soon. I was told the doctor didn't come in until 9:00 o'clock and I was 4th in line to see him. Um..why schedule 8:00 o'clock appointments, if the doctor doesn't come in until 9:00 o'clock?

name: Rose Walker
text: The Doctors are the best.  The staff and nurse's are very friendly and helpful. I had knee surgery years ago and the doctor and nurse's took excellent care of me. Would recommend to my family and friends. Thank you UOC

name: Taylor Hollis
text: Dr Callahan was great. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Dr. Callahan got me in and out and knew his stuff! Looking forward to working with them in the future.

name: Kaitlyn Moore
text: Dr. Scott, outstanding workers comp experience.  Listens well. Sweat, friendly love him to death. Overall best doc visits I've ever had on anything.

name: Judy Craig
text: Dr.Scott and all the staff have been great at both of my appointments. I didn't feel like I was being rushed out. All around good experience. Would definitely recommend to others.

name: SPoKie DoKie
text: Amazing job. Not only is my affected area healing very well, they even took care to stitch my tattoo back together so there’s no damage. They have kept me informed every step of the way and I have never once been caught offguard with something. I couldn’t recommend them enough.

name: Sandra Dickie
text: Dr. Ikard Jr and UOC are very caring and professional! I could not ask for a better team of medical professionals. Everyone that greeted me from my arrival to my leaving were helpful, kind and encouraging.

name: Andrea Walker
text: My daughter had an knee injury. After being referred to Dr. Scott my daughter and I no idea what to expect. Visits before and after surgery were better than either of us could have imagined. Every step and any questions we had were explained to us with knowledge. Doctor and staff were amazing in both Tuscaloosa and Fayette locations.

name: TipTip *
text: My therapy went well, but I felt as if I needed more time. This was not a work injury, I paid for therapy myself. When I requested more therapy from them I was met with a negative attitude and response.

name: Sabrina West-Bullock
text: Dr.Ikard Sr. is the BEST! I've been under his care for a cyst on my foot. The care he gives, along with his bedside manners, are qualities any patient would dream of having.  He always makes me feel as if I'm being taken care of by a family member or close friend.  My experiences with him and the UOC were exceptional.

name: Charles Burton
text: I would have been a new patient except for the utter rudeness of the receptionist staff. The first young lady talked about me to her colleague as if I wasn't standing there and literally tossed the clipboard on the counter without saying a word. I shrugged my shoulders as to say, "what exactly are you asking me to do?" Her response and tone were totally dismissive and rude. Then, while trying to complete the forms, I was called back to the desk to be asked by the second young lady when I could reschedule. When I asked why I would need to reschedule, I was met with attitude and, again, a dismissive attitude. Admittedly, I was a few minutes late. However, as a potential new patient, I had no idea they had different locations at the time I scheduled the appointment. Therefore, my slight tardiness is attributed to that. I'm sure the actual medical staff is great. However, I can only imagine a loss of business due to the privileged and dismissive attitude of the staff you encounter when you walk thru the door. I will definitely be taking my business elsewhere.

name: Renee Adams
text: I received great care from a professional and caring staff. I’m no longer in debilitating pain after surgery, and so very grateful to Dr. Atkins and his staff.

name: Nell Taylor
text: Dr. Standerffer has been caring for my son and I for more than 10 years and every visit has been excellent. He is caring and patient and I’d recommend that anyone needing orthopedic care see him.

name: Jennifer Ward
text: The doctors a great! However, the front desk lady that sits to the left behind the two ladies in the immediate front at the Northport location is one of the RUDEST ladies I've ever encountered!! She makes  this office look BAD!

name: Barbara Allen
text: The lady who conducted the x-ray study was so kind, gentle, and caring. Dr. Buckley is truly a God send. I was majorly impressed with his wealth of knowledge and his ability to articulate so plainly what was going on with my shoulder. I left the clinic feeling like a million dollars and I have not had any left shoulder pain since treatment at the clinic. Thank you so much ‼️😀

name: Taura
text: Dr. McKibbon is awesome. I appreciate him taking the time to explain everything about my injury & the best treatments for healing. 👍

name: Danita Lightning

name: Emmogene Edge
text: Its comforting to find medical services that match or exceed one's former services when one has moved to another state. I found the services at UOC in Tuscaloosa , to be wonderful. They are kind and patient. The staff and my new doctor have inspired my trust and given me confidence to go forward with the prescribed treatment my knees need. Thank you !

name: Mickey Dehaan
text: Dr. Standefer is the best surgeon.  He takes his time to explain things.  I also appreciate how he explains his " plan of care & course of actions".  Annex at Bryant Drive way too many chairs in such a small waiting room.  Every time a patient got up, I had to guard and repositioning my new total knee to avoid it getting smacked into.

name: Sherry Barr
text: Horrible. Made our appointment and gave insurance information in “advance”. They knew my son was in pain but would not see him without a referral from the university student center, even though we went to ER the night before. (But they did not tell us this before we showed up to the appointment) Made us fill out a book load of paperwork and then broke the news. Not concerned at all that this was their mistake, they didn’t even try to make any exception because he was in pain. Rude. Neverrrr again!

name: George Osborne
text: Excellent all the way around. Dr Thompson has operated on me 4 times. Each time my problem was corrected. Follow up visits were great. Very caring and helpful staff. I highly recommend University orthopedic clinic.

name: Betty Hancock
text: Dr. Ikard, Sr did my knee replacement in 2004. He was wonderful and a very precious person. He is such a gentle speaking doctor. He later did carpal tunnel surgery on my right hand and put a cortisone shot in my left hand for carpal tunnel. When my left hand began hurting severely again I called to see Dr. Ikard. I was told he only worked with knees. I was told i could see Dr Callahan for my hand. I saw him yesterday and he said i had end stage arthritis in my thumb joint. He put a shot in it. He was very serious. I wish he would please talk a little more and just have a more pleasant way. I get very nervous around a dr like him. Please Dr Callahan understand, i think you are a knowledgeable dr, but kindness sure helps alot. Dr John Newcomb in Nport Dch er is a very good example of a compassionate dr.

name: Denise
text: Dr. Tosh Atkins is by far the Best Ortho Doctor...He knows his stuff. ...He performed knee and shoulder surgery as of today I feel 120% better...If Dr. Atkins was near me right now...I'd give him a great big kiss...."Thank You and Kudos to a Job Well Done Dr Atkins"

name: Jill Carroll
text:
Everyone from the receptionist to the nurses, to the doctors are friendly knowledgeable and very professional. For joint pain and issues I would not go anywhere but to Dr. Atkins. I had a total knee replacement in my right knee over 20 years ago,  and have not had one minute’s trouble.  Truly appreciate
UOC and their staff.

name: Tyra Hoggle
text: Dr. Claytor is an amazing doctor and his staff is very professional.  Highly recommend!!

name: Amie Lemley
text: UOC has both great orthopedic physicians and ancillary staff! From the waiting room, to the X Ray techs, to check out, everyone was friendly and helpful!

name: April Soleil
text: That’s great if you’re well experienced and have a reason to come across somewhat arrogant (my uncle is an oncologist and he is a bit arrogant) however when you act like you’re better and in a hurry, have an attitude and say “I told her that I couldn’t aspirate” to the workers as soon as he’s coming back into the door, and bent out of shape because a patient asks questions, and overall a douche attitude- NO THANK YOU!!! Won’t be back. His presence made me feel inferior and less than and like I bothered him to keep him longer than a minute. I like friendly people, personally. If you would like to encounter a straight up a** then Dr Thompson at Northport DCH Medical Plaza (UOC) would be the one! Eek. Never again. I won’t be back to see him unless he wants to see a dose of his own medicine- no pun intended. Good luck boss man. The other staff were great (as why I left more stars than ONE) and I am only referencing Dr Thompson at UOC (Northport DCH medical plaza)

name: Q Crews
text: Dr. Ikard Jr. and the staff here are wonderful people. Kind and courteous, and always listen to your concerns. I will take my future injuries here above all others. Lol

name: Hanny Daddy

name: James Mills Jr
text: Dr. Atkins and the staff at UOC are first class. Friendly, efficient, compassionate and talented. I would definately recommend them for your orthopedic needs.

name: Jerry Henson
text: I was extremely pleased with my visit with Dr. Atkins who is a very professional and friendly physician.  He spent a very adequate amount of time with me and answered all of my questions expertly and with clarity.  I would indeed recommend him to all of my family and friends.

name: Pecola Collins
text: Excellent care and the staff is very very nice and caring people. I would recommend UOC   To all of my friends and family!

name: Gunars Cazers
text: This place has it all together. The doctors and staff are comforted and friendly. I have used both the main office in the annex. My only gripe is that they cannot schedule an appointment six months in advance. Their computer program does not go that far in advance. They need to fix it.

name: Lynn Norris
text: University Orthopaedic has been great to meet the needs of my husband and me this year. We have used the physicians offices, MRI, and the therapy staff and  facilities. We highly recommend them to anyone needing Orthopaedic services.

name: Bonnie Buck
text: Dr. Standeffer does a great job explaining situations and concerns. He is kind with helpful advice, especially regarding my health as an older patient and medicines. My shoulder surgery went very well. His encouraging personality helps me to try harder. When you are in pain that can be tough. Excellent doctor and staff.

name: John Perry
text: All I can say is excellent from entry to exit. Kind and effecient office staff. Kind, efficient and competent medical professionals with the procedure.

name: Judith Ingram
text: This was my first experience with Dr. Scott and his office and I was extremely pleased with the service I received. From check-in to check-out the entire staff was friendly and concerned about the patient.

name: Pat Gregg
text: My family has used UOC for many years.  From knee replacements, shoulder surgery, knee scopes etc., we have always been pleased with the caring staff and excellent doctors.  We have a special affinity for Dr. Atkins as he literally put my brother back together after a horrific motorcyle accident.

name: Mary Peacock
text: Dr. Scott and staff were very professional and had excellent bedside manor. They do an awesome job explaining to us the process and answering any questions we had.

name: Teresa Jackson
text: The BEST doctors in Tuscaloosa hands down and I Love the staff so much because they’re the SWEETEST EVER ❤️

name: Jane Richardson
text: The physicians & staff are wonderful; the wait time are acceptable. The quality of patient care is simply outstanding!

name: Emily DeFrance
text:
This post is to make others aware of UOC's internal accounting issues. I personally experienced this situation below on 10/08/2018. If you get a bill from them, double check everything. They are trying to make patients responsible for their own adjustment errors back in 2014. They just caught these errors they made in 2018 because they waited 4 years to audit their books. That being said.......my story below.

UOC is a good organization and has always done a great job whenever I have visited their office. However, I recently received a bill out of the blue saying I owed over $300.00. First and foremost, I pay my bills on time and do not let my accounts become delinquent. I called their office to find out why I received a letter saying I owed money since I was recently just in their office and they never mentioned this balance before. I found out they recently did an audit on September 28th, 2018 and realized they made an internal accounting error from 4 years ago. So when my account was adjusted back from THEIR mistakes, my account showed an open balance and they sent me a bill demanding payment.

Long story short - Their company made an internal accounting error and they just caught this 4 years later and are now trying to back charge their patients for their OWN mistakes in their accounting department. I went down to their office and they were not willing to work things out with me based off of their own negligence in their bookkeeping department. Not until I told them that my attorney and I were going to sue them and I was going to bring in Fox 6 News on your side (to expose their company with what they were doing behind the scenes to their patients) did they try to eliminate my bill from where they made a mistake (now my patient balance is zero - how convenient). I have never heard of any type of business back charging someone for THEIR own mistakes. It's called have a check and balance system in place, perform a yearly audit on your books and train your office staff to do their jobs correctly.

name: Paul Arnold
text: I have been going to UOC for over 10 years and just had a total knee replacement. I was back at work in 6 weeks due to their great Physical Therapy. Dr. Standeffer has always spent extra time explaining things to me and the staff is always friendly.

name: Tracie Barnett
text: My daugther had an appointment to at 8:30 with Dr. Standefer for a cyst that has ruptured. It is painful & swollen! When she got there they took her copay then told her they couldn't see her because her appointment was at 8:00. My daugther told the receptionist that she received a text reminder yesterday that said 8:00. So the receptionist said the text was wrong & she would have to reschedule. Ok that automatic text system belong to them so that was the Dr office fault so I feel like they should have seen her. So I called & talked to the unconcerned receptionist trying to explain to her that my daughter really need to see the Dr today because it was not her fault. She said you want to reschedule because those are Dr. Standefer rules. He told them to tell me to tell her to put a brace on it. She been wearing the brace every since it ruptured. My daughter got to wait another week to see the Dr & be in pain. I just want you all to know God sit high & looks low. You all did my daughter wrong today but you don't have to worry about doing her wrong again. I pray nobody ever do your daughter or son the way you did my daughter today! WHAT GOES AROUND COMES AROUND!!!!  It's so hard as a parent to heard your child crying because they are tired of hurting & there's nothing you can do. Thank God for a Dr & receptionist that was concerned about my daugther hand. She has an appointment...Thank God for favor!!!!

name: Richard Rand
text: Great doctors, great specialists, great nurses, great secretaries.  A truly exceptional team, working together with great efficiency and consideration for the patient.

name: May Hicks
text: Dr. Standefer is a wonderful doctor and has done an outstanding job on multiple injuries I acquired in a car accident. I would highly recommend him or any of his assistants to anyone with any bone or joint injuries. Thank you again Doctor for your superior work and wonderful attitude as well.

name: Jackie Fochtmann
text: Great office staff and Dr. Standeffer is the best.  I have always had a pleasant experience here.

name: Leslie Draper
text: Super friendly staff.  Doctor was very thorough, compassionate, and accommodating. Highly recommended.

name: Twanda White
text: Friendly staff and Dr. Thompson was very nice and precise.

name: Sherry Ellis
text: Pleasant atmosphere. Excellent service from nurse and doctor. Receptionist friendly and provided great service with check in.

name: Rheonna Wiuff
text:
I came to Dr. McKibbin for a second opinion regarding surgery for an ankle injury. I was pleasantly surprised.  His office nurse was very kind, thorough and professional. Took her time taking careful notes and history. Dr. McKibbin was very thoughtful in his questions, physical exam, and spent time reviewing my history,  MRI, Xrays, and Dr.'s notes. He took time more going over my case than I expected. In the end he gave a me his opinions and assessment regarding my injury and treatment.
UPDATE! After seeing Dr. MCKIBBIN for months, him collecting payments for seeing me and telling me one thing about my injury and long term prognosis. He SOLD OUT to the Workmen’s Comp Insurance that pays him and F-ed me out of a fair Work Comp Claim. My injury, as he agreed, I will suffer with the rest of my life and have to make major lifestyle changes to live with. However, he gave Work Comp a different story and assessed me at 0.
Choose your Dr’s carefully, especially if you have a work related injury! If I had known, I would have asked him at the first visit about his rating history and who he felt his loyalty goes to?
If you have a Work Comp case
DO
NOT
CHOOSE
DR.
MCKIBBIN!!!!!!!
He’s a sale out for the insurance check. As long as he gives them low grade assessments and they don’t have to pay out money to the injured parties he stays on their payroll and they send him more patients and it all starts over again.

name: Patricia Pritchett
text: Very efficient and and very comfortable with the staff and Dr Atkins going again as soon as time allows

name: Kristen Watkins
text: I had my knee surgery here several years ago and was very pleased.  My ENTIRE family uses UOC when we need an orthopedic specialist.  One family member in particular uses them for cortisone injections every few months.  The same family member had an accident over the Christmas holiday and needed to be seen after being seen in the E.R. She called to schedule an appointment and was told that it will be Monday Jan. 4TH before they can get her in unless there is a break or fracture.  So she had to go to her primary doctor after the E.R.(pay another 35.00 copay after the 150.00 E.R. copay) to have him order more x-rays.  I called to see if there was any way to get her in trying to explain the situation that she couldn't wait another 6 days even if it wasn't broke or fractured (she can't put any weight on it and its about the size of a softball)  when she originally injured her foot on Dec. 23rd and the receptionist said there was nothing she could do so I ask to speak to the office manager.  I was transferred to Jennifer Germain.  I have never in my life had someone yell at me like she did.  I was a firm believer in UOC until now.  I bet if the physicians knew this is how their practice was being ran they would probably make several staff changes starting with Ms. Germain.  I know that every place of business has rules and I have worked with the public for several years, so I truly get it.  But to yell at someone..... WOW! I don't care if I broke every bone in my body. I'll never be back.( if it was around a holiday it wouldn't matter... they wouldn't be able to fit me in anyways!)

name: Rose Boyd
text: My Dr. was great; his staff not so much. They were not very friendly, could be condescending, but when you get through the surgery and first few office visits - I highly recommend UOC PT!  This is why I rate 5 stars..The staff is exceptional and very friendly. I never once dreaded going to PT. I had rotator cuff surgery and during my therapy sessions Will and/or Stephen would tell me exactly what they were doing and why they were doing it. They were supportive and encouraging.  I felt like a part of the UOC PT family on my first visit.

name: Kenneth Tingle
text: Every time I visit UOC I’m there 2 to 3 hours and thats ridiculous.   Just for a shot.  The doctors are good but the wait time is horrible

name: Jennifer Mack
text: Friendly staff, pleasant atmosphere and no time wasted.

name: A snarling Fetus
text: I had a terrible experience here. They deleted my last review off of this page, because I was not at all satisfied with the "treatment" I received here. I was made fun of by the staff for wanting to put my broken tibia in a hard cast. When they finally took it off they xrayed my leg again and it was still broken. At this point the doctor told me I was fine, and I should immediatly start walking on it. This was definitly not the case, and I am expecting to have surgery now 6 months later to fix the 2 completly disalligned tendons these idiots failed to even recognize. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME with these people.

name: Kimberly Grammer
text: As always Dr. Standerfer and staff was caring and professiona! I called 1 day and was given an appointment within days.

name: Heather Spires
text: A bunch of sweet staff !! Had me in and out in no time !

name: Brett Grady
text: I had both knees worked on, separately. By Dr.Claytor. he is really good. He will do a great job, and you will get the proper pre and post op treatments, and meetings. You will be glad if you choose him. I had repair of the meniscus due to tears. I am now doing a lot better. I am glad I got the surgery done. I have never waited to long for an appointment. The Dr. Is top notch...i can say because of how I feel after the procedures. The staff at the Tuscaloosa clinic, and the Northport clinic are always friendly, kind, professional, and always smiling. Appropriately smiling...no fakers here! They want you to feel good, and I always did, and still do. These people know what proper bedside manner is, and I thank them for it. The surgical center at Northport is equally kind, curtious, professional, caring...if it sounds like I am pitching for them...no, I am telling you that if you need this type of help/care...UOC...that is where you find it.

text: Dr Adkison's visit might be the best medical office experience I've ever experienced. He listened to my problems and discussed his diagnosis  with me and gave me injections to relieve the pain. name: Lynn Carmichael
text: Love Dr. Adkison and his staff. I had a complicated recovery and he was encouraging though the past ten months. I would highly recommend seeing him!

name: Christi Hamlin
text: Dr. Adkison's office runs like a well oiled machine. Not only is the treatment you get top notch, but they value your time. No waiting an hour in the lobby, only to sit in an exam room waiting again. They get you in and out without you feeling rushed. I wish all doctors managed their office similarly. Plus, Dr. Adkison is just a great doctor. Easy to get to, as well - just park in the deck, take the crosswalk and keep walking until you see his office. Everyone was wearing masks, too, which I appreciated.

name: Brian Cauble
text: I have absolutely no complaints. Dr Adkison is professional and easy to talk to. He really knows his stuff, and if you have shoulder issues, go to see him.

name: Elizabeth Hughes
text:
Dr. Adkison is a fabulous surgeon. I had to have both shoulders replaced one in the summer during Covid and the other in the spring 8 months later.
I had no pain and his team ensured the small amount of medicine I needed was ok for me.  His scheduler Tammy was always helpful.  I have done the recommended PT and am amazed and thankful for his surgical skills.

name: alliedenton1
text: The staff was friendly and efficient. Dr. Adkinson is fantastic. He takes his time with you and answers all of your questions. Excellent physician with a caring bedside manner. Highly recommend.

name: kip Patterson
text: Dr Adkison repaired my right shoulder 12 years ago full tear in rotator. 4 weeks ago he did the same for my left. I am 90% range and zero pain. I trust Dr Adkison and his staff. He is the best! Birmingham Alabama is a better place to live with care available like Dr Adkison.

name: Paul Hayes
text: Dr. Adkinson was great! He was very thorough in the exam and found a tear another physician missed. He did a repair on a full thickness tear in my rotator and a labrum repair. Two days post op I got rid of the sling, and stopped the pain meds and went to tylenol and Advil only. In a week I had full range of passive motion. 5 weeks out full active range of motion. I absolutely would recommend all of my family see him

name: Princie Scott
text: Dr. Adkison is a wonderful orthopedic doctor.  He operated on my shoulder for a torn rotator cuff and a tear in the labrum.  The day after surgery when I went to physical therapy, I had great movement and very little pain. After 3 months of physical therapy, I am 100%.  I would recommend Dr. Adkison for anyone who needs shoulder surgery.

name: Jay Williams
text: Visit with Dr. Adkison was great. He took the time to explain what is wrong and my options. Parking and locating the office in the hospital complex where a little challenging, Allow extra time.

name: Danny White
text: Having my shoulder repaired was a scary thing to do, but the professionalism and bed side manners of Dr. Adkinson was very reassuring and calming.  I was treated like a friend, not a patient. Every aspect after the procedure was a pleasure, including the office visits. I was taken in early virtually every time, and was finished prior to my actual appointment time. I could not be more satisfied! Should there be another need in the future, Dr. Adkinson is the only one I would consider.

text: Dr Adkison is the Man he is number one in my opinion. He did a complete reverse shoulder replacement surgery after I had a none repairable rotator cuff.

name: Brandon George
text: I have never given a bad review, but this whole process was very hard. Trying to speak to anyone at his office was very difficult. It took almost 2 weeks of leaving messages on their answering service every 3 days (I did not call them daily. I imagine that would be annoying if your were busy) to get my visit scheduled. The visit was great. The doctor seemed nice and was very thorough. I told the doctor I could call to set up my surgery that afternoon after speaking with my wife. He gave me their direct number so I would not have the same problem of not being able to speak to someone. I called 2 hours later to set up the appointment. I was sent straight to voice mail. I left a message, and my call was not returned. I called again Monday morning and left another message. I never mentioned the problems I had about not getting my calls returned. I am always polite and understanding, but this got very aggravating.  My call was not returned Monday either. I called once again Tuesday afternoon. Straight to voice mail. I called the office's main line number, and told them I am having a problem trying to speak to anyone. They put me on hold, and the coordinator I had been trying to reach answered. She was very nice. She told me they were very busy, and would not have a surgery appointment available for another month and a half. I said it would probably be best if I saw another doctor. She then said she may have an opening in 9 days. I told her that would be awesome. She said let her check a couple of things and she would call me back in a few minutes. Minutes! She did not return my call. I would need physical therapy after the surgery, and there is no way I could possibly go through all that to set up more appointments. I think they may be too busy for new patients. I had to go back to their office, and pay for parking to get my MRI back. I wasted 3 weeks, my co pay, and parking fees. Very frustrating! I called another Orthopedic doctor's office, and they returned my call in 30 mins. and set up an appointment to see their doctor for 3 days later. That being said, Dr. Adkison seems like a great doctor, and the staff is very friendly. Maybe this is just a really busy time.

name: Ashley Goodwin
text: Dr. A is the best surgeon my family member has ever had. However, the staff member you have to go through for physical therapy, pain meds, and follow up appointments is a total jerk. She cares about noone but herself and couldn't care less about the patients.

name: Michelle Norwood
text:
I first saw Dr. McKean in February for a second opinion after seeing another surgeon. I was so impressed with his bedside manner and taking the time to actually sit done and explain what he needed to do to my ankle and what was wrong with it. I was blown away by what he told me that the other surgeon never told me. Scheduled surgery in March.
Today was my 3 week follow up from having Achilles’ tendon surgery and I still think he is amazing. I highly recommend Dr. McKean if you have any ankle or foot pain.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Michelle! We will be sure that your kind words are passed along to Dr. McKean.  Thank you for trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

name: Korin
text: Best doctor ever!!  Super attentive.  The Orthopedic Group has wonderful doctors and staff.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Korin! We appreciate your kind words. Thanks for trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

name: C P
text: Dr McKean is a very good doctor. He is extremely knowledgeable and he cares for his patient. You will see he takes the time to spend with you to make certain you are comfortable with treatment. I couldn’t speak higher of Dr McKean.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Clarence! We appreciate your kind words about Dr. McKean. Thank you for trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

name: Marie Knight
text:
Dr McKean did fantastic work on putting my ankle back together after I broke it in 3 places!

After several months of “getting better”using various methods and seeing Dr. McKean, I’ve been walking on my foot for a few months now with great improvement. Yesterday I was released from Providence PT and today released by Dr. McKean. If you need Physical Therapy, I highly recommend Providence Rehabilitation for your PT and Dr. McKean as your Orthopaedic Doctor. The Orthopaedic Group is the best!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We are so glad you are doing great !!!

name: Brenda Palmer
text: I have been going to this practice for 15 years or more. The entire staff is very friendly, courteous and they treat you like family there is nothing I would change about any of them. What can I say about Dr Edward Kissel? There's only one thing I can say, he's the best thing since sliced bread. I will always put my Orthopedic trust and care in his hands. ❤

name: Jane Clayton
text: This was an awesome experience!  The full use of my left knee was restored to normal in less than four weeks. The prescribed in home therapy was tough but the exact thing needed to insure my knee healed properly.  Dr Kissels staff was kind, warm and ready to help at any time. Thank you for this wonderful experience.

name: Bob Bruner
text: Dr. Worthen, the x-ray tech and his nurse assistant who administered my knee injection were all very thorough in their observations and recommendations for treatment. I felt like they all listened to what I had to say. Everyone was friendly and I didn't feel like my time with them was rushed.

name: jimkuyk thrthtyjty
text: I've never had a more complete explanation of a procedure ever!  I have every confidence in procedure, staff and equipment. This is very exciting to know every step that will be taken in my upcoming surgery.  We need more men of this caliber in the field. WOW, I can't wait.

name: Brenda McClain
text: Dr. Kissel has so much experience and is a kind soul.  No arrogant bone in his body.  He has operated on my husband and on me.  Have recommended him to my friends.  You will never be disappointed.

text: Best ortho ever!  Truly have me my life back.  Had double knee replacement.  Got checked today and still doing great 4 years out. HIGHLY recommend Dr Worthen !

name: Barry Shipman
text: Dr. David  Adkison and staff are the top in the shoulder surgery industry. I had shoulder surgery 14 years ago from another doctor evidently he didn't do it right the pain was unbearable and my shoulder was never the same.  I fell a couple of months ago and reinjured my shoulder. This time i went to Adkison. The pain was not even close to what i had experienced.  Just the feeling I've had in 24hrs was relief. As I see it there is no better Dr or staff. Thank you Tammy and Dr. Adkison , for you compassion, caring and professionalism.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Mr. Shipman and your trust in our practice and Dr. Adkison for your orthopedic care.  We hope you are recovering well!

name: James Mayfield
text: Very caring professional and knowledgeable

name: Sondra Personal
text: Dr. Worthen is very respectful. I need my left knee replaced after having a total knee replacement on my right knee 3 years ago. It was horrible, so I've been desperately looking for any other option. Dr. Worthen patiently explained how the burning pain, severe swelling and leg cramps I had with the first knee replacement were uncommon, but confidently confirmed that surgery was my best option. He assured me that he does not ignore his patients' pain or let his patients suffer for weeks without doing something to help them. He was genuine and I believed him. When I finally decide to get a knee replacement he will be my pick out of the 6 doctors I have seen while looking for another alternative. Dr.Worthen was the first to listen and address my fears and concerns.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Sondra!  We're glad you had a great experience with Dr. Worthen.  We pride ourselves on providing compassionate and thorough care.

name: florence bradley
text: I had a great experience seeing Dr. Sophia Lai here.  The staff did an awesome job of working me in without a prior appointment.  I do recommend making an appointment in advance since this is a very busy office.  Dr. Lai has many years experience in treating sports related injuries and she is exceptional in treatment of runners and triathletes who need to recover to a high level of fitness.  She was patient and took time with me to answer some follow-up questions I had concerning what excercises I could do and what I must stop doing to heal. I highly recommend her to everyone trying to get back on their feet and off running, riding, etc. again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words on Dr. Lal! We hope you're recovering well!

name: Kim Cloud
text: Everyone was friendly and informative

name: Pat King
text: more than met my expectations

text: I have been with Dr Worthen, he helped me with a botched knee surgery. Highly recommend him, best out there. Then Dr Hurowitz helped me with foot pain. I went to a podiatrist for over a year with no relief. Went to him and within a week pain is now leaving quickly. A simple exercise that I was never told about from the other. Love this team here! Rate all a huge 10!!

name: Scott Watson
text: If you are active duty or retired military, this practice does not accept Tricare.  If you care about your veterans and active duty service members, I recommend finding another group to work with that does provide care for those who have served us. I can report Andrews, does accept Tri-Care and Dr. Dugas was incredible.  Go 100 yards down the hill and get exceptional care!

name: David Seidel
text: Everyone was helpful and attentive.  They were interested in helping me and gave me advice on options

text: Saw Dr. Bowman on today! I was not impressed! He seemed uninterested in where my pain was and what I had to say. I also felt rushed! I felt as if he was making excuses for not finding out the root  cause of my knee pain that came from a fall 6 weeks prior that was explained that wakes me up, hurts constantly, and I have limited bending. Gave me a shot and said come back in a month.

text: Dr Atkinson is a awesome surgeon!! He operated on My husband rotary cup !! Outstanding job !!

name: Lydia Blanton
text: I met Dr. Worthen for the first time this week after being frustrated with other physicians who had exhausted their skills with my orthopedic needs. Dr. Worthen was very patient with me & very understanding to my questions & concerns. He made me feel like I wasn't so easy to give up on & that there was hope & direction for fixing issues with my knee injury that other doctors couldn't find a solution to. I am definitely looking forward to working with him more & continuing care with him & his staff. Everyone from the front desk staff (Miss Gloria) to his nurse (sorry I can't remember her name) to Dr. Worthen himself were absolutely phenomenal! I cant thank them enough & will definitely be recommending St. Vincent's Orthopedics to everyone I know!

name: Regina Bearden
text: I have seen Dr. Hurowitz, Dr. Wagner and Dr. Johnson and they all are excellent.  The staff is very nice and helpful.

name: J Elliott
text:
Great staff. Dr. Adkinson is the best for rotator cuff surgery. Very personable and not rushed.
Dr. Hurowitz was very good at explaining and detailing issues with my ankle . He writes his diagnosis on a sheet of paper for you to take it home so you can research on the internet. Spends a great deal of time with you.
Dr. Bowman,  just met him yesterday because of hip and knee issues.He was very good at explaining what was going on. Thank goodness no surgery required. If did need surgery in the future I would recommend him. Like the other two listed very good personality.

text: I switched from Dr. Maddox because he did not seem to care, his dismissive  and lack of procedure explanation. He was also quick to perform surgery instead of using it as last resort. Dr. Licht seem to genuinely care about me, explained everything she was going to to and offered other  for the present  besides going straight to surgery. I strongly recommend her!!

name: Kim Page
text:
I  made a mistake and thought my appointment was at 9: 30 am but it was really at 8:30 am. Dr. Licht's staff told me if I could wait until 10:00  that
Dr Licht would see me. I thought that was so kind of them to see me and not make me have to make another appointment. This was my first time seeing this doctor and I  was told I needed surgery on my hand and wrist. She was very nice and explained everything I needed to know prior to my surgery.
I'm so glad that The doctor and her staff was so knowledgeable and put me at ease about my upcoming surgery.

name: Brenda King
text: Guidance to the proper floor and waiting area was very courteous. The entire check-in was pleasant. Dr. Licht seems to be a very nice lady. She seems knowledgeable and checked my problem out thoroughly. Hands on isn't something you see much lately, but she checked me out. I appreciate that. She seems caring and understanding.. I'm looking forward to her care for me.

name: Patricia Wellington
text: I had the opportunity to meet Dr. Litch today, and was highly satisfied with the level of service that I received. She was very thorough and had first hand knowledge of making her assessment of my health care.

text: Dr Licht is an awesome doctor. She made me feel so at ease about taking my injections. Highly recommend her for your hand Specialist.

name: patrick shaun gray
text: I had to call the administration because the Dr refused to complete my exam and walked out on me.   I was not rude or loud.  I stated during the exam I know what she is trying to do but she was hurting me.  She was doing an exam on my right elbow after a work place accident.  She came in annoyed because the X-rays were limited due to my range of motion in my right arm.  She then started a physical exam and while doing so she twisted my arm while extended out palms face up. I pulled back and said that hurt.   It’s a sharp direct pain.  She then asked me to bend my arm at a 90degree angle. She told me to try when I stated I was not able.  This hurt as well, she pressed on my arm my attempting to comply.  I pull back and told her I know what she is trying to do but this is hurting me.   She walked out on me.  Then she stated to the workman comp rep I refused treatment. This was a false statement.  I never refused, I never said no, and I never walked out. She stopped the exam and quit.   I expected better from a professional.   This was uncalled for!  This Dr forgot I am a patient as well as a customer.    Part of her job is customer service.  The rest of the staff was very helpful and polite.  I recorded each interaction and have since filed a complaint for her unprofessionalism and her false accusations.    I suggest to anyone record each interact with the voice record option on your phone and use this as proof for if such a Dr  uses her title to state lies against you

name: Mike Council
text:
I highly recommend Dr. McAndrew and his staff. I enjoy his friendly manner and laid back personality. He is a great surgeon. His support staff are really good too.
However, not so happy with Alabama Orthopedic. The waiting area is overcrowded with no possibility of social distancing. Even for a morning appointment, the parking lot is full as is the waiting area. Hardly any waiting patients wear masks. Nobody is cleaning seats or attempting to sanitize seats or counters. For my 9:15 am  appointment, I waited in the general waiting until 11:40 then was finally moved to a hallway waiting area for another hour before seeing the doctor.

My injury required surgery scheduled for a future date.  Seven days proir to surgery I was required to post payment for co-payment. On the day of my surgery I arrived at 11:45 am for a scheduled surgery at 12:15. Due to COVID rules, my wife was required to wait in her vehicle in a parking lot with signs clearly marked “for outpatient surgery patients only". All shady spots were filled by unoccupied cars. After three hours with no word,  my wife called to see if I was alright. Was told by the AOC Surgery staff that I was being taken into surgery now (3:45 pm).
While waiting in a hot vehicle in the Surgery Center hot parking lot, several AOC Surgery employees dressed in medical smocks came out and drove away in vehicles parked in the shady reserved spots. That sucks. At 4:30 she was called to come get me. Over four hours in a hot parking lot is absurd.
At postop appointment,  I still waited two hours past appointment time to see the doctor. Let me be clear. Again, nothing but praise for Dr. McAndrew.
I cancelled my appointment for a second postop appointment to remove stitches. I’ll pull them out myself. I live 40 miles from AOC and don’t want to waste any more time waiting to see the doctor. I realize that the Doctors and staff are overbooked, but maybe it would be better to book patients farther out than to overbook knowing that appointment times were not realistic. Patients time is valuable too.

name: Rhonda Evans
text: I have been a patient of Dr. John C McAndrews for years. He has always taken care of my medical needs with the utmost care and professionalism. I love how he explain every detail of my treatment plan and options and I value his professional opinion for what’s best for me!  His staff is also amazing, friendly and caring.

name: Erinn Graham
text: I am having a hard time understanding those who have given him such rave reviews. It is obvious that his provision of QUALITY care differs from patient to patient. The entire experience was disappointing, from the almost 3 hour wait to be called to the back, to his non existent bedside manner. I will not mention the experiences with the office staff, as I understand he may not be in control of outside occurrences. After the wait, the actual interaction with him felt rushed as he made my back pain feel insignificant by saying “well my back hurts all the time, stretch”. He spends no more than 10 minutes with me basically telling me to deal with it. He then goes on to make a comment about him being a surgeon, making my case seemingly a waste of time for him, but also not wanting to refer me to someone else. Allow me to let the record show, I have a high pain tolerance and I do not like taking pain meds. I made it clear to him I was not looking for medication and that it took a lot for me to make the appointment in the first place. I am a new nurse who had to take a break from bedside nursing. He proceeds to make a joke of my situation and states “you know what they call a nurse with a bad back? Unemployed”. But wait! Theres more.. after not offering ANY education about body mechanics, posturing, lifting, etc. or anything worth the troubles I had experienced thus far, he ends the appointment by asking me will I leave him a good review as to not interfere with his 5 star rating and actually points to his 5 star picture on the wall. I don’t ever leave reviews on the internet, about anything, but I am so appalled at the audacity of him to freely and openly make light of my pain. I know how some doctors can be, as I witness it all the time, but Dr. Donahoe takes the cake.

When it was time to operate he asked me if there was a type of music I would like to listen to I told him I want to hear Five Finger Death Punch. I could tell he didn't know who they were.  I told him they were a heavy metal band. I told my husband to go in the car and listen to my favorite CD. Needless to say I came out of surgery all the better. Thank you and may God bless you and your staff for the work you do.
