text: They worked me in last minute when my back put me down for a few days. Dr. Donahoe and staff were professional and over the top friendly!

name: Allison Jennings
text:
Different physicians can and do have different philosophies on the patients best suited for their practice.
Dr. Donahoe came highly recommend to me from both my physical therapist and primary care doctor. The positive feedback he has received on review sites seem to support the quality of work he provides in helping a patient find a good outcome.
However, it was difficult and disappointing to hear from his staff that he denies care for any person that has been in an automobile accident.
In my case, there is no litigation, only a desire to get the best care possible from a physician recommended to me by his colleagues that I trust.
Understanding now, that this policy may have been implemented out of caution, it would have softened the blow had the staff made an effort to explain and offer a reasonable alternative.

name: John Pruett
text: Other than having to wait a little longer than what I would have liked .... It was good all the way around.

name: April Reed
text: Dr. Donahoe is very personable. He’s caring and determined to do what is best for the patient. His entire team is stellar and provided me exceptional customer service.

name: Monica Lewis
text: I have been seeing Dr Donahoe at AOC for a year regarding back and nerve problems. He allowed me to go thru therapy prior to making the decision to have back surgery.  He and Justin did an excellent job and I was back up and around in less than two weeks.  He is very caring and through in his treatment.  I’m glad I had the surgery and that he did it. I would recommend him to family and friends. Hopefully I won’t have any more back problems, but if I do I know who to call.

name: Shiatissiwa Couch
text: I had a wonderful experience with him. He was able to explain the procedure to me in a way that I could understand. I would and have been referring him because of my experience. Thank you for that.

name: Tami Dunne
text: As a Nurse Practitioner with a cervical disc herniation, I waited almost 6 years before finally deciding to proceed with surgery. I researched everything prior to this decision, including which surgeon in which I would place my trust. I decided to go with Dr. Donnahoe, Matt his NP and Justin his PA. I am now one week out from surgery and very happy with my results and my decision. Being a healthcare provider and knowing the standards of care and quality that all patients expect, this team went above and beyond for me. I personally know others that have used them as well and they received the same quality of care. Although at one week I am still stiff and sore, I am absolutely glad I choose Dr. Donnahoe and his team. Thank you for making my experience as comfortable and easy as possible and for going above and beyond to treat my individual needs as they arose. Yes, I would highly recommend him and use him In the future for any other needs. Six out of five stars!

name: Wendy Caraway
text: From the very beginning of care from Dr. Donahoe,  I felt his expertise was on point for my issue. He explained everything to a tee, addressed any concerns I had, made sure I was healthy enough for the surgery, and just overall kind. I would highly recommend Dr. Donahoe to perform surgery on anyone that is in need of Orthopedic care.

name: David Respress
text: Dr Donahoe is very courteous and attentive to my needs. His staff is very knowledgeable and are genuinely concerned with with your well being. I would highly recommend him to anyone.

name: Cathy Tolbert
text: Dr Donahoe is a good Doctor and Surgeon. He will do everything he can to help you recover from pain, injuries and sickness. He is Professional and very knowledgeable of medicine. His Staff are very nice and professional also

name: Jen C
text: The AOC office experience was great, however I had a terrible new patient experience with Dr. Donahoe. After taking 5-6 X-rays of my neck and 5-6 X-rays of my lower back, he spent maybe 10 minutes with me and never once did he go over with me what he saw in my X-rays. During these 10 minutes associates/students (?) were in and out of the room interrupting my visit. The only thing he did for me was ask a few questions, perform a few generic exams then continuously ask me the reason I was sent to physical therapy 6 years ago and what they saw on my MRI 6 years ago. He then ordered a shot and wrote a prescription for physical therapy, shook my hand and told me to ‘smile’. I expected more since my PCP was able to tell me that I had arthritis in my neck and I had a terrible fall 8 months ago causing a concussion and new low back pain. It was an awful experience! I’m still in a lot of pain and will be changing physicians. Don’t go to him if you want someone who cares because he apparently does not.

name: Tracey McIntyre
text: We saw Dr. Donahoe in 2012, and remembered how personable he was with my young daughter. We didn’t hesitate to make an appointment to see him recently for my daughters scoliosis. We were very pleased with Dr. Donahoe and his staff. I would recommend Dr. Donahoe.

Now I’m 60 and have never taken pain meds except when I has my tooth pulled.  I could not sleep for over a month from pain and I requested to see another doctor and was told to see Dr Donahue .   I read in previous post he does not like car accident patients and I see why now.   He was rude to me and said why was I giving Dr Fontana a hard time ?   I said I was always polite to Dr Fontana and he threw his eyes up.   He then said I see on this x Ray all is wrong with u is arthritis and that is what I am putting in the report.  He then said sarcastically that should help your suit.   Othapedic group is full of corrupt doctors

text: I just had a C5/C6 fusion 5 weeks ago to the day. I can not explain how smoothly the weeks leading up to this surgery went. After months of PT, and epidurals, I was finally ordered an MRI and everything went quickly from there. I was referred to Dr. Donahoe and reluctant after reading that some had never even met him prior to surgery, however that was not my case. I met with him and his PA my first visit. The entire staff at AOC has been great, and quick to solve any problems I've had. Thank you all from the bottom of my heart, the light at the end of this tunnel is actually visible now.

name: Anna Kate Donovan
text: Dr. Goldstein repaired my torn shoulder labrum . I followed up with PT through ATI. It was a great experience from start to finish. Dr. G was very straight-forward and personable. There was no pressure from him to choose one option over the other, he simply gave me the information I needed and then supported my decision. He is down to earth and not egotistical at all. His staff is excellent. I would recommend him 100%.

resp.text: Anna Kate, thanks so much for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience with our team.

text: Dr. Goldstein is the BEST! Had surgery on my dominant shoulder and had never had surgery in my life. Was so afraid it would never be or feel normal again. It’s awesome. Can’t tell I ever had surgery. Went back for other shoulder and he said he wanted to be conservative and send me to PT before considering surgery. Sent me to best PT and that shoulder is doing great now too. Thankful Dr. G didn’t just jump straight to surgery. You will love him! No way would I go to anyone else for ortho!

name: FideleF
text: In February of 2015 Dr. Goldstein did a total knee replacement on my right knee.  Based on my flexibility & recovery time, rehab folks kept commenting on how I 'really had gotten a good knee!'  Two years later I went back and Dr. Goldstein replaced my other knee with similar results.  I have great strength and flexibility in both knees - what more could one ask?!  Knee replacement and rehab is not easy (I'm in my early 70's), but if Dr. Goldstein does the surgery and you do the rehab, you'll be good to go!

name: mixti cox
text: I saw Dr. Goldstein for a total knee replacement that became infected intra-op.  He sent me home despite the fact my wound was gushing fluid.  He refused to see me afterwards as the infection grew worse because my insurance had changed.  Orthopods in my home town refused to see me because they felt ethics demanded he stand by his own surgery. When I tried to politely discuss the matter with him he hung up on me.  When I posted a negative review at his workplace site, Saint Andrews Sports Medicine Clinic at Saint Vincent’s Hospital in Birmingham Alabama the owner posted a reply stating s/he was sorry I “felt” I had a negative experience there.  I feel pain every day and they have minimized my suffering. By the time nickle sized spots all over my leg were streaming pus I was nearly dead.  It took four surgeries plus an amputation to save my life, and I spent six months in the local hospital.  He ruined my life.  I was in the top ten% of my profession and can no longer find a job because I am confined to a  wheelchair, cannot stand and am unable to get my wheelchair in and out of the car without help.  I have no family and virtually no help.  He should have his medical license revoked.  It’s too late for me but please save yourselves from this incompetent.  Negative stars.

name: Bruce Tisdale
text:
Made my knee surgery as routine as it could be.
Dr Goldstein told me that there would come a time when I would have to think about it to remember which knee was operated on. He was right. I don’t think about my knee any more.
Thank you, Dr Goldstein

name: Mixti Cox
text: Dr. Samuel Goldstein caused my leg to be amputated after an intra-op infection during a total knee replacement.  When I was discharged the wound was gushing fluid but he sent me home anyway.  Then he refused to see me because my insurance had changed.  When I tried to politely discuss it with him he hung up on me.  No orthopedist in my hometown would see me because they felt ethics demanded that he stand by his own surgery.  He has never admitted wrongdoing.  By the time nickle sized pustules erupted all over my leg I was nearly dead from the infection.  After four surgeries it required an amputation to save my life.  I posted a negative review at Andrews Sports Nedicine Clinic where he works and the owner replied that s/hewas sorry I “felt” I had a negative experience there. I am now confined to a wheelchair, cannot stand and cannot find a job because I cannot get my wheelchair in and out of the car by myself.  I have no family and virtually no help.  Yes, I “feel” my negative experience every day of my life.  He only cares about profit, the patient be damned and should lose his license.  It’s too late for me, but spare yourself the agony of seeing this incompetent quack.

name: wendi collins
text: Had torn my ACL for a second time.  I arrived at Andrews Sports Medicine and was greeted by a very nice person directing me to an automated sign in station.  After only waiting 20ish minutes I was escorted back to X-ray then on to Dr. Goldstein’s hall.  I was met by Troy then Jenny, his PA...both so incredibly nice and warm.  Once Jenny did an exam, Dr. Goldstein then came in.  I can honestly say he is one of the nicest people I have ever met!  He was so welcoming and I felt like he genuinely cared. As someone that is very familiar with orthopedic surgical procedures and doctors...he hands down is the best!  His bedside manor is a 10! The entire staff is amazing! The aftercare was great and recovery a breeze.  Dr. Goldstein is the only one I’ll go to for any and all my ortho needs! Thanks Dr. Goldstein!!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience!

name: Lauren Metzger
text: Dr. Spain was very attentive and knowledgeable. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Tiffany McFadden
text: Dr. Spain and the physical therapy team are the best in the area.  I have visited both the Mobile and Fairhope offices and both are very nice with a staff to match!  I was given non-surgical options that were effective and I wouldn’t choose anywhere else for my Orthopaedic care!

resp.text: Thank you for the five star review!

name: Allan Stockler
text: As always efficient, straight to the point, and clear about the intended direction.....very friendly, refreshing attitude....I recommend him with no reservation.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and positive review!

name: Christi Clements
text: We had a wonderful experience and I would highly recommend Dr. Handwerger.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Susan Williams
text: Not crowded. Nice front office staff member, medical student took my history. Dr Spain did my procedure. He also talked to me about options for the future.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Taylor Smith
text:
Dr. Handwerger was an incredible surgeon to work with. He made me feel comfortable the second he walked in the door and throughout this entire process. I was really nervous about having surgery, and the recovery process. He made everything so easy to understand and I really appreciated him talking to me more like I was a friend than a random patient he has to deal with. Even while I was in the hospital recovering from surgery, almost every nurse and PT I worked with told me how great he was and they all would only trust their children with him and that he does such a good job. He was able to perform the best possible scenario regarding my treatment and I couldn’t be more grateful, I’ll be back on the softball field sooner than later, thanks to him!

10/10 would recommend Adam to anyone requiring Orthopaedic work.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Mark & Tiffany Wilson
text: Great experience from a doctor’s office is hard to fine. You’ll get just that here. Thank you Dr. Spain!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback and review!

name: Kenneth Bell
text: I was a little disappointed in the hour wait time before getting back to see the Dr, but I guess this should be expected in the time of the pandemic.  Once I did get back to see the Dr, I was taken to a room, hand an initial consultation, had an X-ray to see what the issues were, had some fluids drained and a shot and I was out the door in record time. I appreciated Dr. Fereichs and the staff's straight forward approach and am happy to recommend him and the Orthopedic Group.

resp.text: Thank you for your review and sorry about the wait time.

name: Jane Conrad
text: First rate doctor.  I had two spinal injections from two pain management doctors that did not ease my back and leg pain.  Dr. Spain did temporarily relieve my pain  by where he gave the injection.  Pain pills had not relieved the pain either.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Ron Brooks
text: I’m a physician myself and Dr Spain and his staff as well as the facilities were top notch!  💯

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: stephanie campbell
text: I saw Dr.Spain today and he was absolutely amazing.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and positive review!

name: John Fonde
text:
Dr. Barber did a great job of cleaning up a lot of arthritis in my right thumb, wrist and hand
Just finished first rehab session and therapist said my range of motion on my thumb is already excellent and that with a little work my wrist will be great as well.

Thanks to Drs. Haas and Barber for your great advice and surgical work.  Looking forward to returning to a more normal lifestyle.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Miranda Smith
text:
Everyone was personable and professional. Electronic check-in is great. Doc Howard was pleasant and to the point. I was thrilled that he didn’t recommend an invasive treatment plan right off the bat;  and in my opinion, didn’t perform unnecessary and costly diagnostics.
Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Amy Cockrell
text: Three of my family members have seen Dr Spain, all for different reasons. Each experience has been a good one. He is thorough in his evaluation and explains the problem in easy to understand language. Wait each time in the office is minimal.  He’s a great asset to The Orthopaedic Group!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Stephanie Wainwright
text: Wonderful staff and Dr.Spain is the best!!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Dennis F Potten
text: Excellent communicator. Down to earth discussion making appoints beneficial. Only negative is that he’s so busy one must wait a long time. Last appointment I waited 2.25 hours! Having said that, I wouldn’t seek counsel from any other specialist.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Matt Terry
text: Hands down the absolute worst practice someone could choose. Do yourself a big favor, find a different group than this one to use.

resp.text: We take your feedback seriously because we strive to exceed expectations for all patients. If you'd like to discuss your experience further, please call Stephen Jones, the Director of Marketing 251-470-5261.

name: Carol Conway
text: This group takes Covid very seriously . Mask must be worn to enter . All staff have mask on . Plexi glass separates the check in staff from the patient . There is a kiosk to check in . The staff is professional and personable . The Dr is straight forward and to the point . He is conservative in his treatment  and knowledgeable . I was very impressed with him .

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

resp.text: We take your feedback seriously because we strive to exceed expectations for all patients. If you'd like to discuss this further, please call Marketing Director, Stephen Jones at (251) 470-5261. Thank you

name: Steve M
text:
Dr Spain is an excellent orthopedist.  Friendly, engaging, and professional.
He always gives his patients treatment options and lets the patient make the decision on how to proceed.  Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind words and review.

name: Ryan Manning
text: Dr Park did a great job on a Hagland & Achilles repair, my cast was just removed after 6 weeks and in a boot now. I already feel the difference and am excited for the future and to be active again. I previously had a surgery in 2017 with a podiatrist that told me I only had bone spurs. This was obviously not the case after a long recovery. After seeing Dr Park he knew immediately what the real problem was told me the procedure that needed to be done and between him and his nurse the process couldn't have been easier. I will be recommending Dr Park to anyone that asks and appreciate his professional and honest approach to the whole process!

name: Independent Thinker
text: Dr Blackmer was kind, thorough and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind review!

name: Debbie Pettis
text: The orthopedic doctors in this group are very knowledgeable, nice, and take the time to listen to what you want to say.  The office staff are also very nice and courteous.  I would highly recommend The Orthopedic Group to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!

name: Marianne Stewart
text: Dr. Spain is always very nice, he's congenial, and he listens when you talk and he asks questions and is concerned about what ails you. Very good Doctor and very pleasant staff.  I am completely satisfied.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review.

name: Kathy Johnson
text: Dr. Frerichs is a very kind and thorough doctor. I would definitely recommend him for all your Orthapedic needs. He doesn’t keep you waiting either. The staff are very kind and helpful. But we have had to wait hours for Dr. Howard to only see you for 2 minutes once you get into the room. I would understand if it had only happened once but it seems that isn’t the case. My time is valuable too!

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review and recommendation!!!!!

name: Linda Gulledge
text: Had a Hip Aspiration with Dr. Spain this afternoon. I was very pleased with my experience. He was very professional & knowledgeable. I felt at ease even though I was apprehensive about the procedure.

text: The office is very efficient and organized, the wait was short and Dr. West and his staff were very professional and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: dbm2255
text: Timely, friendly and professional services rendered when I could not get to see others till mid week!  I am very grateful for Ortho Group getting me and my broken arm treated - pronto!!

resp.text: You are welcome!!  Thank you for the great review.

text: I wouldn't go anywhere else. I called Bayside Orthopedic in Foley at 8 a.m. and didn't hear back from them until 2 p.m. When I called The Orthopedic Group at 8 a.m. they had me an appointment that same day! Not only was the staff extremely helpful, they made sure I was well taken care of!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: jennifer dobson
text: The Orthopedic Group is top notch from the team at the front desk all the way up to the Dr’s.  Dr. West is excellent and I love the way he is straight up honest in his assessments.  I will never use any other Orthopedic facilities.

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you so much for your kind words and great review! It truly means so much. Thanks for trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

name: Gene Morace
text: As far as a surgeon I think he is probably very good... As for his bedside manner and care and concern for his patient I don't think so nearly as much.   Pre surgery instructions left me without eating for over 18 hours, Scheduled my arrival time 4 hours prior to surgery.  I asked his staff why we were all scheduled to arrive at the same time and was informed that it was just in case someone did not show up... Basically his time was important but ours was not. Sent me home after surgery with a prescription for pain that he failed to sign. Have not heard a word from him personally about any of this. Would probably not go back to even though his procedure seem to work very well.

resp.text: We are sorry we did not meet your expectations. We would like to speak with you about it if you would like. Please call our office manager at (251) 450-2766 to discuss your specific issues.

name: Kim Washington
text:
Dr. Haas saw my mother for pain in her knees. He was friendly and thorough.  He actually touched her which seems to be a forgotten thing with some other doctors. Now they just look at you and ask what's wrong.
I highly recommend him

resp.text: Thanks for your kind words and great review, Kim! We sincerely appreciate you trusting us with your orthopesdic care.

name: Joyce Fisk
text: Dr. Handwerger is the best combination of professional (for parents) and buddy (for pediatric patients). Our 13 year old son loves him and we could not be more pleased with our experience.

resp.text: That's wonderful !!  Thank you for the kind words and review.

text: Office visit was Quick (talks really fast, so have ears open and listen carefully), straight to the point, no messing around. The wait in waiting room was a little long, But have waited longer and they Did apologize.😉 Most don't!

name: Stephanie Jones
text: He did second repair surgery on my hip. Had been experiencing pain for years and had prior surgery at USA Orthopedic.  All my tendons were datched again and pain was  worse. Have the ability  to do things i had not done in years and pain free. Dr. Bose is my hero! Highly recommended him and his awesome staff.

name: J Mason
text: Excellent experience at Dr. Bose's office.  Friendly staff.  I am thankful for his expertise.  I had to have shoulder cuff surgery and I could not have had a more caring and attentive surgeon in Dr. Bose.  I am healing well and my family and I are grateful for Dr. Bose and his staff.

name: Sharon Vice
text: Excellent operation,no pain afterward. Will Be seeing him again in June.This is from William Wayne Vice.

name: Rod Sigler
text: I had another local Orthopedic surgeon to perform surgery on my shoulder. After two shoulder surgeries and about seven years of pain. I let Dr. Bose preform the third shoulder surgery on my shoulder.Everything went great I can certainly see the difference between the surgery been done correct and incorrect. I was so glad that I let Dr. Bose perform the surgery.

name: Sandra Edwards
text: Dr. Bose...is one of the BEST doctors that I’ve ever met.  He performed a L-Lateral Release on my knee in 2017 and just recently (July 21st) repaired my R- Rotator Cuff and R-Carpal Tunnel.  I was rear ended in a MVA on 2/6/2020 and my vehicle was totaled.  Choosing Dr. Bose was an easy choice for me as he’s a great surgeon.  His bedside manner is impeccable and everyone on his staff treats me with great respect.  I’m only 2 weeks out from my surgery and after months of physical therapy I know that this surgery will be another success surgery for Dr. Bose.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND him for all of your shoulder, hand and knee surgeries.  I’m sure that he performs other surgeries, however these are all that I can attest to.

name: Audrey Day
text: Dr. Bose replaced both hips. I'm now undergoing PT on #2. He is genuine and caring. He does have a very dry sense of humor and if you can't laugh at yourself, he's not the Dr for you. To me, he is my "go to guy" - Dr Bose gave me my life back. Thank you.

name: john collier
text: He did more to damage me with his knife than  i had when dove off bridge and broke my neck.two surgeries he has destroyed my way of living. He is no good at total reversal shoulder replacement . And he performed reconstructive surgery on left foot i faught hard to get back to walking after neck injury now he has put me in wheel chair. And after all said and done he diagnosed me with a birt disorder that ive never had.

name: Kent Quinnie
text: Awesome Doctor... Just had my left hip replacement on June 4th, 2019. Dr. Bose was totally awesome. Wouldn't trust any other doctor with my surgery. He replaced my right hip back in 2009 which still feels awesome to this day. He came highly recommended and I highly recommend him to you.

name: R Jean
text: Dr. Bose performed shoulder surgery for two bone spurs and a torn rotator cuff at the same time on June 28th. The work was such a great success, I had no need for pain medication the following day. Two weeks later, I can do things with my arm that I couldn't do for over a year since I started having issues and I have full range motion. I highly recommend Dr. Bose, his great staff and the people at North Baldwin Infirmary who work together as a great team.

name: Tanya Cook
text: I cannot praise Dr. Bose and his staff highly enough.  Dr. Bose has been my husbands doctor for roughly 10 years now. My husband has had both of his knees replaced. Through no fault of Doctor Bose's, my husband has had multiple surgeries on his right leg.  When other doctor's would have shied away from my husbands case, Dr. Bose has stuck right beside him. He is wonderful about being straight forward and honest from the beginning.  He expects perfection from himself, his staff, and the hospitals. His level of expertise has us referring cases to him as often as we can.  A number of our family and friends have used Dr. Bose and all are highly satisfied.  Dr. Bose does not run a large practice (He is the only physician) but he gives all of his patients his utmost effort and experience. To his office, you are a person, not another patient number.  I highly recommend Dr. Bose.  :Tanya

name: Don Wiley
text: Dr Bose is one of the best dam Doctor in Mobile he done my right shoulder and I did not have to have therapy and he did both of my knee and I have had no probable at all if I had to go to someone else they would have to send me back to him

name: Carol Walton
text: Dr Bose performed a knee replacement for my husband with minimal swelling and pain. Definitely will return when other body parts need attention.

name: Dolores Lovelady
text: Dr Bose is a wonderful doctor and surgeon! I just had my third replacement ( left hip) with him after he has done my right hip and right knee within the last 2 - 21/2 years. I am extremely pleased with my results and will definitely use him again if I need another procedure! His staff ( Mike and Keith) are also wonderful!

name: Joanna Franklin
text: I find Dr. Bose to be an excellent doctor who really cares about his patient. Whenever there is a problem going on within my body, I am able to reach front line staff immediately. Those staff members employed to assist him are always helpful as well. He is the greatest orthopedic doctor in Mobile as far as I’m concerned.  I've had three different surgeries and each have been successful. I would highly recommend Dr. Bose if you are in need of an orthopedic doctor.

name: Richard Tait
text: Dr Bose did a great job on me, left arm was hurting, right leg couldn’t walk,right shoulder was in a mess. He rebuilt right shoulder and with therapy it’s as good as new. If anyone need help, I recommend Dr Bose and staff to get the one on one treatment. No sitting around waiting on appointments. I GIVE DR BOSE AND STAFF A THUMBS UP

name: Gene Warhurst
text: I have sent Dr. Bose many many of my personal injury clients from my law practice over the years and they have all experienced outstanding results under his care.  I also have personally had a knee replacement done by Dr. Bose with remarkable results.  I highly recommend Dr. Bose because he simply is the best orthopedic surgeon around and a pleasure to work with.

name: Andrea Atchison
text:
I was very nervous to go in being in a considerable amount of pain, my first visit to a new doctor, and grateful my husband went with me. The office was clean and had plenty of seating. The staff was very polite. I liked Mike (the x-ray tech) and the girl at the front desk. I spent more time with them than the actual doctor. I was in and out of the office in less than 15 minutes. I had an x-ray, a shot, and three prescriptions. I never got the MRI that I was referred to him for. I quit taking the pain medicine because it stops working after two hours. I am trying to deal with the pain and I don't move my arm unless I absolutely have to.

The doctor has a dry personality. Normally, I like that. People who are dry are usually blunt and to the point. This time I felt like I was a waste of his time, just another random patient sent in on referral. He asked me what happened and as I started telling him, he put his hand up in my face and told me he didn't want to hear it. Then he lifts up my sleeve on the right arm when I was there for my left arm. I get the shot, the prescription which I filled there, and went home. For the next three days I had severe shoulder pain where the shot was introduced. I Googled it only to find out that the shot can cause that type of pain for usually 48 hours. I was never told that.

Mike is funny and has a great personality. The girl at the front desk was polite, busy, and grateful I brought in all the paperwork she needed including copies of my license and insurance card. The nurse was polite and hurried. The doctor needs better manners. Don't ask questions if you don't want answers.

I do NOT recommend this doctor and I will NOT use him again! The ONLY reason I am giving this three stars is for his staff.

name: Sharon Bordelon
text: Dr. Bose is a gifted surgeon. He patched up my knee. For over a year it was hard to walk.. Today I can walk pain free. I will always be grateful that he went the extra mile to help me.  He is wonderful!

name: Stephen Moore
text:
I have represented dozens of clients who have treated with Dr. Bill Bose over the years in my capacity as a personal injury attorney with Moore Law Firm in Mobile, Alabama. My clients have all reported an excellent  recovery from their injuries under his care.
I have also personally treated with Dr. Bose and I have referred numerous family members to him. Dr. Bose is an excellent physician with a great reputation in the area of orthopedic medicine. The staff is also very friendly and caring.
I consider Dr. Bose to be the premiere Orthopedic Surgeon on the Gulf Coast and I highly recommend him without reservation.

name: Lisa Koen
text: Dr. Bose is an extraordinary surgeon.  I had minimum pain after both of my surgeries that were done together.  I highly recommend this doctor to anyone who is in need of an orthopedic surgeon.  His nurse practitioner, Mike is fantastic. His knowledge and expertise are excellent  Thank both of you, for putting me on the road to recovery!  God bless!

name: Nicholas Fain
text: Dr Bose and staff are highly professional. Have always fealt comfortable each time I have visited their office.  Always been given plenty of time to discuss things when I am there. Would highly recommend for my orthopedic needs

name: Lois Lathen
text: When my son broke his arm at school, Dr. Bose did an amazing job of putting it in a cast and setting both my son's and our fears at ease. He was both professional and personable and it make a difficult situation so much easier to go through. I would and have recommended him to anyone who needs orthopedic services. His staff is also amazing to work with and make every visit pleasant.

name: Jeannie Starling
text: The best for anything shoulder or knee related. Small office,great staff. Personal care not herding cattle like the big offices!

name: adam
text: Dr. Bose and his staff are very professional. I was able to get an appointment very quickly and the appointment itself was fantastic. Two weeks after the appointment, and I was able to get my surgery! If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. These are the people that you want to see.

name: Jermaine Roberson
text: It was a great experience. My progress  is  astonishing.  I had an ACL reconstruction surgery which I thought was gonna be the end of the world it turned out to be great I'm bouncing back speedily I recommend Dr. William Bose and advanced orthopedics to anyone whose has to have orthopedic surgery

name: Tony Sylvest
text:
Dr. Bose and his staff, are in my  "personal and first hand " experience, the best in their field,
hands down. From your first visit through your recovery farewell. ..you know you have been taken care of.  I can't think of any other place that I can say that about,...Except... Hall Therapy Group....Which I met them through Dr. Bose office. ...Two for the price of one, I call it.

name: candy swoboda
text: I really don't have enough great words to say about Dr. Bose, if you want the best Orthopaedic Doctor in Mobile, pick up the phone and call his office. That's the best thing I ever did for myself. I had small surgery in 2014 an then hip surgery early 2015. Dr. Bose is the only Doctor I will trust my body with. He has a outstanding staff that care about the needs of the patient. Thinking about surgery call Br. Bose first, it will be the best call you ever made!

name: Bart Shumaker
text: I had been going to another doctor for 2 years dealing with my knee and being told I was "too young" for a knee replacement.  I lived in pain everyday all day long for 2 years.  I had a physical job and I was unable to work to my full potential or enjoy the recreational things I enjoyed.  I had been told I should not be having that much pain.  Dr. Bose listened to where my pain was and how I described it.  He took one look at my x-ray and told me I needed a partial knee replacement.  His hope was to remove 85% of my pain.  Today I am pain free.  I cannot thank Dr. Bose enough for giving me my life back!

name: Dr. M BAKER
text: I have known Dr. Bose since April of 2012 when I went to see him regarding an injury I suffered on active duty.  Dr. Bose was incredibly professional and warm and I had complete confidence in his ability to care properly for me.  Since that point, I have seen him multiple times and each time his professionalism and dedication to helping his patients has shown me that I can trust him.  He is an incredible ortho surgeon.

name: amanda foster
text: I had already been to see the wonderful staff at Dr Bose's office when my daughter broke her arm. I found that they are just as great with kids as they are with adults.  Wonderful job of calming my daughter's fears about having a cast put on and removed at the return visit.  I would gladly recommend them to family and friends

name: Brent Hall
text: I have known Dr. Bose for many years and have had the opportunity to treat many of his post-operative patients in therapy.  His expertise as an orthopaedic surgeon has resulted in fantastic functional outcomes.  In most cases, patients are able to return to a level of independence beyond their expectations. In addition, the  staff at Dr. Bose's office provides a compassionate and comfortable environment while attending to the patient's orthopaedic needs.

name: Nita Triano
text: He's the best. A very compassionate and caring professional. I would recommend him to anyone looking for a doctor not a patient factory.

name: Angelia Turner
text: I was seeing Dr. Bose for carpal tunnel. He did the surgery on my left wrist and I have had no problems with it since. Dr. Bose was a great doctor.  I recommend Dr. Bose to my friends and family.

name: Valarie Brantley
text: Dr. Bose has done several surgeries on my right knee including an osteotomy, which gave me an additional 12 years until I had to have the knee replaced.  Job especially well done.  He has just completed my left hip and it was remarkable how fast the healing process was.  He is a no nonsense Doctor (he gets right to the point) and has a wonderful staff.  He keeps his appointments in a timely fashion, but also takes time to get to know his patients and their needs.  I was so relieved and excited when I found out that he was to be my surgeon so many years after he took care of my knee.  I had no worries or fears that it would not be a successful and pleasant experience even if it was surgery.

name: Tammy Knight
text: I am a veteran of the US Navy i saw Bose twice the first time he told me  what was wrong with me was bad bad bad ordered an mri which anyone that deals with military knows could take a couple of months he wanted to see me 2 days after my mri which really concerned me bc of ny initial visit mind u i have ptsd so i saw this past Thurs march 14 2019 he walked in the room looked at me asked me what was wrong i said my lower back was hurting in which it was killing me he then proceeded to tell me he could line a row of people up starting from one end they could all have broken bones the other end could be dying and the middle could all be bleeding to death. He said could look at them tell they werebin pain shrug his shoulders and tell them he doesnt care and walk away.  I said i see what saying i started say something else to him and he put his hand in my face. I served my country i dont deaerve to be treated with such disrespect. He didnt even bother to look at my mri i suffer with emmense pain i went there with hopes of relief from this and a good explanation not to be treated like this. I walked and will never return. He has been turned in to the Admiral in Washington for this and Dr Bose if you read this you need to learn how to treat your patients especially my fellow veterans you have idea what we have been thru

name: Philip Herr
text:
Dr. Bose has helped my wife with the difficulties associated with osteoarthritis and aging. She has had two total hip replacements, two shoulders, one knee, and various repairs -- so it's safe to say that she knows about this type of surgery.

She says that Dr. Bose is the best. She will trust no other surgeon for this type of care.

name: BJ Griffin
text: Dr Bose and his staff are incredible! I recently had a meniscus repair and other repairs on my right knee. I had instant relief from the pain. Minor swelling and great motion. My family has used Dr Bose on numerous occasions for many years and would gladly recommend him to anyone!

name: Frederick Moore
text: Dr. Bose is a very caring and well respected doctor in the field of orthopedics.  In being a personal injury attorney, we have clients that have been to various orthopedics around Mobile. Our clients are always happy with the treatment they receive from Dr. Bose and his staff.   Dr. Bose is not your typical "pro-surgery" doctor like most.  He is a doctor that always tries the conservative approach if he feels it will help before opting for other treatment means like surgery.  I say this both as his patient and as an attorney  seeing how he treats our injured clients.... Dr. Bose is highly recommended.

name: Dianna Youngp
text: My name is Michael Young, I would like to thank you Dr Bose and your wonderful knowledgeable and helpful staff for making my experience pleasant and less stressful during my hip replacement surgery on March 2 , 2016. It is beyond  five star care. Recommended highy.

name: Paul Goldsmith
text: Dr Bose is without a doubt the best at what he does,he is frank,candid,and honest. He gives u real solutions to the problems,not a bandaid as so many other doctors I have seen done. I wholeheartedly recommend Dr Bose for any bone issues u have concerning your quality of life.THANKS DR BOSE!

name: Mystic Artist
text: Every time I fall and hurt myself Dr. Bose is quick to see me, quick to diagnose me and I am always cured. Also, as a retired surgical nurse, I have seen him in action in surgery and he is a skilled surgeon with superior sterile technique and this is paramount to the patient! 100% Trust!

name: Sherri Sanderson
text: In the year 2000, my father had a hip replacement by Dr. Bose and to this day is doing very well.  In 2013, I started having right hip pain.  Of course, Dr. Bose was the only physician that I considered due to the great success of my father.  Dr. Bose immediately diagnosed me with a hip impingement.  He performed a very specialized surgery on me called hip arthroscopy, which is less invasive.  Dr. Bose is the only physician in this region that specializes in this procedure.  I have been a registered nurse for 29 years and was able to return to work very quickly.  I am so thankful for Dr. Bose and his very professional office staff.

name: Russell Lange
text:
I have been a patient of Dr. Bose since 2008.  In that time period, I have had several surgeries performed.  The results have been phenomenal and in each instance my expectations have been exceeded.  Both pre-op and post-op care have been top-notch.
The entire staff are professional, dedicated, compassionate and courteous.  The staff and Dr. Bose treat the patient's well-being as paramount.  My phone calls have always been returned promptly and my appointments have always been on time. Any questions I have asked have been answered completely and honestly.  I heartily recommend Dr. Bose and Advanced Orthopedics.

name: Alexander Bolar
text: Absolutely superb surgery and after care! Dr Bose and his staff ensured I was aware of all the benefits and possible shortfalls surrounding my total hip surgery. He followed through with me on my home care and evaluated my progress with frequent contact with nurses and physical therapy practicioners. After 2-weeks, post surgery, my hip replacement has been deemed a "text book" procedure after xray. Two thumbs up to the Bose team of professionals!!!

Of course I took the pain meds the day of the surgery, but have not needed them since. Absolutely amazing that I dont hurt, more range of motion than I thought I would have this early in recovery and all around he is just an awesome Dr. Thank you Dr Bose.!!!!

text: We are so thankful that we were referred to Dr. Bose for my husbands knee issues. After going back to the doctor that did the initial surgery several times, doing physical therapy off and on for years, and still in so much pain, we finally got the right doctor.  Dr. Bose did a scope and found the problem and now my husband has very little pain.  He can now walk up and down steps so much easier, and is able to bend down better than he has in years.  His Nurse Practitioner, Mike, is fabulous.  Mike goes above and beyond with his patients and we can not commend him enough.  We highly recommend Dr. Bose and his staff.

He literally has blessed hands and I'm so happy God has put Dr. Bose in my life. Knowing that this surgery pain will go away and leave me with little to no pain is the greatest joy of my life. Dr. Krauss was a straight shooter throughout the whole thing. I was fortunate that I didn't loose that foot or even a leg. He emphasized no more smoking.  Sad that it took getting to this point to be ready.  In a nutshell, Dr. Krauss and Dr. Heideprem (vascular surgeon) saved my life and I will be forever grateful to them.

name: po gp
text:
Dr. McGinley is a fantastic doctor and an incredible person as well. I’ve been dealing with terrible lower back pain for almost 3 weeks — and have been avoiding going to the doctor because I have no money or insurance. My back pain finally got bad enough that I decided to bite the bullet and spend the $200 to get everything figured out. After multiple xrays, and a consultation with Dr. McGinley, he was able to diagnose the problem. He gave me two Hydrocortisone shots and a few prescriptions that should help with my issues.

Then, he informed me that he was going to be refunding half of my payment. Without me asking, and only out of the goodness of his heart, I can assume. It may not seem like a big deal to a lot of people but this gesture from Dr. McGinley meant everything to me. I will recommend him to any and everyone. I couldn’t be happier with my experience with him.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

text: Dr. McGinley is an awesome doctor and I would recommend him to anyone! My mother went to his office yesterday to have surgery done on her shoulder. name: Roberta Birch
text: This is the facility where patients go for all labs and testing. Even if  you think you have an appointment, it doesn't stand. You put your name on a list when you get there. I had an appointment for a test, got down there from Florence, and they were closed! There was a severe weather warning for the county they're in, but I didn't know as I don't live in that county and didn't hear any warning. No phone call. No sign on the door. No answer to phone calls inside, no answering machine or service. They just stand you up.

name: Susan McClain
text: Be prepared to wait over an hour or two past your appointment time to be seen by your provider.  The office is dirty.  Receptionist/office workers are not very friendly. The appointment times are overbooked.  Very disappointing.

name: Cathy Pham
text: This place is absolutely horrible. They always over book patients. The average wait time is 1.5-2 hours. It doesn’t matter if you get there late or early, you’ll always end up waiting for at least 1 hour. It’s ridiculous. Don’t brother with this place unless you want to spend most of your day napping in their waiting room.

name: Tracy Stubblefield
text: My dad saw dr ridgeway. Love him! Well worth the wait. What a gem.  He answered all of my dads and my questions with total patience. 🙏🏼

name: Ann Shortis
text:
Disorganized,fired too many experienced staff leaving mostly young inexperienced staff. Expect long waits from over booking patients.We waited almost 2 hours on more than one occasion due to staff inability to triage patients,forgetting to sign patients in on arrival,not allowing appropriate time for new patients to be seen.Just to name a few.
Also,for months we have heard "our fax machine is old and doesn't work right". I suspect the staff cannot trouble shoot or even work it if the "go" button doesn't work the first time..or it is an extremely old machine that needs replacing and no one wants to spend money on it..faxes have mysteriously gotten "lost" far too often  to be just an accident. We have to go in person and stand at the counter and complain to get anything for another Dr to see.
The technician/Drs who read the CT results are 100% unreliable. 2 ct's can read wildly different even within a couple of days of each other. The X-ray situation is soso.
Staff with minimal in house training take the various scan,ultrasounds etc  and readings..

Mainly,it's a crapshoot on care here.Which has gotten much worse since our Dr died in a 4by4 accident.
I say avoid if at all possible

name: TSR Consulting
text: I continue trying to call Dr. Liotta but no one answers the phone. Kinda hard to see my PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN when you dont answer the phone. Not happy about this.

name: Sir Thomas

text: This office is completely unorganized. They never return my calls and never provide critical information to their patients. I'm absolutely amazed that they manage to retain any patients at all.

Staff doesn't LISTEN, they're RUDE, AND YOU WAIT FOR HOURS To see a Dr who barely listens to you for 5 min. I've called 3 times about a referral.

text: My mother goes to this practice and her Dr is awesome, but the office part is unorganized, rude, and plain unprofessional. It makes you wonder how in the world the people at the front desk even got their degree or if they are educated. It is a nightmare to try to get a refill on a medication. It's impossible. The only way to get them is when you actually see the doctor.. if you forget to get a refill when you see the doctor well your screwed until the next month basically. We live about a hour away from there so we can not just go by there everyday trying to get one refill. Today I called about a refill and have been trying to get this refill now for over a week and eventually instead of helping me they hung up on me. I just am beyond aggravated. My mom really likes her dr and his nurse is so sweet, but it's getting to the point that I'm seriously considering finding her another doctor bc of the fact everything about the front desk is just so unprofessional. When we gofor my mother's appt I'm going to complain about this and try to get a number that is a direct line to my mom's Dr or his nurse. I advise anyone who's thinking about coming to this practice to find another Dr office. It you are a new patient it's not worth the hassle

name: K
text: At 19 years old I became a patient of Brad Ginevan MD. After my current pediatrician, Dr. Rivas, advised it was time to transition to an adult provider. During the time he was my provider, Dr. Ginevan worked alongside my psychiatrist to continue maintenance of my ADHD and when necessary, he worked with specialists to manage my delicate GI condition. This included references to appropriate clinics and scheduling of applicable tests ie. Colonoscopy, EGD, etc. I truly trusted Dr. Ginevan and was incredibly grateful to have found such a wonderful physician. I never minded the fact that his office was always moving locations or that his appointments had become a nightmare to secure. I still referred only my closest of friends and family to see him. Always assuring them they'd be nothing less than satisfied with him as they're provider. Those were the old days... in 2013 I moved away to live on base with my then husband. I moved back in 2015 and returned to Dr. Ginevan. He and his staff had undergone a complete restructuring as they were now a part of the mega-merger trend and had merged with the tri-cities health giant Shoals Primary Care LLC. Due to the merger Dr. Ginevan no longer had any of my previous medical records from all of my time spent under his care which led to massive complications to my continuity of care. (I now understand the importance of my responsibility to secure medical history documentation and maintain my own current updated personal medical record.) Also, SADLY, due to the implementation of a governmental-esque standard of operating procedures, it is my opinion that Dr. Ginevan no longer maintained the level of patient care he had became known for. His office staff has always been grade-A; to be commended. If you are considering seeing Dr. Ginevan as your primary care provider this review is for you. In closing I want to say that this review in no way, intends to slander or cause malice. This review is my personal experiential reference/opinions of Dr. Ginevan meant solely for the purpose of socially informing fellow peers.

text: Dr Karr is a wonderful doctor.  He really cares about his patients well being.

name: Em Means
text: I had planned to start seeing Dr. Martin as a new patient after my husband's first visit (where they had down on his chart that he was a 60 year old female with impacted bowls). I ignored that fact and still decided to give the doctor the benefit of the doubt because I could understand things sometimes happen. However, upon my scheduled visit as a first time patient it was for 7:30 am, and I arrived at 7:15 am for new patient paper work. I signed in and no one even showed up at the front desk until my appointment time, where I  then asked for my paper work and filled it out. About ten minutes after that, another woman called me by the wrong name and when I corrected her, I was made to feel as if I had done something wrong. Also, you can not hear when you are being called because the TV is loud, so people are talking over the TV, and I have two ear infections. After filling out my paper work, I was then called back to the window, where I was asked to write down my SSN, but I had already written it down twice on the form already. This told me they obviously were not paying attention to the information they were entering. After this, and already feeling on edge from just the front desk experience, I am called back by the doctor's nurse practitioner who tells me to step on the scale, and with a horrible tone says, "you're going to have to take some of that off." Meaning my purse. I ask where I should put it in case of a designated area, which seem to make her even more annoyed and she replies with, "I don't know." Very snappy. I am a new patient and felt like I was asking a very simple and non offensive question. We then walk to the exam room where she informs me that I would not be seeing the doctor and that he also would never been doing my exams or ever seeing me other than a quick peek in the room. Which, as someone looking for a long term doctor, it does not feel comfortable not even meeting my doctor on the first visit. When I tried to explain that I was uncomfortable with the fact she would only be relaying my issues to the doctor, and that I didn't feel comfortable having my health looked after in third person, and that I didnt understand why they wouldn't tell a new patient to begin with when making an appointment that he or she won't be seeing a doctor. She then got upset about it and told me I could reschedule or abort because she had been doing this for 40 years. Which is fine and I explained to her I was fine with her seeing me, but that I didn't feel comfortable having a doctor diagnose me without speaking with me and knowing me as a person. She gets more upset and I said I think it would be best just to cancel because at that point, being someone who has been diagnosed with a generalized anxiety disorder, I was overwhelmed and ready to go home. She proceeded to then say to me, "Fine then. Adios." I feel as if the entire situation was unprofessional on many different levels. I decided to keep searching for a new doctor. I would not advise this practice if you want to get to know your doctor for long term use, or have anxiety issues, seeing as how it is the only doctor's office I have ever been in where the lobby is loud and over packed.

text: Well where do I start.... First I guess I could start off with the fact the receptionist are very rude. Next I am being seen by Dr Aaron karr aka his assistant for a blood clot in my liver. So as I'm being processed for my visit the nurse asks me." Ma'am which side is your blood clot on".........eeerrrmmm. unless I have 2 livers it is on my right side. I over looked that. NEXT , I go in for my inr check and my levels are still below standard so he send me to Hellen Keller to do bloodwork and says he will call with the results. No call..... Instead I call up there later in the day and she says you need to come pick up you medicine. So I go get it they have switched my medicine with no telling me no nothing I am a breastfeeding mother. He switched me to a medicine that I cannot breastfeed on without any consultation. I had to Google the risks and side effects. Totally unprofessional and a headache. I will be switching doctors asap!

His bedside manner is superb..he’s kind, listens to you, and has an excellent staff.
Highly recommend..
If u r in need of a second opinion, he’s the guy u want.

name: Raymond Webb
text: Dr Greco took time with me; I answered his questions. He answered my questions completely. He gave me the positives & negatives of surgery (arthroscopic).Surgery is my call.  His criteria if the cortisone shot into my shoulders helped then looking around in my shoulder arthroscopic & doing repairs is usually beneficial. I’ve had so many surgeries I know the system quite well. “I have more holes in me from surgeries than a screen door has holes”- RayWebb :-) The first stretch of weather so cold, I will call for arthroscopic surgery. I will golf until too cold, probably in January. Then another review will be forthcoming from me. I think positive The result would be in my favor because I would not do surgery with a low success rate. We will see. He is into sports injuries, so he understands my love for golf. He told me ,”Hit’em straight “- Dr. Greco. I do hit most of my drives straight, that’s is why my alias on golf course is “Da Middle Man”. The drawback a 200 yard drive is a monster for this 76yo.

name: evan cohen
text:
Dr Greco and his staff were first class in the care I received today in their office. I’ve been having shoulder pain that has been getting progressively worse for the last two month. When I called for an appointment, I was given one two days later.
Check in was very simple.
And I waited  about ten minutes from the time I checked in till I time a nurse got me to get xrays in his office. After the xrays I was seen by Dr Greco about ten minutes later. Dr Greco examined me and reviewed my xrays  with me and proceeded to explain quite clearly what my problem was. He outlined treatment options with me. This included injecting my shoulder that they did during this visit. I was a little nervous about the shoulder injection but before I knew it, they were done with minimal discomfort. I’m glad to say that shortly after the injection, the pain was gone in my shoulder. I’m scheduled for some follow up xrays and a return visit.
Dr Greco has made me feel so at ease about my problem and his approach to getting me through this. Although I have been putting off seeing someone about my shoulder pain, I’m so glad I saw Dr Greco today. I’d say on a scale of one to ten, Dr Greco is a fifteen. I look forward to my follow up visit. I would recommend Dr Greco and the entire staff at TOC without reservation.

text: I saw Dr. Smith at his Grandview office as a new patient this past Friday.  Excellent experience.  Reception at front desk professional, personable, and efficient. Dr. Smith came to room within five minutes of X-ray completion, examined hand, discussed options for treatment, and decisions made to move forward with surgery.  Surgery scheduler walked in behind Dr. Smith and within minutes my surgical procedure was on the books and the visit was complete.  I am confident I got excellent care by the team, will have a successful procedure this week, and was treated by professionals with the respect and integrity all patients expect.  As a healthcare professional that's been in the "business" for over 30 years, I know quality when i see it and i saw it during this visit!

Xrays have been quick and are completed onsite, as is the therapy/rehab office where they made my splint in only minutes. All the staff from check in, rehab, X-ray, PA, nursing, all the way to Dr Mitch have been just the nicest most caring people. name: Andrew
text:
Dr. Wilson never noticed that my mother had a textbook DVT 5 years ago. I had to personally drive her to the hospital to get a real doctor where they treated her DVT.

For some reason my mother returned to this moron for the past 3 years. He misdiagnosed my mother as having a Baker's cyst on the back of her knee 3 years ago, never followed through, never actually tried to confirm it for the last 3 years. I made her go to USA Mitchell cancer institute because as it turns out she has a tumor, malignant sarcoma, not a Baker's cyst as Dr. Wilson believed. It's grown so large in the 3 years she's seen him that she might lose her leg or worse.

Dr. Wilson is more suited to being a civil war surgeon, sawing off legs left and right than a modern medical doctor.

resp.text: Andrew, we take your feedback seriously because we strive to exceed expectations for all patients. If you'd like to discuss this further, please call our office manager at (251) 476-5050 during regular business hours.

name: Katherine Neill
text: I cannot say enough about Dr. Ryan and his team. They have went above and beyond throughout my recovery, ensuring I have a great comeback story. Coming into my first appointment, I was so nervous about the possibility of a hip scope. Dr. Ryan took the time to explain the procedure and what my recovery would be like. I am a nurse, but he still talked to me like I was a normal patient. He was so kind and appreciative to me for what nurses are doing throughout the pandemic. When I went back for my first post op appointment, he showed me photos of my hip that were taken during the procedure. He explained each picture and what was happening in each one. Dr. Ryan and his team have been there as soon as I call with a question or emergency. Even now, a little half way through recovery, I still get nervous about my hip. Kirby and Dr. Ryan have assured me that everything I’m feeling now is normal and will get better over time. I cannot recommend these guys enough. They have truly been the best people to work with. I cannot thank them enough. Such a great experience with wonderful people!

name: Marcus Christianson
text: When I initially went to Dr Ryan, I had been on and off crutches for several years. I had a core decompression on hips that went bad. I could barely walk enough to get to my car and couldn't reach my feet. I'm an active duty police lieutenant and firearms instructor. It's hard to teach on the range on crutches and barely able to walk 25 yards. My officers were begging to stop hurting myself for them and retire. Dr. Ryan advised what he thought was best and explained my options and was honest about which options he thought would work. Unlike other experiences he didn't push for surgery, just suggested it as the best option and would do what I decided,  His staff were very kind and caring. Always seemed to remember me. They were careful to explain to my wife and meet her needs to be my caregiver while I healed. The orthopedic surgery pre-op staff and nurses were kind and went out of their way to check on me both prior and after my surgery. Both hospital stays, at St. Thomas, I had the most amazing hospital nurses I've ever had during all my hospital stays in the past, I've had plenty. They not only took of me, but took care of the family that stayed with me, especially my wife. They were careful to check on her needs too. Physical therapy in the hospital, therapist were careful to explain what they were showing me and  watched for my safety. Wish I would have known about Andrews Sports Medicine and St. Thomas Hospital years ago. I am still healing from second hip replacement. I can now reach my feet, put on my own socks and shoes, pick something off the floor, get in my truck and start looking for a time to ride my Harley. Haven't even to just sit on it in three years. Because of Doc and all the others involved I can walk and serve the public for more years, I can teach on the range, I can play with my grandchildren. I'm going from can't get off the bed to being able to get down the steps to enter my house. Still hurting some, still healing, learning to walk again. I know this is wordy, but I can't thank everybody enough for their professionalism and caring. I can have some quality of life and career  back.

resp.text: Mr. Christianson, thank you so much!  My team and I are thrilled you are doing well, and it was our pleasure to facilitate your recovery.  Take care!

name: Sarah Crain
text:
I met Dr. Herrick Siegel in mid April, to discuss arthroplasty surgery of my left knee.  After a surgical consult with a different orthopedic surgeon in early March, left me feeling hopeless.  As the first surgeon repeatedly referred to me as a high risk patient.  Expected to suffer serious complications, if not death.

By the time I arrived at Dr. Siegel's office, for a second opinion.  To say that I was apprehensive would have been a understatement.   To be honest, thanks to the first orthopedic surgeon, my confidence and nerves were totally shattered.  Only for Dr. Siegel to enter the exam room and quickly put my fears to rest.  Me leaving his office with total knee replacement surgery scheduled for May 5, 2021.

I am seven weeks post opt today.  After a overnight stay at UAB Highlands, I was discharged to recover at home.  By day three; I transitioned from using a walker to a cane.  By day four, I no longer needed opioids to control my pain.  In recent weeks, I have gained the ability to walk a couple of blocks without any assistive devices needed.  I go to outpatient physical therapy twice a week.  My only set back at this time is swelling and the inability to bend my knee more than a 100 degrees.  Which is a little compromised due to a second surgery on the same day, to release and stretch my Achilles tendon.  That was preformed by a different orthopedic surgeon.

If you are in need of arthroplasty AKA total knee replacement surgery.  Knowing what I know now.  Dr. Herrick Siegel is absolutely the best.  I cannot thank Dr. Siegel enough for helping me reclaim my mobility.

resp.text: Thank you very much Ms Crain for taking the time to write a review.  I'm so happy to hear you are doing well.  All the best!

name: Greg Kemp
text:
I would love to give a review, but I'm 2hrs past my appointment time and still waiting. Apparently this is normal here at this clinic.

Edit:. It was unfair of me to give a bad review to a doctor because of administrative issues.  I was frustrated at the wait. Dr. Siegel is a great doctor who took good care of me long ago and is seeing me again. He is a stand up guy who cares for his patients. I guess it's like a good restaurant, sometimes you have to wait to get a seat.

resp.text: My apologies for the wait time.   I continue to work with our administration to improve our clinic efficiency.

name: John Isbell
text: Could not have been better. A very talented doctor with God given skills. Saved my quality of life!

name: jan young
text: i had knee replacement 5-1-19. i am pleased with the outcome of the surgery.i was up walking that very evening!

name: Tim White
text: Great surgeon! Just wish he explained my procedure to me better and visited me after surgery and before I left hospital to further explain what he found during surgery.

name: Courtland Company
text: My husband was seen by Dr. Siegel after alternatives of amputation were presented to us by another major hospital group out of state.  He is a very busy man, but ALWAYS knows accurate information about the patient condition and has produced something just short of a miracle for us.  We aren't quite done yet, but so far from where we have been.  Dr. Siegel would get 10 stars from us is possible.  Top quality is worth every effort and he treats many severe cases.  Thank you!

name: Maturity AtItsBest
text:
First of all...I am a very picky person when it comes to My Doctors!!  I have been a patient of Dr. Siegel since 2012!  I must say, I have experienced a Doctor that really care about his patients!  He is a to the point kind of doctor!!  He explain your diagnosis, and what can be done to eliminate the problem or future problems!!
I moved to another city...and tried a few doctors...NONE were equivalent to Dr Siegel!!! I travel to UAB highland, because I'm at ease knowing that Dr. Siegel not only cares about his patients...he take pride in his work!!  I thank God for Dr Siegel...he is one of a kind!!

name: Gene Keener
text: First I would like to commend Dr. Herrick Siegel for his expertise as a Orthopedic Oncologist. He is at the very top of his profession. However he needs to realize what a great disservice he is doing to his patients. I have carried my elderly mother-in-law for two appointments. On both occasions she was forced to wait for well over three(3) hours on each occasion before seeing Dr. Siegel. She was not alone. Please do not take this post as a reflection on the medical and surgical treatment Dr. Siegel provides. Thank you Dr. Siegal for taking care of the physical issues of my mother-in-law but please try to see from a patient standpoint of having to endure 3 1/2 hours of waiting.

resp.text: I feel badly about your message and apologize.  I have been trying the best I can to see all of my patients in a timely manner.  I will send your comments to my clinic administrator. I hope that we can make strides to improve this. Best wishes to you and your family.

name: Sandra Sevcech
text: When I saw him ,he was excellent and  caring. I highly recommend him.

name: Jeff Klein
text: Great experience

name: Lori Whatley
text: If I could give him no stars I would. Don't trust him to save your life if you have an infection in a joint. My dad is dead because of this doctor. He did absolutely NOTHING to treat my dad's hip infection for 13 days & then ignored dangerous blood test results and reports from the home health care nurse.

resp.text: For privacy purposes I will not inquire about your father in this venue; however I do not think that the "Google Reviews" is the appropriate place to make accusations.  With that being said, I have dedicated the past 17 years of my life to care for patients with highly complex orthopaedic problems, which includes total joint infections.  As you are aware, joint infections are highly morbid and debilitating diseases.  To the hundreds of patients I have successfully treated with total joint infections over the past 17 years, I thank them for trusting me with their care.  I take these reviews very seriously and would encourage you to contact me to discuss privately.  I hope this review does not discourage patients that truly need my help from seeing me.   Sincerely,  Herrick Siegel, MD

name: Victoria Wren
text: Very efficient check in process. No long waits. Dr. Rachel is awesome! He is very attentive and explains things well. I went expecting to be told I would need surgery. He explained all the treatment options and listened to my opinions. I wound up getting injections at my first visit without a lot of expensive testing required. Hopefully no surgery will be needed!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Jacqueline Hayward
text: The best Doctor you can have. He made sure that I was comfortable with all the outcomes. I really appreciate him an his nurses took good care of me. Dr. Rachel say Ms. Bradley we going to get through this. I love the honesty. Thank you so much 💓

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Alice Thompson
text: The receptionist greeted me, gave me instructions about checking in and was very pleasant. Not a long wait time. The nurse was friendly, listened carefully as I explained the nature of my visit. I believe she had gone over my chart.  A good feeling. When the doctor came in and greeted me that was a bit calming for me. He asked me the  reason for my visit. I explained it to him and he explained my options to resolve my issues and he let me determine what I thought was best for me at this time. He was very professional, honest and forthright.  An overall pleasant visit.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Marietta Jacobson
text: This was my first time seeing Dr. Rachel. He explained my problem with a picture, which helped a lot,  and a resolution. He was awesome. I had a feeling I was needing shots in my hands for my issue even before I went in , not that I am afraid of shots but in my hand didn’t sound fun. Dr. Rachel asked me questions about kids, grandkids anything to get my attention off the shots and it worked because before I knew it he was done! Great experience!! His PA (sorry I can’t remember her name) was amazing as well. Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Tracy Cooper
text:
I’m very happy to have chosen Dr. Rachel as my physician for carpal tunnel pain and numbness. Today I received an injection and both wrist with no pain as he so kindly takes your mind off what he’s doing during the injection. He also explained in detail regarding surgery, if needed in the future. He is prompt and I didn’t have to wait on him!  Thank you!  I would choose him all over again. My first injection lasted several years, which I am very thankful for!  What a great doctor and I completely trust him!
Thank you Dr. Rachel you are very appreciated!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Karen Marsal
text: Great experience.  Entire staff was friendly and very helpful.  Dr. Rachel explained the issue and suggested two treatment options.  Definitely put me at ease with getting cortisone injection......painless!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: Diana Pack
text: This was my second visit to see Dr Rachel. He is always pleasant and explains all the options before proceeding.  My wait was not longer than 15 minutes. Highly recommend him and his staff.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and recommendation!

name: Jamie Hancock
text: Knows his stuff. I thought my finger was a goner, but it's gonna be alright. 10/10 will see again.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We really appreciate you taking the time out of your day to share your experience with us!

name: nancy sheffield
text: He was very clear in explaining my situation and wanted to try and let me heal before talking surgery. I was pleased with time spent with me and answered all questions for me and my husband. I feel confident I will get better. I prefer trying other options before surgery always.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

text: The staff is always so friendly and helpful.  I’ve been seeing Dr Rachael for 4 years now and he is very informative and great to work with!

I would recommend him to my family if they lived here. Definitely will refer to any friends that may need his expertise in hands and wrists. He will do my surgery when I’m ready!!

name: Juli Listuon
text: Except for a wait, Dr. Rachel was very good.. he took all of the time that I needed to answer all of my questions. He had several ways to address my problem, and explained everyone of them. I was able to make my own decision about my treatment without any pressure.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

name: tracytracy gray gray
text: I love Dr Rachael. Today was my first visit and he made me feel so confident with my situation. I would highly recommend him. He is caring, nice, gentle and very informative. My sister is having problems similar to mine and I have no doubt in my mind who to send her to. Thanks Dr. Rachael. Your injections are not a nightmare like some I've had in the past from somebody else. I so wish that you could be my doctor for my other issues.

name: Peggy Proffitt
text: Dr. Rachel is a great hand specialist.  He knew exactly how to treat my pain. He's kind, easy to talk with and even humorous. And to top it off he feels if your treatment is successful then there's no need to come back. Now how rare is that!!

resp.text: Thank you for trusting TOG with your Orthopaedic needs.

name: Chris Walsh
text: Dr. Rachel made visiting the doctor for an injury more than pleasant. He is caring and attentive, answering all my questions. On top of all that he has a great sense of humor. I would recommend him to anyone needing orthopedic care.

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: Karen Ryer
text: Wonderful experience.  Explained diagnosis and treatment options in a clear and concise way.  Staff was wonderful to work with.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share those kind words. Our goal is to provide high quality care, so your feedback is appreciated.

name: terry651r
text: I enjoyed meeting and talking to Dr Rachel. I felt that we had a communication. Many "Doctors" seem to take the position that they are the "god-like" figure that I must obey. My experience is that they are just as lost as I am. The reality is that my wife and I have found solutions that the "doctors' did not. "First, do no harm". Ignoring the patient could be considered "doing harm". Dr. Rachel did the right thing. Others should follow.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

text: Dr Rachel took time we me to explain, in layman’s terms, my issues with my hands and all options for relief of pain.  He is a great Physian with a good personality. Also, the office staff was courteous and efficient.  Thank you.

name: Diane Krause
text: I went to see Dr. Rachel for carpal tunnel symptoms caused by my rheumatoid arthritis, and have now had a follow-up visit (and will probably see him again soon). He's one of those doctors that makes me wish I could go to him for everything. Not only is he experienced and knowledgeable, but he has a delightful demeanor, smiles when he speaks to you, communicates well, and listens well. His nurses and PA were friendly and helpful, and I found no complaints with my two visits so far. Dr. Rachel is part of a fairly large practice, but so far I've found everyone there to be helpful and efficient -- easy to get appointments, friendly staff, and no long waits.

resp.text: Diane, thank you so much for taking the time to offer your kind words and great review. We love our patients and sincerely appreciate you trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

text: Saw Dr Rachel for the first time today. This was the first time i was a patient at the Orthopaedic Group. I must say they are very efficient and have an awesome check in kiosk. He was kind and you could tell he really cares. He took his time and answered my questions and then he asked his own. He listened to everything and we came up with a treatment plan. The Orthopaedic Group has an awesome system and other offices could learn a LOT from them!! Thank you Dr Rachel!! Oh& his nurse was super nice also. She explained the exercises to me in great detail to make sure I understood everything. 5 ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ and 2 👍🏼 👍🏼!!

text: I experienced an injury to my hand/wrist. I had never seen Dr Rachel previously,  but read his AweSoMe reviews and thankfully he was available to perform the necessary surgery. 🙌🏻   I am so glad I was introduced to,  and referred to him!  My experience from “start to now” with Dr Rachel and his entire staff has been absolutely AmAzInG!!  I “did a number” splintered/jammed/broke my wrist!  A plate and screws were inserted.  I consider myself an active, energetic 63-year old,  and I am so thankful that I am “about there“  with my recovery ! 🙌🏻  If in need of a kind, caring, considerate, competent, thorough, hand doctor and staff,  ...you will not be disappointed in Dr. Rachel!   I will HiGhLy recommend him to family and friends!

This is John McNichol, not Judi McNichol.
