name: Amalyn Hamilton
text: I seriously love him! He is very knowledgeable.  I was diagnosed with a strain on my finger at the ER and he discovered what it truly was, a tendonitis.  He spent several minutes explaining how my hand's tendons and ligaments work and what exactly was wrong. He is very nice and has a wonderful hand for shots! I didn't feel any pain at all (even when I truly hate shots!).

resp.text: Amalyn, thank you for your kind words and great review! We sincerely appreciate you trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

name: Elizabeth Rehm
text: Very pleased with Dr. Rachel.  After a car wreck, I began having problems with my wrist.  He treated me very conservatively, which is exactly what is needed with a wrist injury.   After approximately nine months, he scoped my wrist and determined a ligament was unattached (something that was not visible on an MRI).   I'm just out of a cast and he is making sure I begin activities very slowly. Slow and steady wins the race!  Could not be happier with how Dr. Rachel has treated me and explained everything along the way.

resp.text: Elizabeth, thanks so much for taking the time to let us know about your experience with Dr. Rachel and our practice. We sincerely appreciate your review and thank you for trusting us with your orthopaedic care.

name: Eran Hanenkrat
text: Dr. Rachael is an awesome doctor with a great personality who listened to what I had to  say and answered all my questions, instead of, blowing me off or ignoring me like some doctors do. Within 5 minutes of being in the room, he had diagnosed me with tendonitis. He gave me three options with statistics. I chose the shots which I hate. He talked to me throughout the whole process trying to keep my mind off of the needles going in my hand. I was very impressed and that gave him many brownie points seeing that I have never had a doctor to that before!! I will definitely go back to see him if needed and will be referring his name to others!!

resp.text: Eran, thanks for the great review! We will pass along your kind words to Dr. Rachel.

name: Angie Jeppesen
text:
I have had many surgeries and experiences with doctors... and I have NEVER been treated that well before! From the moment the pre- op nurse came to get me until I was in recovery with the post-op nurse.... EVERYONE I encountered was very friendly, very careful about my allergies, and gave an overall sense that they CARED about me not as a number on a chart, but as a person. The amount of effort everyone put in to making me feel comfortable and not quite so anxious was a welcome surprise. The constant checking of what I was allergic to was also a tremendous shock! Not only were my allergies noted, but they were monitored very carefully... my voice mattered!! I cannot say enough good things about my experience yesterday. This was an amazing team and I am so thankful to ALL of you for the wonderful care you gave me. If only other doctors, nurses, hospitals, teams, could follow your ways of helping people... we would have a much better world in which to live. THANK YOU.... with all my heart, thank you! Best wishes to all of you!
With most sincere gratitude,
Angie Jeppesen

name: Cynthia Johnson
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible experience! Never in my life have I experienced such harsh treatment from a doctor! Even my first visit with him was horrible! As I attempted to explain my situation to Dr. Rachael he gazed at the wall as If I bored him and even when it seemed as if I had his attention he gave off a very nonchalant attitude. My second visit I left crying because he screamed at me so bad as if I was lying and made my injury up just to get paid under workers comp because he ordered a carpal tunnel test that came back positive be he explained to me the Dr. was wrong who performed the test and that half the people in the lobby would come back positive for carpal tunnel even though they don't have it. My thoughts was why would you test me for carpal tunnel which would include the middle finger, the pointer finger and the thumb only when I have clearly from day one told you my pinky finger and ring finger are numb and painful which would be cubital tunnel. So for his mistake I was scolded like a toddler. He then ordered an MRI which came back schowing a tear in my right wrist on my tfc disk and on top of that an ganglion cyst 16mm by 6 mm that has grown inside my inner wrist. When the results came back he canceled my visit and told his staff to inform me that I need to find another doctor to assist me...WOW IS ALL I CAN SAY!!! All that attitude and harsh treatment and didn't have the nerve to face me because you was wrong all along!!! Humble yourself Dr. Rachael!!!!!! PLEASE BEWARE!!!!

name: artgirl
text: Dr Rachel is by far the worse orthopedic surgeon that my husband had the misfortune to use..mike's ring finger was amputated october 2016....he didnot do a culture on the finger and so his hand became infected...so mike was forced by this so called doctor to spend time at the worse hospital in mobile...providence hospital..rachel told us that they had wonderful wound care specialists there and mike would be taken care of...he said that providence was closer and we would be able to see him more...he was wrong on all counts...i would call his office and talk to his nurse to try and get to see infectious disease and wound care because mike had seen neither..i told someone at their office that i was afraid that mike was going to die there...that ...is how bad it got...i was calling the nurse managers everday of the 10 days we were there...i even confronted dr rachel in the cast room and i told him it was his fault that mike was in the hospital because he could have done a culture and got him on antibiotics sooner...he just looked at me blankly and said ok...ok and then told me he heard me and i said i hope so...mike's amputated finger looks like a butt hole...that is what mike thinks...it is horrible looking...poorly done...and the bandaging of the wound caused another wound that we are still dealing with a year later...mike ended up having that pinkie amputated too...having a ray revision...all because of rachel's incompetence... we quit going to him in december 2016...i don't like him and i am a fair person but i donot trust him...if you need a hand surgeon go to Dr Burkett...he is supposely good...but please don't go to rachel...mike passed away on july 24...2018...i blame rachel as the main one of the doctors to cause his demise...the one to start mike's downward slide...i have gone to dr burkett...he is great...too bad mike didnt go to him instead of horrible rachel...

Friendly and welcoming,  professional and very effective! Clean and well equipped.  Great location.
I've had more physical therapy through the years than I care to share,  and this was one of the best.

name: bill bryce
text: My experience at the Orthopaedic Clinic has been top notch from my surgeon Dr. Dooley to Patrick, Jason, and Elizabeth who are highly trained, courteous, and professional Physical Therapists. I highly recommend the Orthopaedic Clinic .

name: Kathy Christiansen
text: The staff are friendly, efficient, and helpful. They keep me motivated, challenged and busy during the appointments. I have experienced remarkable weekly progress with their care and by following the homework pages provided.

name: Alexandra Hodges
text: Back in May I fell and broke the hook of hamate bone in my hand and also had an elbow fracture. We were new to Alabama and I did not know anything about anybody, but it was recommended to go here. I saw Dr. Hancy and he was awesome. He went above and beyond to help me, listened to me when I spoke and took me serious. He was very diligent in pursuing different methods of treatment, to try and bring me comfort and avoid surgery. Unfortunately, it appears that it’s still broken in my hand so I may end up with surgery after all. However it doesn’t bother me because I know I’m in very capable hands with Dr. Hancy. Also every time I had to get a cast put on or take it off the technicians were amazing. Overall for your orthopedic needs this is the place to go.

name: Terri McCard
text: Such very helpful and nice folks!  Wonderful service and Elizabeth is super great at spending time and attention with her patients,.  All of the therapists are so nice and go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable while doing your therapy,  I do highly recommend this service and The Orthopedic Clinic and most especially Dr. Ryan Palmer!

name: Cindy Spann
text: We have used the Orthopedic Clinic's PT department in the past and I knew when my daughter needed hip surgery and required PT, we would be using them again. They are incredibly professional and very friendly. Her PT, Jason, works so well with her explaining all of the whys behind each activity the do so she completely understands the significance. It is apparent he cares about all his patients. We love using them, and if PT in needed in the future - we will be back again!

name: Matt Burke
text: Great Customer Service.  Knowledgeable staff.  Solid care.

name: Jennifer Roach
text: My experience at The Orthopedic Clinic has always been excellent. The therapists and staff know exactly what to do to meet the needs of their patients. They are kind and helpful in every way. I have worked with all of them. They work together to ensure the patient stays on the same program. Whenever I've had questions, my therapist has time to answer it without giving me the idea he/she is in a hurry. I look forward to my sessions because I know I will be in a happy atmosphere working with people who have a positive attitude and an encouraging point of view.

name: Stephan Wood
text: I have been to 4 other physical therapy clinics in my life. This one is the best , They have always been courteous , the whole staff, and they have put alot of effort getting me back going. I would highly recommend them !

name: Linda Lawler
text: The Orthopedic Clinic Opelika Physical Therapy staff is AWESOME!! The facility is a great size!  From the moment I first walked in their door, everyone was so friendly and very welcoming. Patrick is the PT that has been working with me and he’s GREAT. He has been so encouraging (especially when I feel like I’m not progressing as fast as I would like). He is so knowledgeable with what I need to be doing in order to get back to where I was before my injury. I highly recommend this place!

name: Kyle Williams
text:
It has been a real pleasure to work with the folks here at the Orthopedic Clinic. Jason, Patrick and Phillip have taught me well, and under their excellent tutelage I have had the best recovery time possible after my knee surgery. Shout out as well to Michelle, who did an amazing job working with the insurance company and just getting me in the door. Top to bottom this has been a first-rate experience for me!

Looking for a place to get Orthopedic Physical Therapy? You will find no better place.

P.S.
The online exercise routine is a great motivational tool and record of accomplishment, also. I really liked that part, too!

name: Jewel Buchanan
text: Jason Shropshire & the entire physical therapy team of the Orthopaedic Clinic of Opelika -- including Phillip, Kasey, Patrick, Michelle & a host of other competent professionals! You guided, challenged & inspired me after Dr. Shiels performed my bilateral knee replacement surgery. At each encounter, you clearly listened to me; assessed, gently pushed & respected me & gave clear instructions for maintaining success once I went home. In 12 sessions, my physical prowess changed FROM barely walking while requiring assistance in most basic activities of my daily life TO regained abilities & confidence in standing, sitting, walking my dogs in the woods, rolling over in bed, going up & down stairs, & even safely driving! THANK YOU for meeting me face-to-face on each personal goal & sending me back into the world with confidence!

text: The worst service, We were billed incorrectly for future office visits that they knew we did not need. A simple office visit turned into a huge bill. They would not work with us, and simple got mad when we questioned the charges. I will drive three hours to see another doctor than to spend another dime at this doctor's office.

name: Julie Druhan
text: My therapist, Patrick, always took the time to listen to me and to provide information to help me make decisions about my care. He was always pleasant, professional and encouraging.

name: claudia stanley
text:
We were initially very impressed with the staff here.  Very friendly and concerned.  Our appointment with Dr. Wilson was one month ago.  He stated that he could not help my husband's issue and suggested that he see a local neurologist.  We appreciated his honesty.  Since our regular Parkinson's neurologist is in Atlanta, Dr. Wilson said that he would refer us to a neurologist and forward the records.  As of today's date, we haven't heard a word from anyone.....we would assume that if there was an issue with a new appointment, we would have been contacted by Dr. Wilson's office.  I am sure that The Orthopedic Clinic and Dr. Wilson are very good at what they do, but we would have appreciated at least having a follow up of some sort.  Was the referral ever made?  We have no idea since we don't know the name of the neurologist he was referring my husband to, so cannot call that office for confirmation.  I don't feel I should have to call Dr. Wilson's staff to make sure the referral was even made.  We will be seeking help ourselves elsewhere.

UPDATE AS OF OCTOBER 3, 2018  We finally received a letter from a neurologist in Auburn giving us an appointment date.  No phone calls, nothing.  Just a letter telling when to be there.  And by the way, the appointment is scheduled 11 MONTHS after our appointment with Dr. Wilson.  Seriously?  January of 2019.  That is just unacceptable.

name: Thomas V. O'Connor, III
text: Patrick and Jason do an outstanding job

name: morgan wallace
text: I am currently on Medicaid and live in Montgomery. After talking to medicaid and calling all the orthopedic doctor on their list in my area and getting rejected because of the insurance type I was at my wit's end and in extreme pain. The staff, especially the schedule lady I talked to first named Cortina, was so helpful! She was so sweet and caring. She was able to get me an appointment quickly with Dr Hancy. Dr Hancy is AMAZING! he's a hand specialist and seems to have done a fantastic job removing a rare glomus tumor from my finger, I'm still recovering. I had to drive 45-55min to this clinic but I didn't mind because the people were friendly, I didn't have to wait forever, and they seemed much more efficient that most doctors I've seen in Montgomery. I didn't feel discriminated against despite having Medicaid like another reviewer said. I would definitely recommend this place and feel lucky to have found it! And even luckier that they accepted my insurance!

name: Kimberly Bailey
text: Great practice. Everyone there made everything go smoothly. Everyone was very professinal & caring. I felt at ease in their care despite the pain from the fracture, pulled tendons & ligaments. I was petrified when I arrived & the pain was intense. Once I saw Luke Massey he put me at ease with his gentle nature. Joey & David were the greatest being gentle & making me smile despite everything. All of them were the greatest. Highly recommended if you find yourself in need :-) :-) :-)

name: Kate Craig
text: My mom waited three hours after her appointment time, before she actually saw a doctor.  He was putting on his coat to leave when he finally entered the room.  She had seen a doctor in California who had told her she could never work again, her shoulder was completely torn.  She was in so much pain she couldn't move.  This doctor, in all honesty, never even touched her shoulder.  He prescribed addictive opioids and told her to go back to work on Monday.  He didn't even examine her.  She requested a report from the office, so that she could give it to the next doctor she saw (she would never set foot in this office again) and it said all these things about how much movement, flexibility, etc. she had in her shoulder, as if he had examined her.  Again, he never even touched her.  Normally I would not write something like this, but I was appalled at how horribly these people would treat my lovely kind mother.  When my mom asked him about disability (again, she was in too much pain to move her arm, and my mom is *not* a complainer) he told her to go back to work, and if she couldn't do it because of the pain, to find a new job.  She pointed out that if she did that she would lose her health insurance, and he just shrugged.  So, that was our experience.  Because of this doctor, my mom moved again to be with my sister in Colorado, to find a doctor who actually cares about their patients.

name: Daryn Mccoy
text: The day after surgery I was in therapy,  14 days later I was back at work.  Surgery went great, with little to no pain. Stretching the muscles around the knee and building them up is key to quick recovery.  I'm continuing to exercise my legs to prevent having issues later.

text: Timely and pleasant staff. Dr Turki was punctual and attentive.  Didn't feel hurried in my appointment.  Answered all my questions and was thorough in helping me understand my issue.

name: Julie Lowery
text: This is the second time I have visited Dr. Turki. From the minute I walked in everyone is so nice. Also, it is amazing how quick they call me to come back to a room. I can barely sit down, before Dr. Turki comes in. He is so very nice and answers all of my questions. I have been to other Orthopedic Offices and the experiences were not like this group. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Matthew
text: Waited over 3 weeks for an appointment. Waited for over 2 hours. I asked reception and there was still atleast 5 other patients ahead of me. I left a little before 5 and they close at 5. Would not recommend.

resp.text: Hello, Matthew. We sincerely regret not meeting your expectations during your recent visit. Patient satisfaction is incredibly important to us and we strive to provide quality, timely care while giving each patient the necessary time they need. We appreciate your feedback and would like the opportunity to discuss your comments further. Please contact us at (334) 274-9000. Thank you.

name: Mark Martin
text: Good Doctors, Dr. Palmer, Dr. Turki  Dr. Davis, Dr. Barrington, The staff is great. All these Doctors have performed surgeries on me over the years. Excellent outcomes. I WOULD RECOMMEND ALABAMA ORTHOPEDIC TO ANYONE.

name: James Cook
text: Staff and Dr Barrington are great. Had both knees replaced within the last year. Would definitely recommend them.

I had a concern about a referral he had given me. He listened to the concern. I am very satisfied with this practice in general.

text: Great staff Great experience with Dr Walcott

name: Gary Myers
text: Professional, thorough and pleasant.

name: lathonya taylor
text: On a Friday I made an appointment, the appointment was scheduled for a Wednesday at 7 AM. Get there Wednesday at  six something  and the reception doesn't see an appointment for me at 7am, but she sees my name in the system,  I have never visited this office, this would've been my first time.  So the reception turns and ask do I want to make appointment,  I told her I did it last Friday for Wednesday at 7 o'clock for my knee. Will not be back again.

name: Karla Smith
text: Appointment was for 9AM, arrived at 8:45AM. I was never called to the window. After sitting for almost an hour, I asked if I needed to complete paperwork because my appointment was for 9:00. The receptionist apologizes and gives me the paperwork.  After about another 45 minutes,  I was called to the back. The nurse apologizes for the wait and tries to explain,  takes my vitals and then....the waiting game. One doctor was relaxing in a chair conversing with another employee. I have no clue where Dr. Davis was. After wasting 3 freaking hours with these unprofessional jerks, I cancelled my appointment,  got my copay refunded and left, never to return. PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS TIME HERE.

name: Yolanda Harriel
text: Overall wonderful

name: June Lockhart
text: Dr Micheal Davis treated me and performed surgery on me. If you are considering using him for your spine, I recommend you find another doctor. Go to UAB or SOS. I was under his care for 22 months. During the time of my care, I told him I was in excruciating pain. I was treated as if I was narcotic searching. I went to 9 doctors trying to get my MRI repeated after Dr Davis refused to repeat the test. Once the MRI was repeated and found results of severe damage to my spine on all levels, I had no choice but to return to Dr Davis because of the “Doctors are God” big boy club of Montgomery. My surgery that was supposed to only be 2 hours long was an 8 hour surgery. My bones were splintered in my lower back. I had told him prior to the surgery that because of a medical issue that he needed to treat me as if I had a bone infection. He did not. Post surgery he lied and said, “ no more MRI’s, the rods placed in your back are real metal not titanium.” *** Real metal rods were pulled from the market in the year 2000. My rods were put in in 2012. Not only that but he wrote my surgical note rather than dictation and the numbers on my rods are not legible. I also had foot drop and had a massive infection post operative. This was not a tiny infection, my temp peaked at 105.1, plus blood loss. There is much more but I have said enough, find another doctor for your own safety.

name: derrick ball
text: Personally I have had multiple visits and the wait time was always very brief (always under 15 minutes). The staff is always courteous and professional. Dr. Hussein Turki was very knowledgeable and attentive. He also took the time to explain all the parameters and patiently listened to and answered any questions I had. I would highly recommend this staff to anyone and everyone.

name: Jeff Naile
text:
Six months out of surgery, four months of physical therapy and I still cannot raise my arm higher than shoulder level without severe pain. Post OP MRI shows, and I quote, " There appears to be a full thickness defect along the anterior supraspinatus at the level of the critical zone/footplate."
Hartzog decides NOT to do any repair and releases me with an impairment rating of 4%.
Yes, you read that right, 4%.
They are more concerned with their relationship with workers comp insurance carriers than the well being of their patients.
I have an appointment with another orthopedic surgeon for a second opinion.
Very disappointed with the level of professionalism at Alabama Orthopedic Specialists.

name: Barb
text:
Dr. Davis staff is rude to patients. Waste of time waiting for hours for no help to resolve back issues. They could at least post a wait time or let people know something. Doctor's should stand by their appointment. I understand when they have an emergency which most nurses will let the customers know so they can choose to wait or reschedule. I will be finding another doctor. I have a job and my time is valuable.

Dr. Thornbury & Barringer have been great to work with & a good staff. Excellent compared to Dr. Davis.

name: Brook Martin
text: My fiancé's appointment was at 10:30AM with Dr. Davis. We signed in at 10:17AM. We were finally called in at 12:00PM. Jessie, the Nurse Practitioner came in at 12:08PM and left soon after. We finally saw Dr. Davis at 12:49PM. He came in and gave us his medical advice which was very unhelpful. I then asked if he would recommend another back doctor for a second opinion, and he refused to recommend anyone other than himself. As we were leaving, he proceeded to record his notes of our visit very loudly. The entire lobby could hear my fiancé's name, birth date, and all of the details of our visit. I will be reporting him for violating HIPAA Privacy laws, and we of course have cancelled all future appointments.

name: Mary Hill
text: This was one of the best experiences I have had at a Drs office. Staff was prompt and friendly. Dr. Davis was very nice,caring and attentive! His nurse and PA was very nice also. I have nothing negative to say!

name: Daniel carrazco
text: My appointment was at 2 o'clock. I was taken back to get x-rays and right after taken to a room. A hour and fifteen mins passes by and I ask one of the attendants if I was going to get seen and she said they were busy but be right with me. 3:40 rolls around and finally I just let them know I would ask my insurance to switch me to a different office and walk out.  Why make my appointment at 2 if the doctor isn't available?! So unprofessional! Almost two hours of waiting in a frigid room to not get seen?! Don't waste your time here. I was supposed to see Dr. Bennett by the way. Supposed to anyways, because I never saw him. Two hours of my life I'll never get back.

name: Glenn Forbes
text: Dr. Dexter Walcott and his team were very polite and helpful during and after my surgery, very pleased with the Alabama orthopedic specialist team.

name: Cyndi Grimes
text: There staff is terrible. They lost my medical records.

name: Ju Mc
text:
The Front of House Staff (Anitra/Pauline), Back of House Staff (Glen), and Dr. Walcott were absolutely amazing in my venture with them! Though I was there for over 2 hours past my initial appointment (through no fault of the AOS and its staff) they jumped through fiery hoops to get information they werent provided by working all of their channels. Once they received the information, they quickly (less than 5 minutes later) were able to get me seen, evaluated, and course of treatment implemented immediately.

I am absolutely grateful to all members of this staff for their assistance in this visit. I am even more grateful for this experience based on my recent visit with an organization bearing a similar name.

text: Long wait for doctor davis so come prepared but he is so worth it.  i was injured in a car wreck.  he surgically fixed my broken bones and they healed better than anyone expected.  dr davis is in my opinion a miracle worker.

name: Nicole Schlaudecker
text:
While I was seen, and received an injection and some prescriptions that I hope will help my issue, I spent the whole interaction feeling talked over and dismissed. I have been in intense pain for several days, and I have a high pain threshold, so when I'm hurting bad enough to seek help, it's serious. Xrays were taken but the dr did not discuss or even mention them to me, and when I mentioned workloads and lifting requirements I was given a throwaway answer and felt like I was being chastised. I have to be able to lift and carry 50 lbs, and take 25 up a ladder, regardless of what position I fill at work. The chronic nature of my issue was ignored.  I'm really not happy with the interaction on the whole, and it felt like it was a matter of "ticking boxes" to move on to the next person. I'm disappointed because this doctor was highly recommended to me, and I just expected better.

This was only slightly better than the last interaction I had with an Orthopaedic Group physician in which a similar issue was outright dismissed. The facility is nice and I was seen quickly. My prescriptions were also called in to the wrong pharmacy.

name: donna youngblood
text: I was having unbearable pain in my shoulder. I had been to a local ER on a Sunday and had been told to see an orthopedic. Monday was a holiday so I called that hospitals ortho office Tuesday morning. They could not see me until the following Monday. I couldn’t wait that long so I decided to try Andrews Sports Med. They got me into the office the next day.  I saw Dr. Rachel Henderson. She was excellent! They took X-rays and did an MRI that same day. The office called me will the MRI results later that same day! Then the next morning, the outpatient office called me to schedule a nerve block which I had the next day! All this happened within 3 days of calling their office! I have never had to see an orthopedic doc before nor have ever had a nerve block so I was nervous. I can’t say enough about everyone I encountered at the offices. If this happens again I will not be nervous. I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine. I’ll never go anywhere else.

name: William Somar
text: Reputable surgery center but I felt like a number. Visited at the recommendation of my physical therapist for a shoulder issue. When I got to the lobby I could tell this place is set up for mass production: there were check-in kiosks like at the airport and a bunch of people waiting. When I was called the first time, it was to pay. When I was called the second time, I was led to a second  waiting room with no explanation. The third time I was led to an x-ray room where I found out I was getting x-rays. Surprise! Eventually, I was led to an examination room. No vitals were taken. I waited. Eventually, a doctor - not the one I had the appointment with - showed up and immediately started to discuss scheduling surgery without examination. He discussed two procedures - the second one was news to me. When I inquired, he then tested my range of motion to confirm what he had seen in the tests. I expressed doubts about the second procedure and he left to get the originally-scheduled doctor. After nearly 30 minutes, they both came back. The second (scheduled) doctor explained why he recommended the second procedure as a preemptive option. He did a good job of explaining the surgery and recovery. He left and the first doctor took me to a scheduler. Everyone I interacted with was cordial and professional. I never saw my x-rays nor the MRI I had brought with me. I realize this place is good and they have a lot of people to get to. I known they are all fine surgeons. But still, I felt like one more item to check off on their to-do list. I still have unanswered  questions and it is ironic that being there for 2.5 hours and waiting most of the time, that I felt rushed when it came to the consultation. In summary, one of the best places for surgery, but don't expect "the personal touch."

resp.text: Thank you for your candid response. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients. Please feel free to call us at (205) 581-7128 if you would like to discuss.

name: UofAlabamaFan
text: Andrews Sports Medicine has THE BEST DOCTORS.  They are professional, but very personable and approachable.  You never feel like they are in a hurry to see you and get you out of the office.  My family and I have seen four different doctors at Andrews for a variety of problems, and each has had a very successful outcome.  They were surgical, had no problems at all, and are as good as new now.  I have also seen the non-surgical doctors and they are great as well.  They know what they are doing, and do it better than any other doctor.  One family member went to an orthopaedic doctor here in Tuscaloosa several times for a problem with her foot.  He had no idea what was wrong or how to treat her, but he did give her steroid injections a couple of times hoping that would help the problem - it didn't help.  We told her to go to Andrews!  She was able to get a new patient appointment within several days, the doctor saw her, knew exactly what the problem was, performed surgery, and she never had any problems with her foot again.  My family and I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center!

name: Kenneth Byrd
text:
If I could give it a negative star, I would. My wife went to Dr. Henderson for 10 out of 10 pain in her right foot, unable to sleep due to pain and inability to walk on it. After a two hour wait, she was seen, by Dr. Henderson, which was weird because appointments were available all day?  She was condescending, said pain is being caused by a callous on the bottom of her foot and that a pumice stone would take care of it. Then my wife proceeded to take off her other shoe and stated " why isn't the callous hurting this foot." Dr. then said, well, maybe it is a bunion. No X-ray, no nothing.

Fast forward two days later, we are getting an X-ray and getting a second opinion. Come to find out it is a severe impact injury with bone growth (Spur) and needs surgery to remove. Dr. we obtained a second opinion from stated he makes his living off of people coming to him from Andrews with misdiagnosis or lack of adequate care.

resp.text: We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients.

name: John Pointon
text: I chose Andrews for total hip replacement a year ago after research online and personal recommendations from prior patients. I couldn't be more satisfied. Yes, they're busy - not surprising considering their reputation - but they are much more efficient than most medical practices struggling with all the usual issues: insurance; billing; scheduling; non-user friendly EMR systems; HIPAA; etc. etc. All aspects of the process - scheduling, pre-op briefing, surgery and post-op care were first rate. The surgeon took time to explain pros/cons and expectations clearly, and answer questions. Back on my feet in no time. Follow up during the year has been excellent and the procedure was transformative. Recently hiked extensive distances over rough, hilly terrain with no discomfort - fantastic!

name: Tom Jenkyn
text:
As a disabled vet, I've had more than my fair share of orthopedic problems and surgeries. I had the good fortune to have Dr Steven R. Nichols perform multiple surgeries on my spine. Yes, they were different problems at different locations. He was recommended to me by friends in Sports Medicine at the University where I worked.

The first was a neck fusion, about 10 years ago. I was without pain, discharged, and went home the same day. Ten days after surgery I drove non-stop from Meridian, Mississippi to San Antonio, Texas. Last July he performed Lumbar Laminectomy surgery and removed the debris and spurs that were causing numbness in both legs and prohibited me from standing up straight. Again, discharged the same day, feeling returned to both legs and walking as the Good Lord intended.  There is not another Doctor on the planet I would allow to cut on my spine than Dr. Nichols.

His professionalism exemplifies what Andrews Sports Medicine stands for.  My family and I were always given  the same care and concern as the professional athletes they have become famous for treating. Simple logic dictates that if world class professional athletes with unlimited resources, who depend on their bodies performing at the level they do, seek out his services, it must be top notch. I have recommended him to friends and will continue to do so. If I didn't recommend him, it would be as though I didn't care about people who are an important part of my life.

name: Amy Armstrong
text: Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics Center is a very busy place but it is run like a well oiled machine. I’ve never had to sit in the waiting room more than a few short minutes. Several friends recommended Dr. Sam Goldstein to me and I wasn’t disappointed.  Dr. Goldstein listened to me patiently, had my MRI done on the spot and gave me results that same day. My injury is still healing but I’m getting there.

resp.text: Amy, thanks so much for the 5-star rating and for the kind words about Dr. Sam Goldstein.

text: I had the best experience anyone have with Dr. Cordover and Dr. McKeon. I originally went  in for my neck pinched nerve in neck. Dr. Cordover was on a mission. I am a bodybuilder/power lifter I have worked out since I was 13 yrs old. Dr. Cordover listened to my complaints and said that he would get us some answers. He noticed that I had atrophy in my hand and immediately contacted Dr. McKeon and they tag teamed me. I required surgery on my arm due to the muscle atrophy. Dr. Cordover wanted to wait and try a nerve block for my neck first. Long story short Dr. Cordover did neck surgery and I feel like a new man. Thanks to Dr. Cordover for giving me back my life. Superb staff and facilities. Will not use any one else. If I have to rate my experience on a 5 star scale I would give them twenty.

name: Brookelynne Mathews
text:
My husband had major foot /ankle surgery with Dr.Waldrop. He had all tendons repaired, his heel was moved over, the archilles tendon cut and lengthened!  It has been Over a year of being off work and unable to walk/stand or wear steel toe boots tk return to work . No matter how much we told this man that my husband IS in pain he did NOTHING except a few x-rays that NEVER show anything. It took an MRI and nerve test in the beginning BEFORE surgery to even find the problem. Not once did Dr. Waldrop order a MRI or nerve test!!  We had to insist on a referral to see a Pain management doctor because after two months he felt my husband didn't need pain meds.
The only thing  Dr. Waldrop would say is "Umm, I see". Never did any test after surgery except an X-ray, and we believe that's because he knows my husbands foot is worse after his surgery.
My husbands long term disability with his company has now been stopped due to Dr. Waldrops opinion that he can return to work WHEN HE CANNOT!!!
If you use this man make sure you get in writing from him BEFORE leaving his office if you can't return to work. !!

Cameron, we apologize for the long wait and inconvenience. We do our best to let all patients know to allow a minimum of two hours for their visit.

We are a high-volume practice. Our physicians are committed to spending adequate time with every patient to listen to their situation, properly diagnose their condition, discuss recommended forms of treatment, and address any additional questions and/or concerns they may have. Unfortunately, this sometimes results in long wait times.

name: Kayla Palmer
text: Dr Appell did a total knee replacement on my mother. He took really good care of her and she has had excellent results. His follow up program is awesome.

name: Bob Lyons
text:
Dr. Appell did a total left knee on me, in July, 2019, partly to correct previous medical mishaps. We found the entire experience pleasant and super satisfactory.First, a backgrounder...I am a recently retired RN/ Hospital Executive, having run everything from major medical Centers to community hospitals. My wife is likewise an RN, with clinical and Ph.D. Teaching experience. The location chosen for the surgery was the Grandview Medical Center.
The approach to the surgery prep is unusual...called ERAS.under this approach, you drink fluids up to two hours before surgery, you have spinal anesthesia, a mid thigh nerve block, and heavy conscious sedation. After the surgery, you return to your room for a delicious breakfast, and a lot of attention from a great staff. They even feed you a great lunch later in the day! You ambulated with a walker to the bathroom, then down the hall to the PT gym for some easy stair climbing. Pain was totally controlled. Then you go home! And start PT at the facility of your choice, amazing everyone how quickly you are recovering! Phenomenal medical staff, prep and operating room staff, and post op care.smiling, obviously enjoying their work, and exceeding every reasonable expectation. Even had the housekeeper supervisor check on my room cleanliness...and a great young attendant, studying to be an RN took me to my car.
Total world class experience, on both the “hotel” side and the professional staff.
Dr. Appell takes his time, explains your situation, options, and choices, to both the patient and spouse. Truly warn and professional!
Two weeks post op and I am walking with no assistive device, essentially pain free, going to pt three times a week on my own, minimal medicine needed for pain.

resp.text: Mr. Lyons -  we're glad you had such a wonderful experience with us and thank you for your kind review.  We are happy to pass along your comments to the team here and to Dr. Appell. Thank you, and have a fantastic day!

name: Jeffery Watson
text: Everyone was nice and courteous.

name: Snow
text: Saw Dr Savage, Jr. An amazing orthopedist. Instantly diagnosed my injury and got a great treatment plan. Very thorough. Takes as much time as you need answering questions. Beautiful, state of the art facility. Kind and caring staff from front to back.

name: J Stamba
text:
First time visit, before most people leave for work was a comforting experience. The check-in ladies treated me as their best friend.
My visit with Dr. Watterson was as efficient and gently performed. He took the time to get to know me and we prayed together. As a Christian who believes in the healing of God,  it made me feel quite safe with his treatment.
A few questions cancelled out numerous,  expensive,  unnecessary tests. I am very grateful to my regular Dr for referring me to this amazing place!

name: Faron Elam
text: Dr. G. Watterson  is one of the best doctors I’ve ever had. He is very caring and concerned about you. He ask you questions and answers all of yours. I think the world of him cause of his religiousness. I truly like the way he prays with you at the end of your visit. We need more doctors like him.

name: Allison Brown
text: Dr. Lauren Savage and his staff are wonderful.  I was a walk in patient and was treated with care and concern.  Dr. Savage really listens and takes time to address all your questions. text: This was my first visit. The check-in process and preliminary X-rays were very well organized. Dr. Lauren Savage had a pleasant demeanor and seemed to be thorough. I was pleased with his service.

text: First met Dr. Powell at Brookwood HS after my accident Feb 5th. Right off the bat he was so professional and personal at the same time. Really thinking about asking Dr. Powell if he'll fix my hip soon.

text: Been seeing Dr. Powell for almost a year. Giving a one star simply because of the long waiting process. If you are not in pain when you arrive you will be by the time they call you back. It seems they take certain insurance over certain people . Always a hour or longer wait in the lobby just for a simple check up.

name: Life in Camo Media, LLC
text: We have used Jackson Surgery Center three times in the last two years and every visit was a positive experience. The staff is friendly, the nurses are kind and knowledgeable about every procedure we were there for. The staff kept the family/driver informed the entire time the patient was there. The billing department was very easy to work with. I was able to get someone on the phone every time I called to get an insurance issue resolved. I would highly recommend Jackson Surgery Center to anyone that needs the type service they offer. I would give them 10 stars if it were possible.

name: Janice Howell
text: I had a great experience with my kind and caring nurses at my pre-surgery and recovery room time. I'd like to thank Cherri, Philanda and Cheryl personally for their great work. They made sure I was comfortable. As for as the surgery, the anesthesiologist and surgeon made sure I was knocked out for the 7 stitches although I didn't choose to be. Doctor was very late so he didn't want to waste any time. Maybe it was for the best but it was definitely not my choice.

name: Russell Marks
text: I was schedule for a colonoscopy on Mar 4th.  I was notified that I had to report to Surgery Center for Covid 19 test prior to having the procedure.  I called the doctor's office to see if I could have it done in Prattville area as I lived North of Prattville and was told to call Jackson Surgery Center, I did and they said that would be fine.  So I got the test and a letter saying  I had a negative result.  Then next day I get a call from JSC saying what I had was not good enough.  I was asked why I didn't get tested at JSC and explained that it was more convient to have it locally.  She stated that she lived south of Montgomery and came to work every day.  This really upset me!  Long story short I had already spent a whole afternoon getting tested and by the time she called had already begun the prep and had to cancel the procedure.  They need to get better people friendly personal    to contact patients and get there act together as far as what is acceptable covid testing.  I had this procedure at the JSC (prior to Covid) and it was a great experience just glad I didn't have contact with this person back then.

resp.text:
Mr. Marks, thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any confusion.  We will address this issue with our staff, the response you received certainly isn't our expectation. For future reference we have Important Covid Information on our website. You can find it here to review our policies.

https://www.jscal.com/blog/covid-19-information/
If you have further issues or questions please contact our director Missy Sallas 334-293-8484

name: Lisa Hudspeth
text: Better check to see what you owe or they will not do the operation.  They never told me the countless times I’ve spoken with them.  They were extremely hateful.  I asked what I needed and they said insurance card and license.  I drove 4.5 hours and they were going to cancel on me!

text: I just wanted to tell everyone how much I appreciated you all for being so gracious and concerned about the experience that I had with you all on October 21st. You made an unnerving and uncomfortable situation pleasant and endearing.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart. God bless each and everyone that works in that entire building.

resp.text: We thank you and are very happy to have had a positive impact on your experience.  Thank you for your kind words we will share this with our team.  With sincere appreciation. Take Care!

name: Jason York
text:
We were surprised by having to pay a second co-pay, one for the facility for the doctor. It was explained that this is because the doctor is not affiliated and it is an out patient surgery. However, the doctor's name is listed as part owner, not to mention the fact that we have had out patient surgeries in the past and not had separate co-pays. We will not be using this facility again, as it appears to be using any way possible to take money. We could have refused, but we already had the time scheduled off work, and it's hard to rearrange a surgery. At the very least, they could have let us know this in advance, instead of at the time of the surgery. We will be using the Baptist hospital system from now on.

Update: No, it wasn't really addressed, we were just told that we would have to pay again or reschedule. It's not about the money, it's about letting us know in advance that there are two separate co-pays, which was not done.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we apologize for any miscommunication. Our administrative team is aware of the concern and has addressed this with the patient.  If you need future assistance or have further questions about our billing policies, please contact our Administrator Mr. John Gray 334-293-8484

name: Barbara Sowell
text: Great experience! Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!

name: leo zemke
text: I am glad everyone else had such a fantastic experience at this place but they almost let my step son DIE!  He came in and was scheduled for exploratory surgery to fix SHODDY WORK DONE BY DR CHANDLER during a sinus polyp surgery and my step son began to pour blood from his Sphenopalatine Artery and the office was more worried about getting another three hundred dollar copay out of us than helping my son.  My wife had to scream for help in the office to get nurses and a doctor to get my son and help him.  We were treated shabbily during the whole ordeal.  My step son was bleeding to death and they did not even have the ability to  give him blood at this facility.  They almost killed him!  IT WAS HORRIBLE!  A HORRIBLE ORDEAL!!!!  I should post photos of all the blood.  The clinic manager was not friendly, everyone acted as if they did not know what was going on or what to do.  They had to take my son by ambulance over the the hospital and then the nightmare continued.  The ER doctor threw my son out of the hospital room that he was scheduled to be in.  It was like they tried to kill my son and then they were trying to sweep us under the carpet or out the door.  TO HIDE US AND THE HORRIBLE THINGS THEY DID AND THE WAY THEY ALMOST KILLED MY SON!!!   It was a nightmare!  They were going to give my son a blood transfusion in the ER and sweep us out the door.  MY WIFE HAD TO ENLIST THE HELP OF THE AMBULANCE DRIVERS Who could see that our son was in agony and practically DEAD AT THEIR HANDS!  The ambulance drivers GOD BLESS THEM talked the angry, crazy doctor into keeping our son and putting us in a room for the night.  This was the worst thing that has ever happened to our family.  I would not allow this clinic to operate on a PET COCKROACH if I had one!  PLEASE BEWARE!!!

resp.text: Dear Leo, we sincerely apologize for your experience with the Jackson Surgery Center.  We strive to provide the highest level of care equally to all of our patients.  We appreciate your feedback and are addressing the issues mentioned with our administrative team.  We promise to also forward your concerns to the Jackson Hospital Administration.  Our commitment to protecting patient privacy disallows us to discuss this in an open forum.  Please do not hesitate to contact our administrator John Gray at 334-293-8484

I had some questions about anesthesia, and they actually brought the anesthesiologist to me to answer my concerns. After care and instructions were good.

name: Carla LeFan
text:
I have been seeing Dr McKeon for the past five or six years at least. I have an a 63 year old female, who worked as a Pipefitter/Welder and with tiny parts as an industrial sewing mechanic, before retiring. I have always been a big diy person at home. I have suffered much pain from the tendons in in my joints. Mainly trigger fingers, where they lock down and become too painful to pull back up. Therefore, becoming useless for everyday life. Thankfully I was referred to Dr. McKeon.

My first encounter with this awesome lady was with my grandson, whose thumb kept dislocating. Dr. McKeon suggested we wait and allow growth  plates to grow properly, with hopes that he would outgrow it. He indeed has outgrown the condition. Although Dr. McKeon wasn’t the first to operate on these lock downs, she is my choice every time.

My last surgery was at the Birmingham Surgery Center, in Homewood. I often describe it, as much like going to a dental appointment. Dr. McKeon is always so friendly and full of joy. I’m positive she’s human and occasionally has a, not so good day, but you would never know it, when she appears. During surgery she and I had a question and answer session during the surgical procedure. Her coworkers seem to adore her also.

In conclusion, if you’re looking for a 5 star doctor for your hands, and awesome bedside manner is of importance to you, Dr. McKeon is your woman.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Dennis Williams
text: Highly recommend.  All the staff and DR were friendly, helpful, understanding, and on time. Dr McKeon is excellent. She operated on my right hand. It was barely useable before the operation and now it  is like I was 20n years old.  She is doing my left hand in about a week and I can't wait!  A wonderfully skillful DR.!

text: First off my apartment was at 1:00 I got checked in at 12:30 and I was on my way home at 1:05 the best staff and DR ive ever seen now on to the problem I was having I have Dupytrens Contarcure I have had it about 4 years but the last year it has grown into pain in the my palm of my hand on a scale of 1 to 10 about a 7 all the time DR McKeon checked it out and has scheduled a shot to brake it up she also gave ms a steroid shot in my hand when I woke up this morning my hand was not hurting hum starnge I went to work and worked 10 hr with no pain thank you so much DR McKeon.

resp.text: As a practice we always aim to provide the best care possible to patients. My team and I love to hear about folks that have had a positive experience. Thank you for your review!

name: kelley bland
text: I broke my wrist at the gym at 5am and went to the ER immediately after it happened. The orthopaedic surgeon that the ER doctor suggested never returned my calls, and still hasn't. I was in horrible pain and started researching orthopaedic surgeons in the area. Not only were Dr. McKeon's online reviews great, but she is part of the Andrews Sports Medicine group, which is known worldwide for treating professional athletes' injuries. I knew it was a longshot to get an appointment within a few days, but I called anyway. Her staff agreed to see me and told me to come to their office right then! I was prepared to wait hours once I got there since they worked me into the schedule, but I did not mind. Nope! I was called back, had xrays done and was meeting with Dr. McKeon within about 15 minutes. She was straightforward, went over my xrays and injury and said I'd require surgery. She explained the entire procedure and said she performed 100+ of this type surgery in a year. She got me scheduled for surgery THE next morning and made me feel so much better about the procedure. Surgery went great and I am recovering nicely. I cannot say enough great things about Dr. McKeon and her entire staff! They are prompt, knowledgeable, compassionate and caring...everyone I dealt with has been fantastic through this entire process.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Jonathan Herren
text: Dr McKeon did my right hand carpel tunnel surgery. I opted for just the local numbing agent instead of Anesthesia so I was able to talk and joke with her and her staff during the surgery. This also allowed me to quickly leave post opperation with none of the side effects that anesthesia leaves. I followed how she told me to keep it elevated and iced and only had to use one pain pill and was good to go after. She did a great job with a very small  insertion. All of the pain and numbness (yes I know how can you have pain and numbness at the same time but if you have carpel tunnel you understand) have gone away and no further issues. If fixing to have her fix the carpel tunnel in my left hand in a couple of weeks. My wife checked out her academic and medical records and was highly impressed. Not only is she a great surgeon but has an outstanding mind as well as a great sense of humor. You won’t get to see the sene of humor in the office as she is very professional but if opt for the local anesthetic  you’ll see how well her and her staff have fun. All of the nurses I spoke with also thought very highly of her which in and of itself tells you all you need to know.

name: Lydia Brooks
text: I went to Dr. McKeon about pain, numbness, and tingling in my left (dominant) hand and wrist. She diagnosed me with carpal tunnel which was confirmed by a nerve conduction test. At the first visit she wanted to give me a steroid injection but I told her because of health issues my Rheumatologist recommended I not take them. She said it was a local injection and not systemic but I reiterated I could not do it. She was very annoyed I would not get the injection. When I asked her what else I could do for the pain she said there was nothing else I could do for it. I did my own research and started getting massages, acupuncture, and did essential oils. I went back for a second visit and she was nicer and seemed a little more concerned about me since I was still in so much pain. At this point the pain had started shooting up my arm. She said to try hand therapy for a couple of weeks and if that didn't help we could discuss surgery. I did therapy which still did not improve my condition and went back to her for a third visit. This time Dr. McKeon flat out refused to discuss surgery. She dismissed all the notes the hand therapist had sent her and told me she felt like I had mild carpal tunnel and the pain I was having was caused by the hand brace I had been wearing and it was a completely different nerve causing the pain. The pain had not changed and the brace actually made it more tolerable. She told me to stop wearing the brace during the day and only wear it while I slept. She then gave me two doctors' names if I wanted a second opinion. At this point I was crying because I was so frustrated she was not willing to discuss surgery. I did go for a independent second opinion but not to the doctors she recommended. I have an anesthesiologist friend who recommended a hand orthopedist he worked with. I was able to get in to see that orthopedist the next day. This doctor was the total opposite of Dr. McKeon. He listened to me and had compassion for the pain I had been living with for months. He said I had tried all other measures and at this point surgery was the best option to get rid of the pain. I had carpal tunnel release surgery the next week. It is a very simple out patient surgery that takes about 15 minutes. When I woke up from the surgery 100% of the pain, numbness, and tingling was gone. I wished I had gone to the second doctor months before I did but was willing to give Dr. McKeon a chance when she said we could discuss surgery if I did the therapy and that didn't help.

text:
I refer to Dr. Craig as a medical detective. I had seen several physicians that could not figure out what was wrong with me. He discovered that I have a very rare neurological disorder. Without his knowledge and expertise, I could have suffered years with this with no help from the medical community.

My first couple of visits, I wasn’t sure how I felt about him. But I grew to really appreciate not only the physician, but the type of man he is. He tried his best to help me with a nerve block. That did not work for me. He could have done a series of them. But he did not. He knew that wasn’t what was best for me. He is not trying to line his wallet. Dr. Craig recommended another option that he doesn’t perform, nor does Southlake. Despite having to refer me, he is still looped in on the process and making sure I get the care I need. My case is proof, he is going to find what is wrong and do what is best for his patients.

name: James Rice
text:
Great Visit! After Explaining in Great Detail about Both of My Hips & Both Knees to be replaced over time going forward, Dr. Baird then addressed All Questions posed by Me and Both of My ER Contacts who I had asked to also be Present.

Dr. Baird Relieved All My Concerns about Timelines and then about various bits of surgical information given to me by Others over the past few years and then related How Those situations were different from My Case.

Dr. Baird was Extremely Positive, Most Sincere and Very Reassuring when He gave Me My Options to Consider. We also discussed Medications and the Need for Hard Work to Work Hard in Being Successful in Physical Therapy after each of the (4) Total Replacements under consideration to lesson recovery time and thus lessening the need for prolonged medication usages.

Surgical Decisions were made. His Staff is now beginning the Clearance Processes.

A Really Great Visit!!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and review!

text: I took my child to see Dr. Dugas because he is supposed to be great! We live several hours from Birmingham. I couldn’t have been more disappointed with our visit. name: Lita Peer
text: Dr. Dugas and his staff are hands down the best in the practice especially in the area. Possibly even the best in the world. Dr. Dugas has been my surgeon for 15 years! Over those 15 years we did 5 or 6 surgeries on my right leg, a couple of minor ones with one HUGE one at age 15. That one included breaking my leg to realign bones correctly and screws/plates to keep me together until it was time to remove them (which was almost 10 years later and in the middle of my career) but now I’m able to stand on my feet all day and do hair and makeup, which wouldn’t have been impossible without this fabulous staff including their PT program at Champion Sports Medicine! Dr. Dugas is the most respectful, honest, caring, understanding, comforting doctor I could ever imagine having. If I moved out of state and something with my leg needed to be looked at, I’d always travel back to them without hesitation! Thanks to everyone in that building for being amazing! 5 stars isn’t enough!

name: Stacey Chaney
text: We traveled to Birmingham from Maryland to see Dr. Dugas.  Our 17 year old son has a proximal tear to his ulnar collateral ligament.  I can’t emphasize strongly enough, Dr. Dugas is the epitome of doctoring done right.  He is a great listener and a very  compassionate person.  He understands not only the physical challenges of the surgery, he understands the mental and emotional journey.    Dr. Dugas will forever hold a special place in our hearts.  Great doctor, great man and we will/would recommend him in a heartbeat!

name: Bill Palmer
text:
I have been an avid hiker most of my life.  Suddenly, one day last May, my knee became so painful I could not walk.  Arthritis, due to an old injury from 40 years ago.  I met with Dr McGough at Andrews after checking out their website.  I liked the whole robotic-assist surgery idea.   He seemed very interested in what was going on in my leg from previous trama and listened intently.   He also was very good about answering any questions and walking me through what to expect.
It's only been two weeks since total knee replacement surgery,  but I am getting around well and the pain from surgery is now minimal.  It seems Dr McGough did a great job!    He seems to really care about helping his patients.  I am glad I got this done now, instead of waiting and I look forward to being able to hike again real soon.  I would definitely recommend Dr McGough to anyone with knee problems.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Amari Bradley
text: I was out of town visiting my boyfriend, and I thought I sprained a ligament in my knee. I went to a local urgent care center and received a referral to the Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center. Initially, my appointment was with Dr. Colberg, but I was quickly sent to Dr. McGough. After meeting with Dr. McGough and getting an MRI, I was informed that I had a bucket handle tear in my meniscus. From my first appointment I felt at ease. I’ve never had any major surgery (other than wisdom tooth extraction), so needless to say I was NERVOUS. Dr. McGough and his staff took excellent care of me. I’m super happy that I’m no longer wearing a brace and having to go to weekly physical therapy sessions. Thank you all for everything!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

Everyone at Andrews is so wonderful and caring.  And without a doubt,
Dr. McGough is one of the most caring physicians, as well being a "personal"  person, that I have ever had the pleasure of going to.
He always has time to listen, care, share and he wants to do what the patient feels is best for them.  He's always willing to try a remedy as opposed to suggesting surgery as the quick and easy means to an end.
When/ if he ever tells me I need surgery, I will know definitively that I really need it and it's the only alternative to making me truly better.

name: J&H Johnston
text: Extremely horrible doctor. The staff and nurses were good just Dr. Busbee is rude and doesn’t care about his patients whatsoever. I’ve never put up a review before but I felt people needed to know before going to see him. I took my mentally handicapped sister to see him because her arthritis in her knee had gotten so bad it was swollen as big as a small melon and her primary care doctor said she needed to see an orthopedic so we contacted his office. Well she was in so much pain she couldn’t walk and has always been completely healthy with no problems at all so she didn’t know how to process pain at any amount especially at the amount she was experiencing. Well the “good doctor” didn’t care to help her at all and had no sympathy for her screeming every time they touched her knee. Even the nurse went and asked him to give her something to help ease the pain and he gave her a NSAID  which she had already been on with no help! Then he put a brace on her knee so tight that it was purple and hurting even more. He sent her home with absolutely nothing to soothe her pain or help to give any relief after we explained how she hasn’t even been able to sleep and even used the bathroom on herself bc she didn’t want to walk bc of the pain, I’m sure I will be taking her back to the emergency room for some kind of help with her pain! He even admitted it had become real bad on her knee and acknowledged the swelling but did nothing. It’s hard to find a doctor to put themselves in other peoples shoes and really want to help. If it’s not them that’s hurting then they don’t care but I haven’t ever had quite an experience like this with a doctor before and hope in the future he’ll learn to develope a care for his patients especially the ones who are mentally special like my sister because god don’t like ugly and I hope no one else has to go through nothing like this with someone they love and someone who gets paid top dollar to give proper care and not do anything.

resp.text: Hi Noah,  we are sorry we did not meet your expectations. We would like to speak with you about it if you would like. Please call our office manager at (251) 450-2766 to discuss your specific issues.

name: Diane Pirtle
text:
We moved from Ga to Huntsville. During the move I started having severe lower back pain going down my leg also. I couldn’t sit or lie down without making it worse. My primary doctor order a MRI and then sent me to see Dr Larry Parker. He immediately saw the injury to my lower spine and asked would I like to fix it. Two days later I had my surgery and I got instant relief. I had a few bad days with pain but it was worth it.   Two months later I’m a hundred percent better. Dr Parker, PA Michael Jordan and staff are amazing. Highly recommend them. It is amazing to be feeling normal again. Thanks a million. It’s never to late to get healed because I’m 70 years old and suffered for years.
Love y’all and Thanks again
Sylvia Pirtle

name: karihal05
text:
I was taken back for my xrays and visit promptly and treated safely but respectfully during the unfortunate Covid period.
I am very happy with my successful fusion that was performed by Dr. Larry Parker, the decrease in my pain level, and the activities that I am already able to perform after 7 weeks.  I have not required any pain medications since approximately 3-4 weeks after my surgery.
I expect to be able to return to riding my horses, hiking and everything I was previously able to do.  This was the 2nd back surgery I had (unrelated) and both were successful.  I would use Dr. Parker and his team in the future if needed, but hopefully I will not et hurt again.

name: jasper blow
text:
Dr Parker and his staff always treat folks in a caring professional manner.
Can’t say enough about the great care from them

name: Clare Rutledge
text: I had lower back surgery December 5th with Dr Parker, I'm not trying to trash Dr parkers name but my back is 2× worse then it was when I went in. Every appointment I have had since I have requested to talk with Dr parker concerning the issues I'm having, not one time has Dr parker seen me! He keeps sending in his water boy "PA" who seems to only care about medication i was on leading up to the surgery and told me the pain is due to my brains opiate reseptors are some how affecting my pain tolerance.... I can barely walk right now and its been 8 months. I lost my insurance because I can't go back to work. I'm in a desperate situation and today I was told because I didn't have $150 to pay them to be seen, they wouldn't see me. There are a few things that threw up red flags when first talking to the Dr and high in sight I should of never allowed them to do surgery on me! My quality of life has deminished and I can't even hold my 2 year old son. It seems that Dr parker isn't a stand up person and had no reguard for his patients. I'm going to speak with a lawyer because a Dr who won't even attempt to help out his patient who has been affected by a surgery he preformed should not be practicing medicine!!. I plan on taking this to the medical board, ethics committee or any news outlet that will listen. DO NOT ALLOW DR PARKER TO PREFORM SURGERY ON YOU IF THERE IS A CHANCE IT MAY AFFECT YOUR LIFE FINANCIALLY  IN THE FUTURE BECAUSE DR PARKER ONLY WANTS YOUR MONEY!!  my name is Ryan Hunter and if you have any questions about this review feel free to contact me and i will  further explain this. Always seek a second opinion, I didn't and now I'm paying dearly for it! I'm also reporting him to the BBB and will sit outside his office to let people know just what's gonna happen if times get tough and you need the Dr to fix what he has messed up!! Thanks for nothing Dr Parker! You have completely screwed me over and I promise on everything I love you haven't heard the last of me! On a good note, the young lady at the front right desk in the lobby was very sweet and carring and if not for her I'm sure the police would be escorting me to jail for flipping out on his staff!! Sorry if this message offends some people, if you were in my situation I'm sure you would understand. Ty

name: James West
text: Dr. Parker is one of those doctors that want to help his patients get back to what they want to do. He's not surgery happy nor does he see people just to pad his numbers. He really cares and he tells you how it is. He's one of the great ones. Thank you Doc.

name: brett davis
text:
In short ..well not so short but detailed and worth the read if you have chronic pain !..I had a on job accident 22 years ago in 1997..Dr.larry Parker fixed me up good ! Spinal fusion L4S1 back then. A Dr.Walker fixed a crushed wrist ...these guys after idk a year got me fixed up. In 2007 while ironworking  I did more damage..I bit the bullet from '07 til 2013-14 when my my right leg started going out ..i hadn't had insurance in years ..i went on disability, i lined the Dr. Visits and MRIs & xrays together for Dr.Parker to view before I drove 3 hours to see him . I had moved... As long as this man Dr. Larry Parker is breathing..hell be the only orthopedic that ever cuts on me or does anything he can do to me or friends if i can help it ! IN 4-13-2019 was the day for my surgery (i had developed spinal stenosis) I went in & under ) around 12 PM.  I awoke 3:30 with meds and assistant yes but I was up and walking!pain free .well pain from surgery expected ...but  almost pain free and my legs & neurological nerve endings in my legs was gone .after 12 years of chronic pain..3 with neurological in legs(bad enough it interfered with life )..within hours of being  there .. He fixed me again ! Speed up .Monday hardware installed in the back spine for support during the fusion time. So less than 12 hours of hardware installation ..I was signing paperwork to go Home this wasnt nothing new and I knew the drill..Michael Jordan did superb job as well as well as my Sunday Nurse ..you know who you are ..thank you ❤. I'm about 9-10 weeks out and I'm thinking the hardware is going to have to come out ...I'm feeling irritation to those muscles  but at least I'm pretty sure that's this problem.but you need to learn where the pain is coming from ..often after the need for the hardware is no longer needed..some folks it doesn't bother ..some I bet dont know it can be removed...(think of where and how your irritation is...you gotta help the Dr. ..talk to him ..he needs to know what you know ) chronic pain ?Take Notes !.some like me know..and while I realize its definitely needed!! But has it time ..I still have some aches and some pain on some days ..I'm a broken up 48 year old ironworker...I'm lucky to be alive thanks to God and Dr.larry Parker ! Hands down if your looking for a second opinion..look no more !this is coming from a man that's abused his body for about 30 years honestly! He has a good team always ! Mr. Michael Jordan does a good job..hes got a good teacher ..him and Parker are a little different but he wouldn't  be there if he wasn't...Parker wouldn't allow it ...His office Staff..has always been good ! Mrs.Mina .Great lady ! And another and I'm sorry I forgot your name ....Look nobody paid me to say any of this !this Dr. And his team 1. 22 years ago got me walking  and gave my life Back !at 27..at 48 they did it again! Honest to God if your searching for a spinal/orthopedic..look no more . Dr.Larry Parker is a Life changer folks and I wholeheartedly mean this ! This last time I was at the end of my ropes ..but 10 weeks later ..I'm smiling again ..yes I have some pain but hey..I was messed up . Dr. Larry Parker & Staff ! Thank you for everything  and i love and pray for you All ! P.S if you want good results ...DO WHAT THEY TELL YOU TO ..BLT...you'll know
..bending, lifting, toting...dont have it done if your not in a position to do as directed.. i promise it works !i stayed on a level 11-12 on a scale of 1-10 pain level...yep i still gotta take it easy..but stay active when your suppose to !..afterward..dont lay around ..be as active as possible..you spine needs it ..your body needs it. Do right for at least 10 weeks ! The other ..if you do feel an irritation...most likely its gonna be that hardware..6 months medically it can come out ..most insurance legally want 1 year.(Chexk that info ..things change)I'm about to call and leave him a note ..folks i cant Express enough how much this man has changed my life 2..twice ..i wont abuse it again! I'm for ever grateful! ✌ Peace, Love & Hope ! Brett Davis  7-1-2019 ! Still healing .

text: This place is ran like a well-oil machine.   All Dr offices need to take note of how to process patients to get in front of Dr.   When Dr Cantrell arrived in my room to see me he was prepared and had done his research on past MRI from couple of years ago.  Great experience!

name: Cassidy
text: I have never witnessed such poor bedside manner or attitude from a physician. After pressing all over my SO's injured knee (suspected by PCP to be an MCL tear) Dr. Cantrell complained that the patient wasn't reactive enough to pain, I guess because he wasn't yelling or whining but instead light headed and near passing out. Cantrell began to give his opinion but became aware the patient wasn't focused and rudely snapped "are you even here with me? Are you awake?" And sort of got in the patient's face. Then he said hatefully that he'll order a test and see him after that before storming out and taking his bruised ego with him. SO elected to not proceed with the MRI and to reschedule with Sportsmed instead. Absolutely appalling. Would not recommend this doctor to anyone, especially to anyone that reacts to pain by shutting down or nearly passing out.

name: Margaret Dwyer
text: Absolutely fabulous experience every time. Polite, kind, caring and professional individual who takes the time to answer your questions.  I can't say enough good things about him or his staff.  They are all wonderful. This was my 5th different surgery with him and his team. They never disappoint.

name: Tiana Lady_Pickle
text: As soon as I stepped into the office at The Orthopedic Center, I was a bit nervous because I was a new patient and was anxious about my visit, but once I approached the kiosk, input my information, and sat and waited to be seen, I started to feel a bit more at ease. From the encounter with Beth who asked detailed questions, to getting my x-rays by the technician, I begin to feel more and more like I was in good hands. Once Dr. Michael Cantrell stepped in, his presence was calming, sincere, and relaxing. He was so, so kind and soft spoken and really took quality time with me. Explaining the next course of action with the most patient sincerity meant a lot to me and they even provided a "thank you" gift for being a new patient with them. Not to mention, I was listening to 88.1 as I approached TOC and there was an ad for Dr. Michael Cantrell and I took that as a sign that I was in good hands, and I believed it! Thank you for your care!

name: Howard Clink
text: Great staff. Easy check in and no long wait times. Dr. Cantrell did my surgery and things are coming along great!

name: Bill Mooney
text: Dr. Cantrell was very professional and very personable. He made me feel very comfortable and relaxed. He is extremely knowledgeable and answered all questions I had. TOC should be very proud that they have a great doctor like Dr Cantrell.

name: Ian Briggs
text:
I met Dr Cantrell for a second opinion (misdiagnosed by another Dr in Madison) to look at a very painful lump on my knee.  I was seen by his staff before Dr Cantrell met me and they were as I would expect i.e. kindly and considerate. Dr Cantrell was the same and after carefully examining my knee, said that it was a lump that needed to be removed and not an inflamed tendon for which I had recently been misdiagnosed. He was unable to say if it was cancerous without a surgical biopsy and booked me for surgery the following week.

I found the surgical center staff to be very professional, with little to no delay.  The surgery was a keyhole procedure and was very quick, which removed a non cancerous tissue lump. The mass was sitting on a nerve and was the reason for the extreme discomfort. I was discharged and able to walk when i got home. Recovery was quick and painless over the next two weeks.

The follow up experiences with Dr Cantrell and his staff were always timely, polite and kind.  Dr Cantrell's excellent bedside manner is clearly followed by all of his staff.

In summary: I found Dr Cantrell and his staff to be kind, considerate and most importantly caring. The surgery was a complete success and has removed a problem that I had put up with for years. Highly recommended in my opinion.

name: Sheril Keeler
text: Very professional, on time and attentive.

name: Rebecca Moon
text: The office staff is fantastic.  Check in was a breeze.  The nursing staff super friendly.  And, doctor and staff extremely punctual and professional.

name: Jessica
text: He had a peaceful demeanor until I opposed what he planned for my shoulder. He didn't ask or care why I opposed and he became withdrawn and combative. He's the perfect doctor for people who have no history of allergic reactions/complications from medical procedures and won't question anything he says. I walked out during the appointment because it became awkward and uncomfortable. Sorry I hurt his ego with my silly patient concerns.

text:
Dr. Cantrell took time to explain options other than surgery allowing me to make the decision. It was a bit of a wait to schedule surgery with Dr. Cantrell but I feel he has done a excellent job on my ACL replacement and Meniscus repair. I am three months out and healing / recovering as scheduled. Office wait times can be a bit long however quality of work and full recovery is what is most important.
Updated: Nine months post surgery, leg strength is 100%, feeling great and received approval for full athletic activity with ACL brace for 1 year. You must work your physical therapy to see these results!

name: Anna DeSchepper
text:
I have NEVER been treated so bad by a doctor or office staff in my life! Start with the desk staff, they rolled their eyes, was blatantly annoyed I asked any question, and sighed heavily if they had to move.  They forced me to front $150 even tho I had already met my deductible and tried to force me to pay for my brace out of pocket (another $150 and twice the price as online.)
When I didn’t improve, I had to BEG the nurse for an MRI. When they scheduled it, they booked for BioImaging (that this doctor partially owns.) This facility was hundreds of dollars more expensive for me and my “wonderful” insurance and would have delayed care by two days (during which they said to continue therapy without knowing what it said.) I had to physically go to the office and demand the facility he change. Multiple office staff flat out refused to change it. It wasn’t until I made it known that I knew it was illegal for them to do this before they would change it.
Then my follow up was a totally of 2.5 minutes in which the doctor ignored my concerns for lack of progress, insinuated I was a drug addict (cause I asked for something strong than Tylenol) and told me to take meds that cause SEVERE stomach pain and vomiting even tho in have extensive GI problems. I have never been so belittle and humiliated by anyone, let alone a medical professional and I’m a nurse!

name: Beth Bradford
text: Dr. Cantrell is the best doctor!!!!  Very good bed side manner, shows caring and concern for his patients and takes the time to address any concerns or questions.  Wish there were more doctors like him.

name: Nicole Lewis
text: Dr Cantrell is the most dismissive arrogant doctor I have ever encountered. He immediately walked in the room and said there is nothing I can do for you. I have a bad knee with a meniscus tear. Since my last appointment I had developed swelling and fluid accumulation. Before even accessing my knee or greeting me he tells me what he cannot do. I will never return and under the care of another doctor. If you don't like people find something else to do. This is not volunteer work. His staff was great.

text: Was by far the worst experience I ever had. I was referred by my doctor to Dr. Cantrell so he could run a scope down my knee. After a long wait,  I was finally called back. Dr. Cantrell was probably in the room with me no more then 3 minutes where I  explained to him the problem I been having and what Dr. Su said.   He told me the scope wad probably not needed, he couldn't do anything for me and to  just live my best life with the pain and deal with it and then he walked out. I would not recommend this doctor to ANYONE!
